review_content: Oh yeaaah ! C'est ça qu'on veux ! Développons un peu quand même : Robe orangée, presque ambrée, avec une fine mousse blanche. Au nez et en bouche, on retrouve les mêmes notes de pin et de caramel, avant une finale particulièrement amère, qui dure, qui dure... pour notre grand plaisir ! Titrant à 8,2°, vous l'aurez compris, c'est une bière qui envoie du lourd.
Schöne Kupferfarbe, Schaum passt, ordentliche Perlung. In der Nase Hopfen, im Trunk malzig, Karamell, alkoholisch, hinten bitter, okay.

Liquide orangé transparent avec mousse courte et persistante. Nez sucré typique DIPA. En bouche, c'est une attaque très légèrement fruité et miel d'acacias qui débouche sur une grosse amertume résineuse. DIPA on ne peut plus classique mais justement c'est ça qui est difficile à trouver !!!

Douche IPA trouvée chez Noz à vil prix, pas de notes d'agrumes mais une bière agréable à boire qui tire sur l'ambrée, une fine mousse qui reste présente, une amertume qui reste présente également, sympa 🙂
Bière 33 cl trouvée chez Noz.nez riche et sucré, façon ambrée plus que IPA. Bouche ronde sur les fruits cuits. Belle amertume en fin de bouche. Une double IPA plutôt réussie. (M)

Aroma: Fruity hops with citrus and caramel. 
Flavour: Fruity dry bitter with fruity and malty sweetness and notes of grapefruit. Aftertaste is fruity bitter. 
Colour: Orange with an offwhite head. 2/6-2018
Oldskulowa ipa z wyraźna goryczka. Szlachetny smak, ziołowość przyjemna. Goryczka wysoka, akcenty słodowe lekko cytrusowe ale przede wszystkim żywiczna goryczka.

Bière cuivré avec petite mousse persistante.
Odeurs de fruit tropical, 
Bouche sur l'agrume, le tropical, bonne dose d'amertume avec bonne longueur en bouche.
Carbonatation excellente.
Une très bonne bière.

This is a really good beer.  Just the right amount of hops to give it a good flavor without being overly bitter.  Good solid malt backbone to give it a nice malt taste.  I really like this beer and the ABV is not to high for a DIPA.

My first impression is that this tastes much drier than the label's 72 IBU would suggest. The hops are right up front and fresh without feeling overly stringent, balanced by a nice, straightforward malt character. Medium mouthful, moderately fine carbonation, and a hint of bourbon in the finish. Delicious.
Tap a tap Richtar Jakub. Amber color with off-white head. Aroma of caramel, citrus hops. Taste, caramelly malty base followed by nice hoppy bitterness. Long hoppy bitter finish. Nice.
V richtarovi. Vona krasna medova chmelova. Medova farba husta pena. Chut silna alkoholova horkasta medova. Na konci dlho ostava.

35,5cl bottle from Géant Casino hypermarket in Bazeilles in France.
F: medium, tan, good retention.
C: orange gold, light hazy.
A: orange, pine, mellow tropical fruits, bit caramel, tomato, apricot, grapefruits, dried fruits, bit onion effect. 
T: full malty base, mellow orange, pine resin, peach, nice hoppy feeling, spicy, dry on the palate, medium carbonation, very nice for the style, fully enjoyed.
Bitter, strong yet very balanced, if that makes sense at all. It’s quite rare to come accross these in my place but they are worth looking for. Definitely one of my favorite IPAs.

12-ounce bottle pours pale gold with a 1.5" beige head and lacing. Aroma: faint brown sugar. Flavor: brown sugar, caramel, honey, longanberry, rambutan, grapefruit, orange, bread, biscuit. Mouthfeel: medium- to full-bodied with a creamy yet slick finish.

Oh yeaaah ! C'est ça qu'on veux ! Développons un peu quand même : Robe orangée, presque ambrée, avec une fine mousse blanche. Au nez et en bouche, on retrouve les mêmes notes de pin et de caramel, avant une finale particulièrement amère, qui dure,…
Schöne Kupferfarbe, Schaum passt, ordentliche Perlung. In der Nase Hopfen, im Trunk malzig, Karamell, alkoholisch, hinten bitter, okay.

Liquide orangé transparent avec mousse courte et persistante. Nez sucré typique DIPA. En bouche, c'est une attaque très légèrement fruité et miel d'acacias qui débouche sur une grosse amertume résineuse. DIPA on ne peut plus classique mais justement c'est…

Douche IPA trouvée chez Noz à vil prix, pas de notes d'agrumes mais une bière agréable à boire qui tire sur l'ambrée, une fine mousse qui reste présente, une amertume qui reste présente également, sympa 🙂
Bière 33 cl trouvée chez Noz.nez riche et sucré, façon ambrée plus que IPA. Bouche ronde sur les fruits cuits. Belle amertume en fin de bouche. Une double IPA plutôt réussie. (M)
Aroma: Fruity hops with citrus and caramel. Flavour: Fruity dry bitter with fruity and malty sweetness and notes of grapefruit. Aftertaste is fruity bitter.…
Oldskulowa ipa z wyraźna goryczka. Szlachetny smak, ziołowość przyjemna. Goryczka wysoka, akcenty słodowe lekko cytrusowe ale przede wszystkim żywiczna goryczka.
Bière cuivré avec petite mousse persistante. Odeurs de fruit tropical, Bouche sur l'agrume, le tropical, bonne dose d'amertume avec bonne longueur en…

This is a really good beer.  Just the right amount of hops to give it a good flavor without being overly bitter.  Good solid malt backbone to give it a nice malt taste.  I really like this beer and the ABV is not to high for a DIPA.

My first impression is that this tastes much drier than the label's 72 IBU would suggest. The hops are right up front and fresh without feeling overly stringent, balanced by a nice, straightforward malt character. Medium mouthful, moderately fine carbonation,…
Tap a tap Richtar Jakub. Amber color with off-white head. Aroma of caramel, citrus hops. Taste, caramelly malty base followed by nice hoppy bitterness. Long hoppy bitter finish. Nice.
V richtarovi. Vona krasna medova chmelova. Medova farba husta pena. Chut silna alkoholova horkasta medova. Na konci dlho ostava.
35,5cl bottle from Géant Casino hypermarket in Bazeilles in France. F: medium, tan, good retention. C: orange gold, light hazy.…
Bitter, strong yet very balanced, if that makes sense at all. It’s quite rare to come accross these in my place but they are worth looking for. Definitely one of my favorite IPAs.

12-ounce bottle pours pale gold with a 1.5" beige head and lacing. Aroma: faint brown sugar. Flavor: brown sugar, caramel, honey, longanberry, rambutan, grapefruit, orange, bread, biscuit. Mouthfeel: medium- to full-bodied with a creamy yet slick finish.
Bottle. Big foamy head on a classic copper ipa. Badass grapefruit, citrus pine, biscuit aroma. Much more sappy, honey, malt forward ipa than bitter. Alright but nothing crazy.
Smell of hops, spruce. Clear amber colour, high off-white head. Aroma of hops, spruce, a faint of honey. Regular IIPA with pure flavours. Bitter. Medium carbon, slightly oily texture.

On tap at Nobell.
Okay IIPA but nothing really that would bring me down to my knees.

Bottle from craft Mecca, Morrisons of Aldershot. Earthy resin aroma
 Golden amber. Thin translucent white head. Medium-heavy bitter. Resinous and malty. Old school. Light-medium bodied. Slick. Average-fizzy carbonation. Long astringent finish. May well have faded due to having been on a supermarket shelf and then in a locker at work for a few months - no fruit juice here, all hop juice. But not too boozy.
Restrained aroma in a golden amber pour.  Hop forward balance with a boozy fruit body and light bitter finish.  Dangerously delicious.
Bottle. Medena farba, biela pena. Vona sladova, kramel, med, ovocie. Chut sladova, karamel, ovocie, alkohol. Plne telo, horka dochut.
Bursztynowe klarowne piwo z niezłą pianą. Aromat chmielu i słodu. W smaku lekko wytrawne, mało chmielu, niestety daje o sobie znać znaczne utlenienie.
Clear golden appearance with thin head. Aroma and flavour have sweet caramel malts and ripe yellow fruits like honeydew melon. A good old DIPA.

Bottle. Pours rusty amber with an off white head. Aroma is malty cereal and caramel, orange peel, and pine, maybe some stone fruit. Sweet, verging on syrupy in the mouth, yet still fairly refreshing. Taste is caramel, dark cereal, hint of licorice, orange peel, marmalade and apricot. Actually not too bad, don’t normally dig this style of beer unless it’s under 7.5%

[12oz bottle from Total Wines, Brea, CA.] An amber pour with a thin white head; innocent toffee aroma; immediate hit of hops in teh mouth though, quite fresh and leafy with some tea and a sweet caramel malt body; then a lingering peppery bitter finish. Not as extreme as the marketing would have you believe.
bottle at home which bought from a UK supermarket. The beer was dark in colour. It was a malty beer might just been me not liking it

09.09.2019. 0,355 Bottle. Systembolaget Strömstad, Oslovägen 56. Golden colour with white head. Strong beer with lots of aromas an flavours. Sharp fresh hops with lemon, tropical fruits and a soft pine touch. Pineapple as well. Flavours are the same. Soft bitter aftertaste. Good one!

Achetée à Casino supermarché (Villedieu-les-Poêles)
Nez de fruits tropicaux et de pin.
Robe orange et trouble.
Fine mousse.
En bouche se dessinent des saveurs de pamplemousse et de pin.

Amber colour, creamy head.
Aroma: hops, orange peel, grape, toffee, brown sugar, caramel.
Taste: hops, caramel, orange peel, bitter hops, pine, resin. Heavy bitterness with orange peel and burnt sugar. Creamy mouthfeel.
7-3-8-3-16

Bottle. Pours a clear amber colour with a medium white head. Aroma of pine, resin, slight toasted malts, some orange, grapefruit and subtle spicy, perfumey hops. Taste of orange, pine, resin, some grapefruit, slight toasted malts and subtle caramel. Medium to full bodied and an oily texture. A dryish, citrus and resinous hop bitterness in the finish. A classic American IPA pumped up with bitter resinous and citrusy hops. some booze but isn’t too noticeable. Good.
Bottle from Morrisons. A combination of boozy-ness and orangey-ness. Maybe too much of the former. Overall, it’s a bit fierce. On the plus side, it gives you a warm glow!

Bottle, from Morrisons. Orange gold, fluffy and moderately sustaining white head and good condition. Pleasant but restrained orange citrus hop notes and sweet honeyed malt in the nose, a little muted in the mouth with a toned down citrus note and a hint of peppery spiciness, some sweet yeastiness and a tingle of hop bitterness. Finish is sticky and malty with a low undercurrent of citrus and a moderately persisting hop bitterness.
Bottle. Dark gold with a medium sized head. Aroma is citrusy grapefruit. Taste is malty sweet upfront with a hoppy bitter finish.

Butelka. Miedziany kolor,biała piana o drobnych pęcherzach, średniej wysokości,opada dość szybko. W aromacie słodkie owoce pestkowe,karmel, brzoskwiniowa ice tea. W smaku pełne o małym wysyceniu i dobrze ukrytym alkoholu. Dominują ponownie owocowe chmiele,brzoskwinie,morele,trochę słodkich tropików,ice tea, zioła,chmiel. Gdzie te 72 ibu się pytam?...nadal... naprawdę niezłe

Robe or sombre, limpide, belle carbo assez lente, 1cm de mousse, rousseâtre et un peu irrégulière. Nez très fruité : résine, fraise, mangue, pointe d'agrumes. Attaque ronde, beaucoup de corps, texture agréable, suivies par des notes de pamplemousse, une amertume relativement modérée, équilibrée par le corps, et la fraise ressort dans la longueur. Grosse longueur en bouche, alcool plutôt discret, mais se sent en rétro-olfaction. Très sympa !

Blond ambré parfaitement limpide avec un col de mousse blanc cassé, joli visuel. Nez plein de promesse sur l'orange, le pamplemousse, la mangue, l'ananas et résineux. Et la dégustation ne le fera pas maintenir avec une IPA qui jouit à la fois d'un excellent équilibre malt/houblon et d'une belle complexité aromatique. A l'attaque, le poivre un poivre bien présent apparaît en complément d'arômes de résineux, d'orange et de miel. Si l'intensité est encore sur la réserve le duo malt/houblon est réellement superbe, permettant une bonne assise aromatique et cette fraîcheur du houblon. La deuxième bouche est assez exceptionnelle, gagnant en intensité, elle se complexifie également avec mangue et ananas en complément. L’arrière-bouche est quant à elle sur une amertume plus tranchante, avec un ressenti peut être légèrement inférieur aux 75 d'IBU mais saillante et permettant un bon contraste avec des arômes de pamplemousse prédominants. La prise en bouche est pour sa part bonne, et l'alcool, à 8,2% plutôt bien adapté (peut-être aurait-il pu être légèrement poussé). Si le final reste sur une belle amertume, la longueur est un peu courte, seul petit bémol à noter. Belle IPA.

August 24th, 2015 - An Unlimited Release! Get it now! Or, later. A leather brown ale, it has a soapy scent, but good and fresh. And I also smell unripened grapefruit, bitter and not at all sweet. The flavor is also quite butter, with a fresh, hop forward dimension, and blossoming a little in the middle. On the finish I get some esters, appearing as papaya and lychee and other tropical fruits, but it is a brief glimmer before the bitterness resumes.

12 fl oz bottle. Appearance is an almost clear amber copper, topped with a big fluffy head of white froth which has good retention. Aroma is fruity hops, not quite citrus or tropical, but perhaps apricot, as others have noted? Also whiffs of malt and floral and pine hops. Taste is slightly sweet fruity and malty, but mainly piney bitter, with a rough edge of alcohol which rises above the flavours. Medium to full body, sharply carbonated.
Bottle from Morrison's good old school dipa. Resin pine the malt shines and feels fresh
Magnifique russe au joli château de mousse de couleur crème. Puissance et force.

355ml bottle from Morrison’s supermarket (£2.25):

A clear amber with orange tinges & a fluffy head that's foamy & white, it’s quite thick looking too it & has fairly good retention for the strength of the beer. The nose is a hoppy one with some malts & plenty of sugars plus a little alcohol in the early going but it's definitely sweet with citrus, mango &some resinous pine in there as well. The taste is a sweet & malty one, not quite as pronounced as the nose but the mango & citrus both feature, as does a pleasant apricot taste & lots of sugars with caramel following on behind. Again it seems fairly resinous & it is a medium bodied offering with lighter than expected carbonation levels but a sharp, crisp feel & a little bit of warming alcohol right at the end too: brilliant stuff.
Bottle, Morrisons, Leicester. Golden with a white head. Toffee and brown sugar malts. Grapefruit and woody, floral pine. Spicy and dry. Herbal. Marzipan alcohol.
0,33 l bottle. Very good double IPA, i enjoyed, thanks and worth to drink in the future.
Bottle - amber with thick white head. High carbonation. Strong citrus aroma. Good mouthfeel. Easy drinking - full flavour, highly citrus. A good beer.
Pours amber with a heavy carbonation and fluffy white head. Aroma of resinous hops. Taste is delicate and floral. Palate has oak and woody notes. Really good beer.

The bottle I drank did not taste good.  Too heavy dull fruit taste.  Too much sugar.  Bitterness was not good. Very disappointed. Too bad!  Maybe just a bad batch or an old bottle. There was no date on the bottle.
12 oz bottle, pours pale clear copper.  Medium body.  Faint pine aroma, and more pine than grapefruit to the taste.  Strong hops finish.  Decent.

Bottle, best before 17.10.2019. Clear copper with a small white head with fine retention, lace and regeneration. Caramel, hay, light golden bread, wood, light citrus and flowers. Medium to full body, mild to mediu sweet and bitter. Hoppy finish with some caramel.
Ett inte för sött, honungssmakande öl med en schysst beska som jag kan tänka mig passar underbart till husmanskost.
Yes, its' still beer. I am affraid of its future. Heineken is not guaranting stabil taste and quality for the future. Busines is busines.

12/21/18
With A hanging out in baseball room talking about fam game-night-w/o-us drama.

Poured from bottle into a paper cup so can't see the color but the head is pretty crazy. I overpoured and then got some froth on my nose trying to smell it.

Nose is a citrusy sweet hop explosion. Exceedingly bright and fruity.

Taste is very sweet with lots of floral hop character. Lots of sweet tropical fruit - mango/papaya stuff. Lots of hop flavor but much more sweetness than bitterness but the hop bite does come through pretty big on the finish.

Palate is soft and smooth. A little less crisp than expected from the ridiculously foamy head.

Overall, I've never not loved an IPA from Lagunitas and this is no exception. Sweet and hoppy is their thing - and mine as well :)
Bottle. Pour was clear light amber, white head that lasts. Aroma of grapefruit, pine, citrus. Taste was bitter, pine, pine resin, spruce, caramel, dry finish.C

For me somewhere between an IPA and a Double IPA (more double than single) more malt, so mor alcohol and also t touch sweeter. Strong hops but still drinkable. I like this beer but it has one disadvantage. Before you know, the bottle is empty but at 8.2% it hits quite hard.
355 ml flaske fra Systembolaget.Lukt av humle og fersken. Fin gylden farge.

Det är inte med förvåning utan med ett krasst konstaterande man inser att ekvationen Lagunitas+IPA+hög alkoholhalt ger ett resultat som landar högt över konkurrenternas motsvarigheter. Djupt fruktig arom med stora mängder kola, en smak av karamell med stor fyllighet och långt efterföljande bäska. Nån som vill upprepa en succé...var god kopiera enligt ovan.

Reddish, golden slightly cloudy pour with moderately thin foam that lasted. Grassy hops dominate the nose with some citrus and spice (plum?) on the edge and some caramel malt. Complicated bitterness with very little malt. Medium body, light fizz. Almost chewy.  Too much going on - their standard IPA is preferred.
July 2012
Det här ölet plockas fram vid stunder av njutning. Kraftigt och fylligt och blir en hel måltid.

355ml bottle bought at Q Club in SoHo, Central.



Looks: Clear amber orangeThree-quarter finger head with crumpety off-white foam which lasts for 2 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with sparse slight carbonation.



Aroma: Very fragrant rich Ale malt, with strong orange, strong honey, floral, sugar, spices, pine, strong resins, bread, strong lemon and grass.



Taste: Close to strong sweet Ale malt, with strong amberness, oranges, grapefruits, red fruits, floral, sugar, spices, strong pine, strong resins, herbs, biscuits, strong lemon and strong bitter grassy hops.



Body: Full body. Quite slick and oozy palate.



Mouth Feel: Full Amber maltyness in a slightly wheat-thinned background, very malty but not viscous. Strong orange esters mixed well with grapefruits hops and red fruits, flowery with strong but pleasant sweetness. Very herbal piney ooze, biscuity with strong lemon to round. Very nice!



Hoppiness: Strong orange, floral, spices, pine, strong resins, strong lemon and grass in nose. Grapefruits, floral, spices, strong pine, strong resins, herbs, strong lemon and strong grassy in taste; Bitterness is very strong for a lasting, very high astringent sweet-bitter full amber malty finish.



After Taste: Fairly dry. Herbal piney oozy and strong bitter to mouth.



Comments: This one is way better than Hop Stoopid, with a fuller body, pleasing orange honey characters and very strong piney oozy hop taste. The strong sweetness is just above acceptable. If this one got pumped up further, it may be a torture, for now, it's a loaded 'lil devil well worth a try!
Gylden gjennomsnittlig med lavt hvitt skum. Aroma av malt og tropiske frukter. Karamell. Bitter smak med ulike frukter. Medium/tykk konsistens. Bitter ettersmak.

Aroma malt, hvete, banan. Utseende klar gylden med offwhite skum. Smak malt, alkohol, hvete, banan, karamell. Kraftig, middels fyldig, lang ettersmak av malt og karamel Flaske kjøpt på Systembolaget Arvidsjaur, 35,5cl 8,2%
Bottle. Creamy foam. Hoppy aroma, citrus, fruit, slightly floral, not bad. Taste: quite juicy, citrus and fruit, white port wine, good hop bitterness.
slightly cloudy on the pour, citrus, pine and brown sugar on the nose. taste not as good as expected hoppy slight bitterness but not much length. still a good beer though.
Very characteristic of a Lagunitas, moderate to strong hop presence. I like Lagunitas, but will say that their beers lack some depth. I like this one served cold.

Fruit. Pine. And something floral/sweet. Slightly cloudy bright gold. Thick long lasting off-white head. Just lasts forever. Big gobs of foam left on the glass. A little thinner than I expected. Something floral. Very smooth. Pine. Pretty solid. Well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Safeway in Reston, VA
Aroma: caramel, grass, spruce, citrus, 
Appearance: clear copper with an off-white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Delicious
Gyllengul, klar. Tallbarr o frukt i doften. Melon, mango o citrus dominerar smaken. Mycket välbalanserad, åt det lite sötare hållet. Måttlig beska tar över på slutet. Läcker klassiker!

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, light body, medium body, full body, thin feel, oily feel, creamy, sticky, slick feel, thick feel, fizzy, lively, average carbonation, soft carbonation, flat, astringent, bitter, abrupt finish, long finish, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium sourness,

Copper colour. Small off-white head. Sweet hoppy aroma which turns into dry side soon. Notes of pinewood needles, light caramel, grass, some citrus. Floral, bitterish and long aftertaste. Alcohol is quite well hidden. Medium bodied, a bit sticky perhaps.

Taster at GABS 2018. Pours a pale orange gold with a white head. Aroma: citrus, pine, mild caramel, mild pineapple notes. Taste: citrus, pineapple, pine, biscuity malt, mild caramel. Medium bodied. Moderate carbonation. Smooth flavour balance. Quite pleasant. Would happily have this again.

Aroma: citrus, grassand notes of malt
Taste: grassy hopes from the start, Huge malty wavev with notes of caramel and honey. Strong bitter aftertaste with citrus trail

Lovely mild IPA wit zero to no bitterness. Easy to drink on a hot summers day.
Bottle 355ml at ToveHallen Sønderborg.
Found in bottle in Chicago area. Easily my favorite of lagunitas. Well put together and hops all around. I would enjoy this most as a late summer beer.

Upon reading the label "Maximus" and trying a handful of other Lagunitas IPAs, I expected this to be a lot hoppier than it was. Actually suprised to see this as an IPA, reminded me more of a very good American Pale Ale. The appearance was a darker orange than most IPAs, has a bit of an amber tint. Was also cloudy versus clear....which reminded me of an American Pale. The taste was sweet and malty with decent amount of hops, just not enough for me when craving an IPA.....is this really supposed to be an IMPERIAL IPA, cause of the strength maybe? I prefer my beers not on the super-hop bom side, but felt like I've been somewhat tricked. Still a good release by Lagunitas, but this may be a slight "miss" versus "hit".
Delikatna lekka IPKa. Piwo słodowe, lekkie, dobrze pijalne i dobrze ułożone. Czuć delikatny owocowy posmak. Świetne do hamburgera.
God fyldig med en del sødme. De over 8 % smages og giver en lidt dårlig eftersmag sammen med humlen.

3/22/18: 1 Pint 6 Oz, two pours into pint glass. Golden copper clear pour, one finger white head. Pleasant citrus hops aroma. Firm feel, nice mix of sweet citrus and solid hops. Firm mouth feel, carbonation holds. Overall excellent IPA offering!

12 oz bottle. Scents of pineapple and chalk. Pours an amber gold with a pronounced white head with tiny bubbles and huge lacing. Big round mouthfeel with sweet malt and tropical fruits in the hop flavors central to the lingering finish. Light carbonation. Suoer drinkable for an 8.2%.
Beautiful orange hue, finger of tan on top. Nose is caramel malt, touch alcohol. Middle is caramel, marmalade, a kick of wood, some alcohol. Finish is warm and bittersweet. Sipper.

Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, klarowna, piana bardzo obfita, trwała. Aromat to połączenie amerykańskich chmieli z karmelem, biszkoptem i słodem. W smaku wyraźnie pełne, goryczka średnia w kierunku wysokiej, piwo raczej po słodkiej stronie. Tu też niestety dominuje karmelowo-biszkoptowa strona niż cytrusowa. Alkohol świetnie ukryty, wysycenie wysokie, z początku trochę musuje w ustach.
Mnie tam szkliwa nie rozpuściło ano dpy nie urwało. Jeszcze Bardziej slodowe niż podstawa, ale pelniejsze, wiadomix. Nie mój styl.
I like its an 8%, had bottle poured to glass. Its not my favorite, but for that high bac, pretty good

22 Fluid ounce poured to wine glass	
Sight: Bright yellow, golden, not a lot of head a bit hazy/cloudy	
Smell: slight hoppy smell, sweet and fruity 	
Taste: well balance flavor specially the bitterness/ alcohol, sweetness really comes out	
Mouth feel: nice follow thriough, long finish, sticky, bitter aftertaste
Overall: Excellent beer, specially with the price. Definitely something to look forward to.

Pale light head, and amber color. Strong grapefruit like bitter flavor but no alcohol burn. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a clear golden amber with a thick foamy tan head. Aroma of butterscotch and caramel. Taste is malty with a decent light citrusy caramel note that is offset by ample hops.
A solid double IPA, especially when factoring in the price point (costs as much as Lagunitas’ regular IPA in my area).

Golden pour with a thin white head. Aromas of pine, resin, tangerine, apricot and maybe a little mango. Taste is very balanced with fruity notes, hops, piney bitterness and a smooth malty backbone. Medium body with a thick mouth feel and moderate carbonation. Nice to go DIPA.

355ml from bottle bought at Antenna America (Tokyo). Similar to its little sister, this IPA brings all the best from Petaluma. Nice aroma, specially piney, peaches and slightly floral as well. Well rounded beer

Pours orange, amber, golden with a white head and good retention with a nice aroma of citrus and hops. Tastes of malt and bitter hops with a citrus, lemon finish. It’s mostly dry with some booze. It’s also medium bodied with lively carbonation. Although the malt tastes dry, it’s caramel character balances well with the bitter hops.
Gröna dofter. Något besk och söt smak. Fyllig. Finns något åt lök-hållet här? Trevlig   Öl!

From Jul 2008

This pours a clear gold with a 1 finger head of foam. Not exactly a big head of foam for a vigorous pour but it has some staying power and there's some nice lacing.

The smell is a nice balance of caramel malt and citrus and piney hops. Nice nose.

The taste is also balanced. Plenty of malt for the malt lovers, plenty of hoppiness from flavours of grapefruit and some pine for the hop lovers, and put them together and you have a finely balanced DIPA. There's also some fruitiness here. Very nice.

It borders on a full mouthfeel...silky smooth, and the alcohol is nicely hidden. It finishes on the sweet side but not overly so as there is a good kick of grapefruit right at the very end. Pretty easy drinking as well.

This is a very well made example of the style and I can recommend it with no qualms.

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki
Pours cloudy dark amber with a small fluffy white head. Light aroma of caramel, hops and citrus. Taste is initially sweet: caramel and malts with sour lingonberry, pine and slight citric notes. Even a trace of oak barrel can be spotted. Sweetness eventually gives in to sturdy bitter hoppiness, with a surprisingly smooth long finish. Medium to full bodied, smooth mouthfeel, low carbonation. Very enjoyable Double IPA with kind of a special own flavor, building more upon caramel than citrus.

Nice hoppy IPA. Much more malty caramel and less citrus than many other IPAs, and can taste the 8% ABV.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rotted unripe orange & rubbing alcohol. Apricot.
The fruit's failure to stand out and little-to-no maltiness leaves not much to stand in the way of the taste of alcohol.
As this is my first Lagunitas brew, and 8.2% and 72 ibu's is right in my wheelhouse, I truly wanted to like this one, but found nothing nice to say. 
I reckon it'll get you drunk.

Pours a deep amber with a modest head that leaves only a thin lacing. Aroma is fruity with lots of citrus (mainly orange), pine and grass. Medium body, slick feel, soft/avg. carbonation. Taste starts off dry with lots of hop resin, and rounds off with zesty citrus and some caramel. Long and bitter finish, but it's still nicely balanced with the alcohol really well hidden.
amber, hazy, white foam, resin, grass, medium sweetness, very bitter, full body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,

Drunk 1 year after tap.

Golden almost amber with a light white head. Grapefruit, caramel, hoppy and piney aroma. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter (not a lot of bitterness) with notes of grass, caramel and som hopps and with a liqourish finish.

Clear orange color with long lasting white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, mango. Taste is sweetish with bitter notes and long lasting bitterish finish. Well balanced and easy to drink. Very good ipa.

Pours a Golden orange color with light head. Smells of citrus, and hops. Drinks super smooth with a slight bitter/citrus after taste. Can't believe it has an ABV of 8.2 %. Bought 1 in a mix six pack and I'm sad I didn't just buy 6 of these. My new favorite IPA.
Orange color beer with an huge frothy beige head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, and a some floral notes. Flavor is citrus, biting pine and lots of grape fruit.. Medium to heavy palate.

Pours nice golden, even a bit of amber Quite clear and not very carbonated - nor with its of foam. Aroma is nicely hoppy, some clean sugar feel to it, not stuffy but dry and slightly grassy. Well balanced, feels like a quite light beer to drink although it has some abv packed away. Tastes dry, balanced between sweet medium body and lots of hop bitterness. At the same time hops are not too bitter, not astringent but just about right. Quite nice one, feels as Lagunitas should feel like.

This beer has a strong hoppy taste with a slight fruit taste, it was slightly bitter. Bought a bottle and enjoyed with hotdog.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Decent stuff. Sweet and bitter combination. Sweet grape fruit im particular.

Bärnstensfärgad med medelstort skum som fäster fint på glaskanterna och ligger kvar länge på ytan. I doften finns massor av torkad frukt, tallbarr och citrus och en liten kryddighet. Smaken är stor, rund och fyllig med skön fruktsötma, citrustoner, tallbarr och en balanserande lång efterbeska. Snarast en DIPA skulle jag vilja säga. Denna gillar jag, sötma och beska i en skön förening, stor och komplex smak. 171011 jämförd mot Nebuchadnezzar: Maximus är lite sötare både i doften och smaken, mer av aprikos och persika, t.o.m. lite övermogna päron, beska bäddas in lite mer i sötman.

Bought in at a Swedish Systembolag. God damn Swedes and their cheap prices...
Opened with a prestine can of Skruf Fresh Slim White. Pours amber with a tight off-white head. The nose is spruce, tight tight citrusy hops. Medium mouth feel. Sweet hops aroma with spruce, malts, and a fruity grapefruit-feel. This is delicious.

Wow I've been excited about trying this one. The finish is clean and delicious. Just a damn good beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at the Lumsden in a Lagunitas jar. Pours gold. Peach, syrup, grapefruit, orange, little bubblegum. Nice full body. Decent.
Light orange pour. Similar to the lagunitas IPA just with everything way more in your face. Not saying it as s bad thing though. Very enjoyable
Pours golden with a firm white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, stable and flowers. Taste of pale malt, grapefruit, peach and juniper berries. Somewhat sweet with a bitter resinous ending. Full body.

Copenhagen 25/7 2017. 35,5 cl bottle from Meny. Just says "Maximus" on the label with Hops slowly entangling the corners on the label. Pours clear golden copper yellow with white head. Head settles as 1,5 cm thick layer of foam. Moderate lacing. Aroma is rich and strong. Sweet exotic fruit with a sweet boozy fermented touch. More subdued citric notes. Almost sugary intensity. Soft carbonation and sluggish palate. Flavor is fairly sweet but balanced by distinct bitterness. Aftertaste is bitter with semi dry finish. There is no boozy or metallic alcohol here - but none the less you are not in doubt that this beer has a healthy ABV.

355 ml bottle. Clear, dark golden amber, medium off-white head, low carbonation. Aroma is malty with tropical hop notes. Mouthfeel is very hoppy and bitter, medium body. Taste is "dark", tropical and hoppy. Nice balance between sweetness and bitterness.
Tap at Stouts. Amber with thin white head. Tangerine, pineapple, apple peels, slight alcohol and malt aromas. Big fruity sweetness with a moderate bitterness. Medium body with a slightly sticky feel.

One of my favorite IPAs- deep rich taste - with hints of yummy - takes normal Lagunitas citrus notes and goes BOOM!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Excellent IPA. Big mouth, heavy and robust. Quite impressive beer. Will have ahaib
Bärnstensfärgad med fint vitt skum. Doftar fräscht av citrus och lite tallkåda. Smaken fyllig och besk. Eftersmaken lång och humlig (efter 3 snapsar).

Nothing special. Sweet note? I don't know, just but a fan. 

  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Here we have another old Lagunitas favorite. It pours a nice thick dark amber and has a pungent citrus and resin nose. The taste is a bitter, citrusy, piney hop bombast with a long finish and an effervescent mouthfeel that would seem unlikely for this ABV and type of beer. Good for capping off a glorious free Monday night 35mm screening of the movie Air Force One for its 20th anniversary with your cutie butt.

Solid Imperial IPA. Pours light, clear copper with a brief, froth y white head; lots of residual lacing. Aroma caramel malt and tropical fruit. Taste starts lightly sweet from the big malt base, Hops starts tropical fruit, finishes pine resin. Palate features the big malt structure, taking a moment for the resin hops to emerge at the finish - a nice dance of sweet and bitter in the finish. Overall, a substantial and straightforward imperial.

Nice looking beer. Aroma: caramel, pineapple and faint floral notes. Taste: fruity (grapefruit and mango) and caramel. Followed by nice pine resin and tingling notes of pineapple and herbs. Balanced. One of the better beers I have had lately.

8.2%
A big piney west coast affair, Maximus is anything but subtle. Starts with a resiny pine nose with a bit of citrus and peach. Pours a light amber with a decent frothy pure white head. Flavor is sweet in the front, but bitterness rises quickly ending in a very bitter crescendo and sticky resin fade. All about the hops here.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I wasnt very impressed by this one. It pours a mid amber body, almost no carbonation, head or lace. Aroma of sweet caramel malt. Flavor is similar with a slightly grapefruit tasting finish. I was expecting a few more hops and less malts for a IIPA, Overall it was o.k. but not outstanding. Originally rated on 1/21/09. 
Re-rate on 9/8/17. Bumped it up to a 3.6 from a 3.4.

Tap at the Ørsted Ølbar, Copenhagen. Poured a clear medium amber with a frothy white head and some clingy lace. The aroma is malt, tropical fruit, some alcohol. The flavour is moderate sweet light bitter with a smooth rich fruity alcoholic bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Nice and fruity with well hidden alcohol.
Pours golden with off-white head. Citrus aroma. Frothy texture and refreshing taste without an aftertaste.

Bottle. BB 24 Oct 2017 (drunk Apr 2017 before being sold to Heineken). First pour rather clear bright orange, second pour contains huge chunks of floaties. Head creamy white, rather big, nice lace. Lovely tropical fruit aroma, sweet, stone fruits and pineapple. Tastes sweet and bitter, very fresh and tropical, ripe, kinda like apricot, mango and pineapple, not very citric, more like resiny. Fine but crisp carbonation, oily texture, somewhat dryish finish. Very nice.



Edit: Bottle from random deli in Brooklyn. Still very nice, the only difference is the lack of floaties this time and the brewery now belonging to Heineken. Feel bad but gotta up from 3.6 to 3.8. It's still a lovely brew.

Rami Rami is drinking a Maximus by Lagunitas Brewing Company at Konstruktorska Business Center


Jeszcze sa cytrusy i tropiki, ale juz nielekko utlenienia, slodowa warstwa fajna, dluga spora goryczka, slodkawe, to chyba _bylo_ fajowe :(


Rami Rami: Chyba jednak nie ma sensu kupowac takich zza oceanu jesli sie nie ma wlasnego, szybkiego transportu... znaczy w sumie pije sie przyjemnie...


Rami Rami: Kurde, to mimo braku buchania chmielami jest ryli dobre, az se ciut ocenke podniose :)

Butelka 0,355l zakupiona na WFP, pite w domu. Kolor złoty, klarowny, wspaniała biała piana, mocna zostawiająca piękny ślad na szkle.W aromacie zioła, cytrusy cała gama aromatów. W smaku goryczka bardzo dobrze synchronizująca się z mocnymi aromatami. Piwo bardzo dobre, klasa światowa, super.

Bottle from systembolaget acharlottenberg. 
Quite good double IPA. 
Nice aroma

Golden amber with medium big, frothy head. Smells of flowers, tropical fruit (pineapple, mango), caramel, notes of roasted malt. Taste is intensly tropical, also pine (which i couldnt smell) becomes apparant, some complex notes of burnt log. It is a little big too sweet for my taste but it is balanced by some sourness and medium bitterness. Medium body and aftertaste. Overall a good west coast DIPA, it looks really nice too.

A big piney west coast affair, Maximus is anything but subtle. Starts with a resiny pine nose with a bit of citrus and peach. Pours a light amber with a decent frothy pure white head. Flavor is sweet in the front, but bitterness rises quickly ending in a very bitter crescendo and sticky resin fade. All about the hops here.

The Pour: Light orange-amber, 2 finger ivory white head.

The Bouquet: Earthy, piney hops, grapefruit, and pineapple citrus notes are prominent

The Sip: Nice bitterness from the hops and citrus. This is a very hop forward beer with herbal earthy pine hops. Malty sweetness which makes it a little bready.

Mouth-Feel: Light carbonation, very malty for an IPA, super smooth. Full-bodied hops linger after swallowing.

Overall: Beautiful. On the maltier side of IPAs that I’ve had in the past, but I really like this. This IPA has a very nice weight to it. Full-bodied earthy hops bounce around the palate while the malt anchors the whole package. Very easy drinking IPA. Pair with a burger or pulled pork sandwich, or just drink it by itself.
Bottle. Golden color, small white head. Kinda sweet at first, but really piney hops in the back. Very bitter finish, a little alcohol-y but not overpowering. Pretty good.

Rødgylden klar skum hvid kort 
Grape citrus malt brød 
Bitter meget sød lidt 
Tør flad 
@hop SF
355ml bottle from alko. Pours clear amber with white lacing. Intense hoppy bitterness at first, pine and tropical fruits... but there is no finish.

Semi clear beer with a brief white head. Quite fruity aroma with thick feel to it. Quite bland taste actually. No carbonation, sweetness yet very dull hops. Either this is not fresh or it’s just weak. I need more bitterness. Now it’s not balanced with alcohol.
Bottle at home. Pours amber with big white head. Aroma is strong hops, citrus and caramel. Taste has caramel, pine, citrus, hay and malts. Pretty nice.

Bottle from systembolaget. An awesome double IPA. Powerful, full of flavour, bitterness verging on aggressive but remaining intact with the drink and a fibrous golden colour. Yum. (24/2/17)

Bottle from Jane Doe, Östersund. Not as miraculous but definitely one that grows on you over the time. Very bitter. 4.1 ti 3.7.
Nice hope pine aroma with some sweetness. Clear copper colour with off white head. Medium sweetness heavy bitterness. Finish is dry bitter but not overly so. Well balanced dip a with nice aroma.

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours cloudy bronze with a little white head. The aroma features strong citrusy fruitiness with pine and a touch caramel; very hoppy but a hint of maltiness appears as well. Taste is light sweet initially, later medium to heavily bitter. Caramel and toffee flavoured maltiness gives way to hoppiness that displays both citrusy and piney notes. Potent but fairly balanced. The palate is medium to heavily bodied and smooth, low to average in carbonation. Very tasty.
Bottle. Clear amber in color with a thick whitish head. Ripe fruity and sweet notes in aroma. Smooth mouthfeel. Sweetish fruity taste, some bitters though save it, although it’s quite heavy to drink.

From a 355ml bottle on 14/2/2017. Pours a clear medium golden with a small head. The nose is very malt with lots of caramel and some resiny hops. Flavour wise, it’s sweet and malty up front - more caramel, some toffee, and bread. The hops are firm, with lots of resin and pine, providing nice balance, and there’s the barest hint of booze at the back. The texture is a bit syrupy and the carbonation is soft. Very enjoyable indeed.

Bottle; pours clear amber with an off white head; aroma of citrus, pine, and hints of caramel and honey; taste is light bitter with citrus, caramel, and some bready notes; finish is mostly dry and light bitter with a touch of pine

Aromas heavy on the hops - grapefruit, pine, spruce. Some bread and sweetness from the malt.

Color is a clear moderately light amber, a bit more toward the orange. Head is average size and offwhite.

Taste is pretty bitter and just a touch sweet.

Body is medium; texture slightly slightly oily; carbonation a bit on the lively side and the finish is long and bitter but with some malt sweetness also.

Overall this is a pretty good IPA; the hops are strong with several aromas. There is also enough malt presence to provide reasonable balance.

Bottle. Orangey Amber in colour. Very Hoppy; piney oily resinous and spicy hops. Fruity; bitter citrus grapefruit and lemon. Malty backbone; sweet malts, caramel. Slightly salty. Nice hop/fruit/malt balance. Initially sweet then bitter hoppy citrus fruity throughout. Long dry hop bitterness in the finish. Very drinkable. (2010-10)
35.5cl bottle. hazy orange color. citrus, tropical fruits, malts. medium bitterness. semi-dry finish.
A little sweetness in the nose. Taste is nicely blended , hops and malts in perfect harmony. A bitter finish. Good stuff.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and hoppy with caramel and notes of pine. Dry finish
Clear amber pour with a thick creamy off-white head. Aroma of pine and citrus with some bread. Citrus flavor upfront with some pine caramel, and bread. Superb lacing. Very nice.
Fantastisk IPA, en dejlig rund smag, hvor man overhovedet kan smage alkoholen på 8,2 %

Pours super clear gold with a finger of head that lasts forever. Lots of hop aroma. Floral, pine. Clean bitterness that doesn’t linger. Very low malt flavor or sweetness perceived with the bitterness. Hop flavor is consistent with aroma. This is not something I’d reach for often but is pretty good.

Bottle. Pours clear dark amber with large foamy off-white head, very faint citrus aroma, low carbonation, initially sweet taste followed by medium hoppy bitterness, thin body, long sticky sweet finish with residual bitterness. A bit too sweet.

Lagunitas Brewing is a favorite and I thought Maximus IPA was worth a try. Prescient thinking. My gosh, is this good. The 12 oz. bottle pours a dark gold with a thinnish head that does lace nicely nonetheless. The nose is of pine needles and blue sky. Just kidding on the last one. But the sky is the limit. Opening taste is lemon and orange with a close follow of sweetness. Involved. Aggressive without being over the top. Hoppy certainly and finishes with a rewarding bitter bite. Very nice.
12 oz bottle Pours a burnt orange color with minimal off white head light lacing. Earthy aroma with a very hoppy taste crisp clean flavor.

Poured from the bottle. Clear brilliant orange, with medium off white head. Pleasant balanced aroma of hops - citrus, pine, pineapple - and caramel malted notes. Flavour really nice and balanced, tropical fruits and pine, with roasted sugar sweetness from the malt. Medium body, creamy smooth, but doesn’t linger. Bitterness is a slowly building one, and clean, that compliments the sweetness and alcohol so well that it becomes dangerously crushable at 8.2%.

Bottle, 355 ml from Beergium. Shared with JFK10000. Pours clear orange with medium off-white head. Hoppy, citrus, grassy, malty, sweet, moderate bitterness in finish. Medium bodied. Guess not the freshest one since I expected more hops.

Weak smell. Very floral, funky and earthy aromas. Throat lozenge. Doughy. Very nice hazy gold colour, lots of bubbles. Well balanced high bitterness with some sweetness. Thick mouthfeel. Bitter finish. 

Dad likes it.

12 oz, bottle. Pours a hazy deep golden color with an off-white head. The aroma is dominated by West Coast hops. The flavor is as well with a perceptible hop bitterness and lots of hop oil. The malt body is thick and tastes like crystal/caramel malts. I am not a fan of American IPA´s, but I think that this is a very good one and those who do like this style will not be disappointed. It also delivers quite a kick at 8.2% ABV. The label lists the IBU´s at 72.41 which is way too exact. I have worked in the laboratory of a major brewery and can tell you that to keep the IBU´s to 72 is hard enough much less getting it exactly to two decimals.

650 ml bottle

Clear light Amber color. Bright White head that falls to a collar. 
Nose is orange marmalade, citrus, tropical fruits and Honey. Bright and aggressive nose. 
Taste is pretty similar. Orange marmalade, citrus, tropical fruits and honey. Aggressively hopped. Feels bigger than 8.2%. slick and oily body but a bit sweet that lingers a bit too long

Bottle from LCBO. Pours a clear deep gold colour with one finger of soapy white head. Aromas of pine, herbs, and citrus. Taste matches the aroma. Citrus in the front with some bread note that leads to a surprisingly malty finish and well balanced hoppy after-taste. Medium bodies with moderate carbonation.

Poured in a Snifter glass, frothy almost 3-finger head. 
Clear, amber coloured. 

Aroma is marmelade, honey and citrus. 

Taste follows the aroma pretty hard and fills the mouth with fruity honey sweetness and some lingering bitterness. 

Like it’s little brother, it sticks to the palate for a long time which is really nice. 
Good DIPA!

Orange blond body with white two finger head. The aromas are citrus,hops.I couldn’t smell much that particular day. The taste is quite bitter but there is a malt backbone that stands next to it and compliments the bitterness.
From Beergium. In Teku glass. Watching Los Soprano 4x13. Deliciously resinous fruity juice. Thick body with alcohol well hidden

Pours dark gold, clear, shoRt lasting off white head. Aroma is grapefruit, tropical fruit, grass, hay. Taste is more resiny, dank, grapefruit pith, strong bitterness barely covering the alcohol.  Sweetness more evident as it warms. Medium mouthfeel, alcohol, bitternees, and citrus on the finish.
031016. Tap at The Bull, Tampere. Pours hazy copper with a small head. Aroma courteous, floral notes, mango. Nice overall taste.
Bottle (from beergium). Pours amber. Aroma is sweet, vanilla, pine, malt, citrus. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, pine, caramel candy, malt. Finish ipine bitter. Overall: good.

Bottle shared by Mart, thanks! Clear orange amber beer, white head. Nose is citric, resiny, malty sweetness, caramel notes. Flavor is citric, caramel, oranges, malt, toasty notes. Citric and resiny finish, lingering alcohol with malt. Not bad at all.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass. Appearance is clear, golden/light copper with trace sparkle, finger-width foamy white head with fair retention and nice sudsy lacing. Aroma is fruit, resin, citrus, pine. Taste is sweet tropical fruit with dank, bitter resin, citrus and pine at the ending. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with thin, foamy texture, average-to-lively carbonation and mix of sweet fruity and mild bitter finish. Overall, this scores high across the board with decent complexity. Weirdly thin palate for an imperial IPA but equally weirdly it kinda works.

Quite impressionable in the glass with a new penny translucent copper appearance. The head is a dense foamy white at about three fingers. The aroma is a malt driven with hops playing the supporting role. A spicy/funky hop character with a dash of citrus but what I get most is a pineapple-like tone at the core. This pineapple and sweet bread combo prevails in the taste as well. Almost like a pineapple upside down cake as a beer. Just as marketed, it’s the IPA cranked up.
Bottle thanks to Lukasmh. Pours clear orange with a medium offwhite head. Aromas of pine, resin, orange, malt. Taste is malty, earthy, piney, resin, orange, orange zest.
Good amount of hops. Definitely a natural citrus feel. Good malty yeast. Hops are noticeable; but, not overwhelming.

Very clear honey gold... big head that drops to sheets of lacy rings.. looks very nice.

Aroma is obviously hops.. pine and candied citrus rind... toasted malts thrown into the mix.

Flavor has big bitterness to balance a pretty heavy malt profile ... good medium body... hop flavors are citrus pine and Flintstone vitamins ... the Flintstones linger (Amarillos???).

Caramel, peaches, and malt aromas. Taste of maple, sugar, with a peachy hop flavor at the end. This one is missing a strong fruity side to balance the hop bitterness, though it is quite nice, and is a change from the more overpowering IPAs

8/25/16. Bottle. Not my favorite DIPA. Perhaps not a fair comparison but I drank this a night after a Wicked Weed Freak of Nature. Kind of heavy with none of the refined nose or mouth found in the WW. Solid but not a stand out. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is one of my favorite IPA’s since it fits perfectly with food (especially spicy food) but just as well on its own. The fresh, fruity taste and its well balanced bitterness makes this incredibly enjoyable and relaxing beer one of my definite choices when buying beers!

Try drinking with homemade burgers or spicy mexican food, such as tacos.

Pours a beautiful copper color. Two fingers of off white head with generous lacing. Aroma is reminiscent of pears and mild grain with a back end of sweet malts. Flavor is very upfront with the strong hops. Refreshing taste of summer dominates this profile. Grapefruit, mowed grass and fresh cut pine. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Zapach intensywny, owoce tropikalne, cytrusy, sosna, trawa. Kolor bursztynowy, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku umiarkowana słodycz, średnia pełnia, owoce tropikalne, cytrusy, sosna, karmel, toffi, trawa. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie.
Damn great IIPA. Buckets of delish hoppyness working well with a solid backbone of maltiness. Should all be like this.

Pours flat amber with creamy white head. Aroma is heavy malty, cookie, resin, pine. Bitter finish, velvety mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Delicious balance. Not very fruity, more on the wooden side. Great.

Golden. Rich aroma with citrusy and spicy hops. Full hop flavour, spicy and pungent, and a full taste with moderate sweetness and a very bitter finish. Full-bodied and soft. Overall, a great double IPA. It has the right malt sweetness to balance the aggresive hops.

Pours amber with thick white big head. Aroma is fruits, grapes, pineapple, melon, some wood, sweet flowers. Taste is bitter, acrid, fruit sweetness, mango, melon, some wood, resin, spices, herbs. Very nice beer, super!

12fl oz bottle poured into a Samuel Adams Perfect Pint. Light, sparkling, with a fluffy offwhite cap. Smells like a tropical fruit that I can’t quite place. The hops in the flavor kicks a little at first and then becomes rather muted. Pretty tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Orange color, beige head. Hops, hops, hops in the aroma. Grass, pine and citrus. Sweet beer with a hop bomb during the finish. The hoppy taste gets to intense and doesn’t suit me at all.

from bottle, poured a deeper orange colour with a white head. nose of crisp caramel malts, grapefruit, orange sweetness, lemon zest, caramel sweetness, pineapple. taste is sweet fruits upfront followed by a nice clean bitter aftertaste. enjoyable
Aroma is earthy hops. Taste is a reasonably balanced IPA. Overall pretty good, not great.

Aroma of grapefruit, orange and hints of yeast/dough. Pours golden with a tall, frothy and white head. Nicely balanced flavour, mostly bitter. Feels quite thin, average carbonation, bitter finish. Quite enjoyable.

Tap @ basement beer bar, Aalborg. Aroma of piney, some grapefruit. Clear amber with white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate+ bitter and dry to light sweet. Medium body, oily feel, bitter finish.

Versa nel bicchiere di una bella tonalità arancione-ambrato, velata; è sormontata da una bella schiuma di colore bianco sporco, cremosa, che si dissipa lentamente e dalla buona allacciatura. L’aroma iniziale è un’esplosione di profumi floreali, agrumi dolci (soprattutto pompelmo ed ananas) e di luppolo, che solletica il naso. Il profumo di malto aleggia nel finale, così come quello di caramello. Al palato trova seguito quanto percepito al naso, con il luppolo che domina l’ingresso in bocca, accompagnato da forti note agrumate, di pino e sentori di resine. L’amaro è ben bilanciato dalla comparsa a metà bevuta del malto e, dalle note dolci di caramello; per un finale lungo e secco. Ha una bassa carbonazione, che la rende liscia e cremosa per un’ottima facilità di bevuta.

22 oz bottle pours a semi-hazy orange with thin patchy white head. Aroma is resinous with a pith note and a hint of banana esters. Taste is biscuit, caramel, and floral pith; up front bitter with a mild, slick finish. Seems like a cross between a red and a hop bomb.

Tap@Taphouse, Copenhagen - pours orange amber with a white head. Aroma and taste comprises sweet tropical fruits, prominent grapefruit, tangerine, citrus peel, with good malty backbone, caramel, toffee, resinous hoppy, pine needles, bitter finish.

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear orange with a medium sized, off white head. Aroma has lots of fruity, citrussy hops, grape fruit, ripe orange, caramel malts. Nice and fresh. Taste is nicely balanced between caramel sweetness and a rather high hop bitterness. Average high carbonation and an oily body.

0.355l bottle. Clear orange body, white head. Aroma and taste of biscuit, toffee, toast, pine, berries, citruses and a hint of roast. Sweet upfront but has a nice hop bitterness in the end. Not a westcoast style hop bomb, but I like it.

Tap@Søernes. Pours almost clear light amber with offwhite tight head. Aroma of malt, bread, biscuit and caramel and hoppy with a fruity resinous, citrus aroma. Taste is malty and semi-sweet with bread, biscuit and caramel yet hoppy with fruity, grassy, resin and citrus. Finish is balanced semi-dry bitter.
Bottle. Hazy deep yellow pour with a thin off white head. Aroma of citrus, brown sugar and vanilla. Medium body with a malty backbone. Bitter sweet finish.

12 oz bottle shared by ebone1988 for the stupid fucking book. Thanks asshole. This is a steamy pile of garbage. The pour is a dark clear golden orange with a thicker cap of off white head that falls to a film and leaves a few spots of lace. The aroma is fucking awful. This couldn’t smell more like a malt bombed amber ale if it was labeled as such. This is terrible. There is no hop presence, no bitterness, just malts and a lingering sign that Lagunitas should close their doors. Fuck. The flavor is also fucking terrible. God damnit. It’s all malt. What a surprise. for something I thought was going to be an IPA, boy was I in for a treat. No bitterness, no hops, nothing that resembles an IPA. The mouth feel is syrupy and thicker. There is a soft carbonation that really lets the malts tickle my taste buds in a way that makes me want to scrape them off with a rusty bayonet. This is terrible.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is malt, floral, pine, tropical fruit, old. Appearance is amber golden, off white head, clear. Taste is not good. Malt bomb. Bitterness from the malt is apparent. Maybe some pine? Some citrus? I can’t get past the malt. This is not good. Mouthfeel is medium body, very light carbonation, malty bitter aftertaste. Overall, I’m glad I’m done with this brewery for the book, this beer and all of their others are incredibly disappointing.

Clear, copper colour with a white head about one finger thick. Mild hoppy aroma, some citrus and little bit of sweet brown sugar. Bitter taste but it’s well balanced, rich in flavour, somewhat dry finish, some sweet malts towards the end. Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation. Very good but quite basic double IPA.
Bottle. Pours golden with off-white head. Aroma is malty sweet fruity. Taste is sweet fruity orange grapefruit with a piney finish. It’s pretty good but a little too much malt for my personal tastes.
a bit of citrus hop aroma. Body is a oddly a bit thin, taste is citrus hops and a bit of a biscuit malt.

The beer has a clear golden yellow color. The foam is white with small bubbles. The foam disappears at a leisurely pace, leaving little trace. Aromas of hops, tropical fruit. There are some peach, orange and little flowers. Some sweet notes of syrup. The flavors of the hops, and very little malt. Then comes the passion fruit and pineapple. After that, a fine hops bomb again. Followed by sweet peach, some citrus, orange, a little salt, syrup and pine in the back. Medium body. Moderate carbonated. A little dry and sweet, fresh with just enough bitterness.

Dark orange body, with a big active white head on the pour.
Nice blend on the nose, of grass, citrus and caramel malts.
Mouthfeel is quite velvety, almost like a cask conditioned beer, only still retaining a bit of a sharp edge.
Sweet peach dominates the tastes for me. There is also some nice caramel malts. Definitely can tell this is an Imperial, and not a stereotypical citrus juice bomb IPA. I love this beer.
Nice and fresh hops on this golden color ale with a major foamy white head. Perfect balance between malt sweetness and hops. Good stuff.
Sample at Waldo Hopfest 2016. Comes golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is grapefruit, tropical, pine, and malt. Very good.

6-pack from the LCBO. Pours a clean amber colour with a big warm cap, great retention and creamy-foamy lacing. Grassy hop aromas with citrus over caramel malts. Sweet malty taste with lots of herbal notes. This Imperial IPA goes down nicely, but it is a little rich in the middle. Thankfully, the finish is lightly dry and helps this.

I drank this tonight and can’t believe I haven’t had it before. Beer is a smart simple brew, with a deep and solid malt bitll that allows for a solid well thought out hops profile. It’s a strong hop beer that is malt forward. Pleasant all the way though.
Refreshing IPA for being a double. Light citrus notes and semi dry finish make this one i will definitely get again
Tasted at our DIPA shootout. This beer won our shootout. Grapefruit/tropical aroma, excellent fruit additions, well-integrated bitterness, slightly sweet, syrupy mouth feel.
Bomber Bottle from mchughs. Pours clearish orange. Skunk, dank hop, citrus, pine nose. Flavor is marmalade sweet with bitter finish. Dank hop resin on finish.
Pours clear orange with a big foamy off white head. Aroma has citrus fruits and sweet fruits with a bit of pine. Flavor is pretty much the same with a good bitterness. Very enjoyable beer.

On tap at Lagunitas tap room, Pataluma (CA, USA). Orange clear pour, tick and resistant off-white cap. Nose: citric, almonds pastry. Mouth: complex citric-sweet orientation, juicy sweet tangerine soul, clean, dry finish! Just great! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber in Seattle. Stringy foam on darker gold. Dense pine resin and citrus. Medium body, tart and relatively clean. Resin density. A little alc bite and richness. A little much in creaminess in middle for me. Nice, but not my perfect hop balance.
Pours dark orange with medium head. Aroma: herbs, grass, followed by tropical fruit such as mango. Taste: citrussy-herbish, a touch of iron, followed by a strong bitter palate. Very good.

Pours clear dark golden, lasting head and good lacing. Aroma of resin, pine, some sweet fruit like mango and peach. No trace of alcohol. Medium body, medium carbonation. Sweet malty taste, sticky texture, but it gives not enough balance to welcome strong, vegetal, herbal and long bitterness on finish.

355 ml bottle from a six pack bought at the LCBO.


Appearance: Pours a gleaming copper colour with fingers of pillowy white head. Average retention and tons of lacing.


Aroma:
Pine, peach and citrus.


Flavours:
Pine, peach and citrus.


Mouthfeel: Thick and coating.


Overall: Gorgeous peach aroma and flavour in this one. One of the best IPAs I’ve had in a long while.

355ml bottle. Clear orange body, medium white head with good retention, lots of lacing. Aroma of peaches, grapefruit, apricots, fresh herbal peppery notes. Taste of honey, apricot jam, grapefruit zest, a touch of pine. Lovely, but a tad too sweet.
(bottle) clear, very bright orange colour with a mall beige head; aroma oftropical fruit, bit of dankness; balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish

Halvljus och grumlig. Ganska humlad, fyllig smak med en del alkohol. Inte så fruktig mer åt tallbarr

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A dense off-white head on a light golden body. Nose includes malt, tangy hops, spice and brown sugar. This is a nicely bended malt-first IIPA. The taste profile extends from the elements in the nose, including dank and fruity hops, apricots, some spice and chewy, slightly caramel malts. Nice richness and density. A bit of alcohol warmth too.

A very sweet beer, but shot through with enough flavour and bitterness. Very caramel and bread (with glazed crust) malt, pine, earth, orange and floral in the taste with hints of spearmint and maybe anise or licorice.

Nice drinking DIPA, smooth malt flavors, nice caramel notes, bit of spice also detected. I like these because I felt like I could keep drinking them instead of wanting to switch to something else. They should put these in a 12 pack bottles :)

Couleur abricot, mince couche mousseux. Un liquide clair, limpide, transparent avec une petite effervescence. Au nez, le sucre domine clairement. En bouche, un malt doux caramel et le sucre brun. Légère finition sur le sucre et le caramel.
0,355 bottle. Hazy orange colour with fast disappearing head. The Aroma is very dry and hoppy. Taste is hoppy with some spices. Very bitter ending.

Servida en un Spiegelau IPA.

APARIENCIA: De color ámbar/dorado, con algunos destellos naranjas a contraluz, se observa moderada alta actividad de carbonatación. Corona de espuma blanca de buena retención, 3 dedos de altura, de burbuja compacta y muy buen lacing.

AROMA: el lúpulo de entrada es lo que predomina completamente, con notas flores y algo frutales, como toronja, piña, durazno, ligeras notas herbales como de pino, atrás algo de dulzor de las maltas.

SABOR: Al frente amargor moderado alto de entrada, notas herbales y resinosas, notas de pino es lo que predomina, atrás ligeras notas cítricas y frutales, algo de toronja, piña y durazno, con muy buena permanencia de sabores en paladar. El retrogusto queda el amargor pegado pero es seco, no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio, sensación oleosa probablemente procedente de los aceites del lúpulo, carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: Una excelente Imperial/Double IPA con un amargor interesante, destacan más las notas resinosas de pino que las cítricas. Muy buena.

Aroma includes pine, apricot. Color is a clear burnt orange topped with a solid one fingered head. Bitter start with a dose of fruit, malt sweetness. Medium body with a bold character. Warms the palate and is very drinkable.

12oz bottle. Clear dark amber with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are sweet cereals, bread, caramel, barley sugar, lemon, resinous hops, alcohol and licorice(?) with spicy and earthy notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, syrupy texture.

Bouteille 355 ml. LCBO. 8.2%. Couleur cuivrée pâle, mousse blanche. Arôme très sucrée, qui enterre le houblon. En bouche, maltée, assez sucrée, sucre d’orge, houblon et amertume en finale qui s’étend. Bonne mais vraiment sucrée à mon goût.

Pours golden brown with some lacing. Aroma consists of pine, grapefruit and orange. Taste is medium sweet and mixes well with the flavours to create a solid beer. The body is thick, carbonation is medium. Easy to drink given the alcoholic content.

12oz bottle - Pours orange with an off-white head. A very nice aroma of hops, raisins, and cereal grain. Big flavor of tangy citrus, but with a biscuit base... and dry hay. I expected a bit more warming alcohol and over-ripened fruit flavor for the abv, but it never happened. I liked this one. But not my favorite Imperial IPA.

Bottle from the LCBO. Slightly cloudy deep orangey gold with a small off white head that fades quickly to a sheet and leaves a bit of sparse lace. Nose is pine, grapefruit and orange zest, caramel, honey and some light floral notes. Taste is a medium light sweetness of honey and candied apricot and a much more pronounced medium+ bitterness driven by pine and grapefruit. Medium+ slick body with slightly soft carbonation and a long bitter finish.

For å være en øl jeg ikke forventet å like, så overasket denne. En IPA som faktisk er drikkbar. Veldig nøytral i smaken, egentlig ikke noe som utpeker seg. Man kjenner at det er en double IPA. Tilnærmet ingen ettersmak. Anbefales som en lettdrukket IPA.

0,355 l pullo @ Teerenpeli Kamppi. Lähes kirkas kullanruskea, vähän sakkainen. Tuoksuu keksiltä! Ihanan makeaa mallasta, vähän humalaa. Maussa paahteisen keksin makuista mallasta, todella kivasti humala viimeistelee maun. Myös karamellia hiukan. Onpa kiva!

0,355l bottle, kindly donated by friend, Pours slightly hazy, almost clear rich golden liquid, big frothy white head, Aroma: lot of hops, pine, caramel, grapefruit, resin, candied orange, apricot, Taste: medium sweet, heavy bitter, light to medium sour, rich, grapefruit, orange, apricot, pine, resin, caramel, malty, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, slick to creamy mouthfeel, long bitter fruity aftertaste, Overall: enjoyed, very good IPA, well ballanced, easy drinkable yet strong and full flavored.

330ml bottle served in regular glass. Purchased and enjoyed in Hong Kong.
 
A: Pours a beautiful orange to amber color forming a medium and very creamy yellow head with good retention. Forms tons of thin lingering and molasses lacings in the glass.
.

S: Sweet nose. Strong notes of toffee, caramel malts, resin and honey. Strong notes of grapefruit and orange zest. Hints of pine, honey, grass and pineapple.

T: Sweet upfront. Strong notes of caramel, crystal malts, honey, grapefruit, orage zest and resin. Strong bitternes. Biscuity. Good bittersweet balance.

M: Heavy body. Medium carbonation. Persistent toffee, grapefruit and resin in the aftertaste.

O: Excellent drinkability. Masterpiece!
Aroma is hoppy, fruity, some pine. It’s potent. Sweet body with a sweet and hoppy finish. The alcohol is masked and it has a strong IPA flavor. A very wet IPA.

12oz bottle. Clear orange combo with a white head. Light body. Mild hops pine grapefruit flavor. Citrus orange pine aroma. Very easy drinking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Golden coloured with a large white head. Aroma is hoppy (grass, citrus and pine) and malty (caramel and bread). Taste reflects the aroma, but is more sweet. Medium bodied. Medium bitterness. Medium carbonation.
A solid IPA with particularly well balanced body/aroma/taste. Quite creamy and soft with sweet grapefruit bitterness and juicy malts. Nothing to add. A solid IPA and a reference.

pours orange amber with a nice cap that last. Lots of lacing. Aroma is citrus, pine and floral hops, grapefruit and bready malt. Flavor is much the same. Medium bodied. Moderate carbonation. Very nice lasting dry bitter finish. Really nice IPA and nicely priced for the quality.

This is a nice beer it's got a great hop start that continues throughout a little hint of fruitiness and then back into the Hops again is it finishes off really nice beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured into a tulip glass. A nice copper color and a sudsy white head that leaves some creative lacing. Aroma is purely hops with a little citrus and a lot of pine and floral. Taste is very well balanced with malt keeping the massive amounts of hops from being bitter. Palate is perfect for a big IPA; heavy but not thick. I’m a huge fan! Too many IPAs now are just bitter assaults on my taste buds...like they have something to PROVE. This one has nothing to prove.
slightly cloudy amber color; nice hoppy aroma - floral and citrus hop notes; nice citrusy, floral hop flavor on a medium bodied, bready malt base

29/01/16. Bottle @ Teerenpeli. Clear light copper color with white head. Nice hoppy and fruity aroma, fresh hops. Rich malty body with fresh hops. Dry balanced and lenghty taste. Really well crafted dipa.
One of the best IPA I have ever drank :) the taste and smell is just perfect !!

35cl bottle. Clear orange pour with a tall and sticky white head. Smells of citrus and tropical fruit hops, as well as pine hop dankness and caramel. Super malty body, bitter-sweet and syrupy, with notes of grapefruit, papaya and pine resin. The alcohol is present, but well incorporated. A very malt-forward IPA, not my favourite way of brewing this style, but it has its strong points.

Bottle from Delucci’s Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is fruity, citrus peels, sweet pine, mild wet earthiness. Taste is fresh marmalade, tropical fruits, wet rinds. A really fresh IIPA with loads of character and extremely drinkable.

Orange amber, quickly disappearing thin head and decent lacing. Citrus peel, resinous, earthy. A bitter wallop up front with even more bitterness on the wash. At 8.2abv and 72.41 I.B.U. this is some serious brew. 
More great stuff from Lagunitas. 
 $10.99/12oz bottle sixer at Publix Boca Raton Florida.
Dank, pine and citrus in the aroma and taste. Copper clear with white head. Smooth. Decent ipa.
Golden and white. Amazing resinous and juicy aroma and taste. Bright then fruity. Slick and oily finish

pours amber gold with a thick off white head. Aroma is orange citrus and sweet floral. Wow! Great orange grapefruit citrus taste. Bright then bitter. juicy, resinous mouth feel. Long bitter linger and pleasant in the sinuses. This is right in my wheelhouse! Great great great IPA!
Pours golden with a bit of green appearance. Bready malt with with a citrus and grass hop finish.

Draught@Vastarannan kiiski. Amber color, rich tan head. Piny hop aroma. Strong flavor with caramel malts, resiny hops, citric notes, bit of warming alcohol. Full body, medium carbonation. Thick mouthfeel. Nice.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a clear golden orange with a thin white head. Sweet citrus and some light pine aroma. Clingy and slightly oily. Fairly smooth with light bitterness on the tongue and roof of the mouth. Taste is mostly citrus rind. Not too bitter or harsh but it has a very dry finish. Not bad but not my favorite.

Pours clear golden. Fairly hoppy. Citrus, pine, malt, caramel. Medium body and bitterness. A very good IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

8.2%ABV. IPA.

Poured out a deep Amber. 16ºSRM.

Nose is sweet over-ripe pineapple. Nose has a round sweetness reminiscent of a port or sherry.

Mouthfeel is sudsy. There is adequate carbonation. The palate has roasted malty flavors that are nutty, caramel, toasted cracked barley bread, creme brulee, The palate is very sweet and and sticky, sticky date pudding and molasses come to mind. Hops are pronounced with pine, resin and some nice bitterness, not agressive or hyssop.

Finish is medium. Pleasant.

Goes on Favorites List!
Bottle. Clear golden color, white head. Aroma of grapefruit and pine. Taste is sweet, with bitter pine resin at the finish. Nice.

Aroma: Pine, butter. Appearance: Copper with huge white head that leaves the most lacing I’ve ever seen. It’s like a DIPA float. Taste: Citrus, not a whole lot of hops or pine. Not too bitter. Palate: Medium body.
Aroma is malt, caramalt and hops. Taste is the same but with bisquit and some pine as well. A fine bitterness that not taking over everything, fine balanced.

Clear gold, light head. ARoma is tropical fruity, pine resin. Nice. TAste is slick, malty but smooth and fairly dry, fairly sweet but not overly. Clean toasty chaulky malt, resiny, pine and fruit.Orange. Some sweetness balanced with a pine candy finish.

12oz bottle on 28-Dec-2015, purchased at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam. - poured into a stemmed tulip glass.  Clear golden amber colour with a large white head. Medium body with soft carbonation. Aroma of sweet malt, candy apple, citrus and pine. Bitter grapefruit, orange peel, tropical fruits, caramel, hops and sweet malt. Excellent lacing down the glass.  A really well balanced quality Double IPA.
Beautiful amber color with persistent head. Nice Belgium lacing. Strong sharp floral aroma. Flavor of herbs. Earthy hop finish with slight toasty malt finish.

The hoppy aroma is perfect and I strongly suggest using a sniffer glass to enjoy this. Very strong on taste but balanced, robust is the perfect word. The appearance when first poured is also perfect with a rich white head on a golden platform only problem is the head dissipates quickly. Taste is perfecto for an imperial IPA just the right amount of bitter hops with a bit of sweetness. Full bodied on the palate with a soft carbonated taste and a long finish. A well crafted beer that would par with a steak or a burger.

Pours beautiful clear amber with big creamy off-white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, caramel and light floral. Taste is bitter and sweet, light alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter hoppy finish. A great double ipa.

Bottle. Pours amber with a lasting bubble off white head. Aroma of biscuit, orange, pine, caramel. Taste is of grapefruit, grassy, citrus, caramel, burnt notes on the finish. Slick oily mouthfeel, sticky, medium carbonation.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear copper with strong white head. Floral, hops with some citrus and grass. Strongly malty that’s almost covered by the bitterness. Loads of hops in this one yet malty, not caramel base. Medium body with lively carbonation and a long, bitter finish. A great DIPA that isn’t just a copy of all the other great DIPAs.

Smell is malty yeast smell lacking I feel like the citrus hop smell behind a good IPA. Appearance is a nice light to medium orange golden color. Taste starts off multi with a heavy booze flavor followed by a nice crisp citrus hop flavor. The malt boozy flavor lingers on your tongue a bit too long. All in all nice IPA wish it was a little boozy

Great beer. Will try again. Another quality offering from Lagunitas. Need to try again to give updated review and more detail. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dusty orange peel and orange biscuit malt aroma. Golden yellow with large fluffy off white head. Very sweet orange malt and strong bitter grapefruit peel/pine flavor. Good body.

Pours a slightly hazy, dark golden orange color with apricot edges and a one finger, white foam head that quickly settles into a lasting ring. Rings and spots of soapy left behind. 

Earthy, floral hop aroma with some grassy pine and oily resins countered by a faint citrus fruit presence and a sweet malt backbone. The malt presence is a bit stronger than I expect/prefer with hints of caramel, toffee, biscuit and cracker hindering the grassy hop character. 

Medium body with a blast of dank, earthy hop bitterness that lingers over hints of sweet tropical/citrus fruit and a caramel malt backbone into a bone dry finish. Better balanced and more complex than the aroma suggests. Dry and sticky with grassy pine, spruce tip and resinous hop oils followed by hints of juicy grapefruit, orange pith, pineapple and mango. The intense hop profile is countered by a malt backbone with strong caramel sweetness, toffee and toasted bread. The malt presence is stronger than I usually prefer but in this beer it provides excellent balance without hindering the complex hop flavors. The high ABV is excellently masked with a touch off boozy sweetness in the finish but there’s no heat to speak of. Complex, flavorful and dangerously drinkable. Another very solid beer from Lagunitas.

A wonderful vibrant burnt orange with a creamy and lacy bright white head. Stone fruit hop aromas, with a hint of pineapple too and sweet malts - mainly toffee. Well balanced, great malty flavours - biscuit and crumble with some nice tropical hop favours, pineapple and grapefruit. Nice and dense, creamy mouthfeel and well carbonated.

Very good strong IPA. Good price. Golden Amber with a full body. A decadent beer if you will. Very hoppy grapefruit Beginning but immediate balance with a creamy caramel ending. It can be very filling.
This beer pours with a firm white head and a nice appearance in amber. Clear taste of hops and a great final. Powerful and full taste and long lasting palate.

Btl pours a beautiful clear golden color. Big tight compact head the slowly fades leaving lots of lace on glass. Aromas of pine, citrus fruit, earth and some dankness. Tastes of grapefruit, lemon zest, sweet caramel and evergreen tree sap. Thick body, coating almost sticky mouthfeel, good carbonation and a bitter finish. This beer is sweet but the hops balance it out nicely. Alcohol content is hidden very well. Bold fresh hop aromas and flavor make this beer very enjoyable!

12 oz bottle - pours a clear copper color with a thin soapy like head. The aroma is lighter than I would’ve guessed but still has some pine, citrus zest, peach and a hint of caramel malt. A mouthful is bitter and smooth. Mostly standard IPA flavors with a good malt structure.

Bomber pours a clear orange/amber color under a thick bone-colored head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is full of piney hops and caramel, with some citrus and tropical fruits. Taste is bitter upfront, with lots of caramel sweetness in the middle with a dry, slightly dank finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Body is medium to full with average carbonation and a slightly oily mouthfeel. I’ve enjoyed this one several times (thanks to Lagunitas’ reasonable bomber pricing) and can’t believe I haven’t rated it until now. Along with Hop Stoopid, this is one of my go-to IIPAs.

Flaske 330ml fra Systembolaget Kiruna. Drukket på Rundvannet 2 Aug 15. Gyldenbrun. Middels høyt skum som flater fort ut. Litt lacing. Dempet ferskenaroma. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken litt syrlig. Hint av sitron & fersken. Tørr bitter avslutning.

Look; off white head, clear amber golden body. Aroma; resin, pine, peels, fruity malts, grapefruit. Taste; resiny malts, peels, berries, grapefruit, ananas pineapple - leading to a balanced solid finish in malts and resin. On palate strong, solid, slightly sticky. Overall; bitter sipper.
