[35.5cl btl, abv8.2%, BB10.06.2016, B@Systembolaget]

A favorite, spruce, resin and citrus hits the nose. Golden orange and clear, thick head. 
A very full flavor, with lots of maltyness and fresh hops, not that bitter a good balance. Overall a very nice brew...
Bottle from Systembolaget. White/beige, creamy head. Amber body. Smells of hops, apple, citrus, grass, caramel. Tastes very bitter and hoppy. Apple, pineapple, grass, plums.
Bottle. Dark golden body with a lively white head. Aroma is grassy with malt. Taste of pine, hay and grapefruit, with a sweet maltbase. High bitterness, spicy and piney aftertaste.

Lagunitas Maximus has a thick, frothy, bone-colored head, a clear, somewhat bubbly, orange appearance, and splotchy lacing left on the glass. The aroma is of piney (but, not so piney) hop oil, and sweet bread. Taste is the same, and the bitterness is there, but not at all harsh. Mouthfeel is high medium and oily, and Lagunitas Maximus finishes on the dry side. RJT

Bottle 65cl / Botella 65cl.
@ Lucky Supermarket, San Bruno, CA, USA
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Hops, citrusy, resinous / Lupulo, citrico, resinoso.

Flaska från SB. Superklar guldorange med högt fluffigt vitt skum som lämnar rester utmed kanterna. Riktigt fräsch citrus, rejält med perfekt mogen mango, passionsfrukt, lite ananas. I bakgrunden beska från kåda och apelsinskal. Kroppen något åt det större hållet med riktigt klibbig humle. Absurt humledominerad från början till slut. Kåda, grankotte, knäck, seg kola. Fin övergång från det friska i doften till de tyngre tonerna i smaken. Dekadent smaskigt.
Strong hops and citrus. Malt. Pine. A little tropical fruit. Delicious and well made beer.

Orange amber with a tight lasting frothy off-white head and sticky lacing. Aroma bursts with pungent hops. Grapefruit. Orange. Pine. Flavor follows. High bittersweet. A touch and alcohol that works in seamlessly. Enough sweet caramel maltiness to handle to keep all the hops from dominating. Really great balance. Just a fantastic well-made DIPA.

Beautiful pour, amber, great foamy head with IPA aromas. Foam diminishes a little, first taste is awesome, tastes like a subdued IPA, but it’s an ale. Alcohol is not present at first , but it is there. Resins, pine aromas are forward, but controlled. 

Great beer, one of the best.

Bottle poured a clear orange hue w/ large creamy lasting white head and nice lacing. Bold sweet citrus aroma. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a bold bitter finish. Tastes are orange, grapefruit, and straw.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Orange color nice a fruity and piney taste. Has a big bold hops tastes. Great Ipa
caramel, resin, floral, herbs, earthy, leaves, fruitygolden, hazy, frothy, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, lively, bitter,

Holy tropical citrus pinecones. Damn, this is fanfuckingtastic. I’ve had this beer before and it was awesome but this bottle is out of this world. Gigantic pine and citrus on the aroma with a big tropical presence as well. Lots of grapefruit, papaya, mango and pineapple. Taste is full of big sweet tropical fruits and pine needle dry bitterness. Big and hoppy and theres no weird sweet maltiness to make it gross. Just a big in your face ipa. I’m loving this and I’ve had it before but this bottle is just too good for words. I’m crushing it and should probably slow down before it crushes me back. Cheers!!!

Bottle from Stone in Asagaya. Pours a clear copper with a small soapy off-white head that lingers throughout. Light aromas of orange, grapefruit and some caramel. Taste is more of the same with an orange marmalade character taking over as it warms up. Average carbonation with a nice bitter finish that lingers. A little sweet but still solid.

An excellent example of jigh amounts of malt and hops, without the overpowering sweetnes that can come from the malts. Lots of grassy fresh notes mixed with citrusfruits and some pines. Quite long lasting bittreness with a rich body. Its a nice everyday imperial ipa!

Bottle. Pours a clear golden body with a fairly large and dense offwhite head. Nice aroma of resin, pine, citrus and loads of malty caramel. Taste is somewhat balanced, but fairly bitter. Caramelly malts at first, into grassy and resinous hops. Finish is a light, lasting bitterness. Medium body and avg + co2.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear dark golden, white large head that leaves rich lacing. Sweet aroma, orange marmalade, biscuits, pine. Oily smooth mouthfeel, low carbonated. Taste is sweet, biscuits, caramel, bread, apricot, dark dried fruit. Mild bitter finish.

Pours in a golden amber color with longlasting line of white head. The aroma consists of hop, malt, tropical fruits, honey and pinapple. The flavour is hoppy and sweet with citrus, tropical fruit and honey.

Tap. Black Swan, Leeds. Clear amber colour. Thin, tight, lasting, white head. Big, thick, chewy malts. Sweet, grainy and fruity. Big, chewy orange hop bolted on to that. Some spice, along the lines of cinammon or fresh ginger. Taste is soft, sugary sweet. Turns juicy, rich, zesty bitter. Full, smooth, easy drinking mouthfeel. Finishes relatively short bitter, with a spicy, sweet close. Very nice.

Bottled 07/15/15. Pours very beautiful clear golden, with a white head. Aroma is dank hops (mostly that), sweet malts, then tangerine, pineapple, a tropical fruit note (mango? guava?). Flavor is hoppy and sweet up front, interplay between the two is beautiful, light citrus and tropical fruit notes, honey, dankness again. Medium-soft mouthfeel. Really nice. I like this one quite a bit.
Bottle 33 cl. Golden, clear with a nice foamy head. Aroma of grapes, Orange, malt, hops and citrus. Medium bitter, lift sweet with a soft Hoppy end, alc is well hidden.
Shared bottle. Clear golden orange colour. Pine, resin aroma and flavour, thin body for its strength

Pours a clear golden orange with a big frothy white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, grapefruit and resin. Taste is pine, grapefruit, citrus rinds and a huge sweet malty two row bill that’s balanced by the bitter hops and a semi dry finish. Super smooth and easy to drink for its high abv.

355 ml. bottle from Systembolaget, poured in to a Snifter. Clear, amber colour with a golden tint. Dense, off-white head. Fruity aroma with spruce, citrus, resin and caramel malts. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body with a oily texture and an average carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits, pines and caramel malts. Rather straightforward IIPA without any surprises. Enjoyable, trough.
I just haven’t cared for IPAs for a while. Too hoppy. If you like that style, you’ll enjoy this.
A sweet IPA, good taste but not fantastic. This was too sweet for my taste.

Pours a clear copper dark gold color with huge creamy head. Aroma is citrus hops and spice and a bread malt note. Taste following the aroma well. The flavors are strong and solid. This is one amazing beer leaving solid malt rings all the way down to the bottom of my glass!!  And a great price! Its safe to say its the best bang for the buck.
From tap. Unclear orange color with white head. Hoppy and malty aroma, citrusy fruity, pine, grass, caramel. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

22 oz into glass. Clear bright copper. Nice white head pretty stable with decent lacing. Aroma of pine and citrus. Maybe passion fruit? A hint of hops. 
Taste refreshing with moderate residual bitterness from the hops. Can't believe it's 8.2 abv. Or that it's 72 IBU. A fantastic IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tried this in a 20 oz bottle my son bought me for my birthday.   For an IPA I was quite amazed,  it was very pleasant,  had a more than expected floral flavor which improved the normal IPA bitterness.   My son bought it at World Mart in Keizer. 

 -Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Aroma: sweet notes, appricot, honey, passion fruit.
Appearance: hazy amber color, thin white head.
Taste: high bitterness (passion fruit), citrus notes, malty, something like honey notes, semi-sweet.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Really good IIPA, really drinkable and complex.

Typisches Imperial IPA.
Exotisch hopfig, dazu Karamell.
Mango, Grapefruit, Orange im Aroma und Geschmack. Insgesamt leider zu bitter.

Refrigerated 12 oz. squat bottle poured into s a snifter. Clear Amber with small off-white head. Aroma is light herbal hops and malt backbone, medium/thick body, low carbonation, and some small-bubble lacing. Taste is bitter hops and strong malt backbone. Lots of flavor, but not that hoppy.

Good colour, clean aroma with notes of cereal and citrus with slight resinous overtones. Smooth yet snappy entrance to palate, with more zesty citrus backed my good malty notes with distinct resinous overtones. Strong.
12oz bottle. Light hoppy nose. Typical double, decent balance, though not enough to mask the abv.
Creamy heading, light amber colour, lots of hops on the nose, creamy mouthfeel, less hops than the nose, more malty. I like it though!
Fairly good. Dank and fairly bitter. I remember other bottles as way more of tropical fruits, could this be batch variation maybe?
Bottle at Corner Bar, Beijing. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of pine and citrus. Sweet finish. Was expecting a lot more, a case of Brewdogesque style over substance?

Wow! This beer is a mouthful. Nice sweet notes on the nose and a slightly caramel taste on the finish that are balanced nicely by the dry hops flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear, medium-dark amber with huge off white head. Smells like Mosaic hops with a delicious citrus & almost fruit punch like aroma. Very smooth bitterness & mouth feel with a noticeable alcohol presence.

Awesome beer. Refreshing hops with some fruit hints amid the fresh hop punch. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The bottle of Maximus cautions that drinking it might strip the enamel from your teeth. While I wouldn’t go that far, Maximus definitely tastes like one of the hoppiest beers Lagunitas has ever made. Maximus pours a clear, light shade of orange. The head is fluffy and lacy. Aroma is redolent of wet pine, fresh spruce, some malt, booze, and citrus. Flavor’s got sharp pine, tropical hops (orange and peach are definitely noticeable), caramel malt, a trace of honey, and boozy sweetness. Mouthfeel is crisp from the hops and warm from the alcohol. You’ll definitely notice a sticky, lingering bitterness. Are you not entertained? [Arms outspread.]

Bottle@Kaisla, Helsinki, Finland. Medium/strong aroma with sweet peach and caramel. Deep orange color with small white head and lightly hazy liquid. Strong, round taste with peach. Balanced with tasty hoppiness. Narrow taste spectrum and long hoppy, fruity aftertaste. Medium/strong body with medium carbonation. Very high quality DIPA with simple but superb taste.
Pours clear golden. Aroma is balanced hops and malts. Taste is nicely balanced, but a lot of hop botrerness lingering, as it should be.

(from notes)
A - limited but long-lasting head; yellow-orange color. well carbonated

S- floral and citrusy hops! bittersweet; alcohol evident

T - hops; good complexity [from multiple varieties?]. IBU = 72, but there’s a good bit of sweet malt flavor too. 

made of "hops, malt, hops, hops, yeast, hops, water and hops" (label) - lol

A brew for hop-heads, although not exceptionally hoppy for an American DIPA.

Bottle: clear, deep straw with just a hint of copper. Thick head and lots of lace. Moderate hop lift with stone fruit. Slightly reductive. Slightly dull. Lacks the huge lift of Sucks. Subtle malt profile. Dry, not sour and bitter. The palate is very resinous, rubbery and bitter. Not a big fan of this flavor profile and beer. 
This is rubbish compared to some of there other beers.

Aroma is pine needle, citrus, clove, crystal malts and caramel. Taste is crisp malts, honey and caramel. The hop profile is deep and very well balanaced. Grapefruit, passionfruit, clove and pine needle. Finishes quite smoothly for the amount of hop character and abv. Appearance is a cloudy gold with a medium head that retains pretty well.Solid beer.

I guess I am going agains the tide on this one and rating it a bit higher than most. Beer poor a rich coppery color with a white mostly diminishing head. Slight amount of lacing but all in all a nice appearance...Aroma is clearly hoppy with sent of pine and citrus predominant. Flavor is a little short of the hop promise but nicely balanced with a decent malt backbone supporting a moderately hopped beer. Plate is good at between a three and a four. Not a bad choice for an IPA when Dogfish 90 is just a little to stout.

Gets whacked early from the hop smash. Pine and resin. Oily, fruity and a hint of the alcohol but a reasonably soft finish. Good perfume in glass. Like a pot pourri. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great aroma with citrus, pine, and a little flowery hops. Bitter, fruity taste with citrus and a little underlying caramel. Fruit, pine, and alcohol in the finish. Overall a fine effort.
Vraiment très bonne quoique un peu terne visuellement... Les houblons sont bien dosés et l’alcool ne prend pas toute la place comme plusieurs comparables. Un beau cadeau de la part d’un collègue ;-)

Mycket god öl med en distinkt smak av humle, ölet passar utmärkt till grillad flankstek ala tex mex osv. Jag upplevde en känsla av rus efter den åttonde flaskan, detta öl avnjutes särskilt i sällskap av nära fränder och övriga människor, inte att förväxlas med sofiero eller åbro.
Poura amber red with thick bubbly head, with palate of citrus and hops with hints of caramel.

Pours orange with a large white head. Smells earthy with some solid citrus notes. Taste is juicy citrus with a caramel sweetness backbone. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Lagunitas Maximus finishes with a soft lingering bitterness.

12oz bottle into a tumbler. Pours a slightly opaque golden colour with lastig white head and lots of lacing. Subtle, pleasant nose of pine hops, light citrus. Some malt. Slightly sweet, but not overpoweringly so; light bitter finish. Very pleasant.
Bottle 33cl. Dark golden with a nice big white foamy head. Nose has hints of fresh hops and citrus. Nice balance between rich malt and bitter hops. Very good beer. Medium length.

Draught@ home.
Amber filtered, thick white head. Floral nose, white pepper. Little artificial though. Full flavour, not too thick or sweet, dried apricot, figs. Boozy, herby finish.

Keg at Drygate. Clear amber beer with a thin head. Dry, sour fruit aroma. Flavour is crisp refreshing fruit, a slightly sour grapefruit hint, with bitter hop cutting through it perfectly to stop it being sickly. Leaves an almost too-sweet aftertaste but again, it’s just right with a certain tartness there. Tremendous beer.

Bottle. Pours a clear amber gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges .Aroma has pine hops with a bit of citrus bitterness and some light grains backing. Flavor has bitter citrus up front with growing pine and resin and a sweet grain backbone.
good IPA but a bit too malty, the hops did not shine through. resin, citrus, alcohol, medium body, average carbonation, bitter

Dark caramel, peach, orange peel, pine tree. Caramalt, dry apricot, mango, passion fruit, orange jam, minty hops, touch of alcohol, dry peppery finish. Outstanding iipa, massive complex fruity hops yet very smooth and drinkable.

Pours a stunning amber/copper color. It has excellent lacing and the smallest bit of head retention. Tastes sweet and a bit of alcohol. Drinks very easy and doesn’t finish too hoppy, which is rare for a DIPA. A memorable beer.
Dark in appearance. malty to the taste. Nice smooth beer but definitely filling

Aroma floral, citrus, 
Appearance golden, amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate medium body, lively, 
Overall not a super happy ipa but very refreshing and I would suggest this beer to a friend

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 14C). Bottle 35 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: intense and nice hop aroma with mild notes of grapefruit with a pine and resinous character. sweet malty background provides a good support. APPEARANCE: gold ambar color and slightly hazy. medium ivory head with good retention. TASTE: balanced malty sweet flavour, with hop notes (grapefruit, pine, resin). high bitterness that lingers well beyond a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium body with moderate carbonation. no astringency. mild alcohol warming. OVERALL: a very good example of an Imperial IPA. Recommended.

Bottle. Pours a translucent, dull orange with soapy white head. Aroma is grass, hay, caramel, and some resinous hops. Taste is lightly sweet, quite bitter. Hides the alcohol well. This is and will continue to be a staple beer I keep going back to.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours clear amber, two finger off white head. decent lacing with some retention. Aroma of pine and herbs. Taste is on the sweet side balanced with earthy bitterness. Full bodied, lively carbonation, sticky mouth feel. Finishes bitter sweet with tasting notes of grass, herbs, pine, cantaloupe, caramel and alcohol. Not as good as expected but not bad.

Pours a hazy amber with a frothy average white head. Earthy aroma heavy on the hops with some citrus. Flavour wasn’t as hoppy as I expected -- bitter, spicy and a bit malty. I found I could taste the alcohol a bit too much. May have been served a little too warm.
Flaske fra systembolaget. Noe uklar gylden farge. Moderat karbonert med hvit skumtopp. Smaker grapefrukt, noe furunål, noe karamell. Merker lite til alkoholen. Ganske god
When first poured and tasted a strong bitter hop flavor is overwhelmingly present. After it has warmed for a bit a more balanced sweet melon and hop flavor is present.
Aroma is sweet and hoppy. Even with 72 ibu, didn’t feel it was too bitter. Extra alcohol is noticeable in a good way. More of a sip and enjoy IPA rather than one you chug. Very solid IPA.
Old rating. Pretty standard Cali DIPA. Big caramel, biscuit body, huge bitter hop crunch. Piney.
Pours a clear amber with a foamy white head. Smells of citrus and pine. Taste is bitter and sweet biscuits citrus hops.

Bottle. Golden, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate to full, malty and sweetish aroma, light caramel and some tropical fruitiness, piney - light grapefruit hoppyness. Body is medium malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish flavor, light caramel and tropical fruitiness, some piney hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and lightly sweetish, light caramel, some piney - light citrus hoppyness, faint alcohol. Nice aroma but flavor/finish lacks bitterness and body. OK DIPA but nothing special.
Keg at the Hare and Billet, Blackheath. Amber pour with a beige head. Tangerine and tropical fruit aroma. Mango, citrus and pear flavour. Boozy mouthfeel. Sweet, fruity finish. Tasty.
Citrusy, bitter, and crisp. Need I say more? Very enjoyable, will drink again.
Bomber pour..a solid example of a dipa..tasty with good bitterness and malt presence..mmhmm

Aug ’14. A 0.355 l bottle from some Systembolaget in or around Stockholm. It poured clear amber body with medium sized head. Strong citrus, herbal, spicy and other hop aromas were balanced with typical IPA biscuit malt. Quite bitter flavor, various hop bitterness, too, also rounded with biscuit and fine jaffa cakes malt. Needs some time to open up its complexity and to be enjoyed. Hop notes are really divergent, from typical citrus, herbal, pine, to some weird soapy (not bad somehow) bitterness. Fuller in body, only lightly bitter finish, more of the malt now overtakes for longer aftertaste and fuller enjoyment. Excellent!

22 oz bomber in an English pint. Clear orange pour, minimal off white head. Lotsa hops on the nose and then some pine. Citrus is a bit strong upfront then the malt comes thru.

This is a PFG brew. Sometimes I have a hard time with IPA’s at first. It takes a bit to appreciate the hoppy ones.
Mostly clear amber with a little white head that leaves a bit of lace. Nice hoppy aroma, piney with a hint of citrus. Flavor is smooth, not very bitter. Not bad.

Bottle. Mostly clear deep golden color with a medium sized foamy off -white head. Aroma of peach and grapefruit. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium body.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

From a 12 ounce bottle (this is becoming among my favorite American breweries). Pours a beautiful copper with a pinky of head. Our favorite nose of pine tar/piñones. The taste is done well. A hint of bitter that lingers and transitions into sweet/candy taste, but done well. Alcohol is hidden. A very good beer.

Edited for spelling/grammar.

355mL bottle from Slowbeer....numbers make no sense to me?
Pale copper gold body, holds a creamy white head.
Punchy hop nose; lots of pine sap & cut grass, woody spices, dried leafy herbs, with a backbone of biscuity malt.
Full body, moderate carbonation, resiny, oily, chewy, long on the palate.
Succulent palate, dripping with hops; citrus, pine, sap, cedar, dried bay, eucalyptus, all tempered (to a degree) with toasty biscuity malts. Bitterness is aggressive without being astringent. Warming finish, begs another sip.
Well crafted, intensely flavoured DIPA. Excellent balance.

35cl Bottle from Craft&Draft. Clear Amber/orange colour, white head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, resin, some tropical fruits, light citrus. Not nearly as hoppy as I hoped. Flavour is medium sweet, malty, caramel, resin, grass, citrus, light fruity, decent bitter finish. Medium bodied. Lacks a whole lot of hops, guess they got killed on the way over to NL. BB 12-2015.

Niente di indimenticabile. Birra amara, in teoria,ma con un bel bilanciamento. Color ambrato carico,bella schiuma, odore di caramello e resina, erba. In bocca c’è una buona dplcezza dei malti che nonneccede, ed un buon tono amaro resinoso quasi terroso, lungo abbastanza. Buona ma non indimenticabile
11.3.2014. Fresh, grapefruit, grassy aroma. Taste is grassy, fruity, grapefruity, bitter.
caramel, bread, orange, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, umami, medium body, creamy, average carbonation. Very good IPA, I like the Lagunita style!

Bottle to snifter. Looks good; a mostly transparent orange with foamy off-white head. Smells of bitter hops with a bittersweet malt backbone. Tastes like it smells with some juicy hop notes as well. Mouthfeel is medium to medium full-bodied and a touch hot. Still, enjoyable.
Copper color. Mostly clear but some floating particles. Smells and tastes of citrus hops and some pine. Grapefruit. Eh. Low carbonation.

To me, Lagunitas’s ales and IPA’s are some of the finest regulars out there. This beer looks awesome in my glass: copper/orange, clear as water, lots of carbonation from the bottom of the glass, nice foamy white head... it looks fabulous! Aromas are citrucy, hoppy, malty as well. Taste is mango, a bit of caramel, brown sugar and malts. Super well balance on the tongue with a fine bitter ending! I give 3 for palate because I find the mouthfeel a bit dry wich reduces it’s body that could have been a bit more round to my taste. Still a great everyday beer!

Flaska systembolaget. Kodafärgad vätska med ljusgult skum. Sötaktig humledoft. Sirap och halm. Maltig smak med sirapslimpa, farinsocker och touch av torkad frukt. Koncentrerad smak med mycket sötma och bra beska.

Bottle from ABC. Pours a gorgeous and sparkling orange amber with a robust frothy head. Super strong hop aromas - grass, floral, citrus. Taste follows suit - very sweet, slightly bitter, and maybe some faint bread malt that I missed on the nose. Medium-bodied and somewhat dry on the finish. Third or fourth time having this beer and it remains a top-tier IPA for me. Acquire.

Bottle from harvest market. 
Deep golden color. Big pine and resin. Rich caramel maltiness. Nice brew.

Bottle at home while visiting Jacksonville. Pours gold with a very slightly off white head. Caramel, pine, lemon aroma. Medium body, medium carbonation. Lightly sticky, with pine caramel, lemon, grass, sticky sap, light orange, grapefruit. Decent, sweet but not overly so, tasty enough.

Pours an almost clear amber with whiteish head. Big, tropical fruit hoppiness with mangoes, preserved peaches and some pine cones. Slightly caramelly maltiness. Juicy aroma. The palate is medium+ bodied with some sweetness and a nice kick of bitterness on the finish. Pretty well balanced for the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is sweet, piney, and resinous, with hints of garden flowers and butterscotch. Mouthfeel is creamy and sweet throughout, with a slightly bitter finish.
Excellent IIPA. After just having a regular IPA this came on very strong a bitter just like I like them. Lots of fresh hop flavor with just enough malt to balance.
Pours clear dark golden. Nose is tropical fruit, floral hops. Taste matches, fruity, hoppy, a bit bitter on the finish. Sweet overall. It's fine, I prefer their standard ipa.
Drucken på fat. Klart bärnstensfärgad med vitaktig skumkrona. Försiktigt söt, med smak av tropiska frukter, malt och citrus. Välbalanserad bärs, med fin efterbeska. Toppen!
Bottle from CBB. Clear gold with a small white head. Huge pine hop aroma with some malts. Super bitter hop profile with nice caramel malts.

Pours a deep gold color almost to copper. Thick white head that lasts with tons of lacing. Tremendous hop aroma of citrus and almost fresh cut grass. A caramel malt flavor. Dry and lingering bitterness in the finish.

c’est très très bon. Really. Une robe brun doré avec pas mal de truc en suspension. Un nez robuste. Une belle ampleur en bouche. Des notes cidrées et acidulées qui se déploient sur une longeur conséquentes. Assèche bien le palais et excite les papilles qui en redemandent. Et en même temps, il ya une certaine douceur ou rondeur. L’étiquette de la bouteille en fait pas des tonnes et sait rester discrète tout en distillant quelques petites phrases amusantes. Vraiment, un ensemble très séduisant.
A great tasting beer. Enjoy it with food or by itself. A 22oz beer that goes down like a 12 oz beer. What does that tell you.
I was a bit nervous at 8.2 abv, but really good IPA. Had at Chicago TapRoom..........
Pours golden with a small head. Citrus and alcohol in the aroma. Tastes of grass,hops and some citrus and alcohol. Good bitterness! Overall a good Dipa.

Well balanced with a great hop kick. Fun to drink. Would love to grab a pint of this at a bar 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This hop heavy beer is definitely a crowd pleaser in a room of IPA drinkers but beware the ABV will catch up quickly on summer days.

Copper pour with two fingers of fluffy white head. Great looking. Aromas of pine and grapefruit, with some malty hints of biscuit and bread. Flavors translate from aromas, with a very smooth semi-sweet mouthfeel. Good stuff as always from Lagunitas!
Flaska från SB. Bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Doft av rostad malt och en del fruktighet från humlen. Brödig och spritig med en hel del trevlig humle.
Not sure if this is a double IPA, but doesn't taste like one. Really nicely balanced beer and almost tastes like a session beer, doesn't seem like 8.9% ABV

Bottle - pours orange gold with a big lacy white head. You know it’s a big beer when you get a hit of the aroma from a distance during the pour. Aroma is pine, citrus, Carmel malt and lots of tropical fruits. Taste hits you with. Bitter twinge that got the saliva glands working. Very dry but with an over note of caramel. The palate is creamy and full and great. Like this one.
Bottle. Direct. Grassy and citrus hop aromas. Lighter grass and herbal hop flavor profile. Not as juicy as ipa, or as intense as hop stoopid, but drinkable none the less.

This beer pours a clear golden amber color with a thick fluffy white head that left a lot of lacing around the glass. The aroma is hop heavy! I am picking up hop resin, pine, citrus, bread malts, and some tropical fruits. The aroma is just outstanding. The taste is full of floral and pine hops. There is quite a bit of citrus and grapefruit in there as well. Even with all the hops this is still well balanced with the bread malts. As you can imagine there is quite a bit of a hop bitterness in this beer. The finish is crisp and refreshing. I really enjoyed this beer and would highly recommend anyone to try it.

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours orange with a creamy head. Aroma is citrus, mandarin, honey and caramel. Body is medium with low to moderate carbonation. Taste is citrus, grassy with a slight honey like sweetness. Finish is harsh and bitter. Awesome
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомендую его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
Bottle. Sweet fruity aroma. Balanced fruity taste, with some sharpness. Quite bitter finish. Good imperial IPA, but not the best I’ve had from Lagunitas.

12oz bottle pours clear amber with 2 finger head. Nose is malty orange, grapefruit and some sticky pine resin and a bit of toasted bread. Taste is malt heavy, sweet round caramel and malty fruit with sticky orange, resin, and piney grapefrut, bitter. Finish is bitter, malty orange, some toast, resin. A bit too malty for my liking.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a beer can glass on 06.03.14.

A: See through amber/orange body. 2 1/2 finger white head. Fantastic lacing.

S: Lots of grapefruit. It also has burnt caramel/brown sugar.

T: Grapefruit and burnt caramel dominate. Flower and hop resin are subtle.

O: This was good, but it was more malt forward than I like. Maybe the bottle was old and the hops faded though.
How: Bottle. Appearance: Clear amber, medium white head. Aroma: Tropical fruits, citrus, caramel. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation.

Pours clear amber with a think cream head. Aroma of resin, grapefruit with hint of alcohol and butter :( This drinks like an IPA, but offers a richer aroma and a decent bitter finish. Would be perfect if not for the diacetyl.

Pours a copper color w/a nice head. Aroma is pine citrus and malt. Taste is initially sweet with a good hop bitterness. Has a very clean taste in his easy drinking. Very solid beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bomber. Pours clear amber with a thick frothy off white head. Tastes like sweet citrus, caramel, light booze, dry malt, and earthy hops. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like caramel, nutty, booze, and citrus hops.

Pours a brilliant orange color with a large creamy white head. Notes of pine needles, apricots, and sunflower seeds, with a nice toasty caramel finish. Great beer really well balanced and not overly hoppy.

Doftar fruktträdsblomster, ananas och honungsbröd. Smaken är en härlig kombination av sötma och beska. Sötman är exotiska växter, så ananasen. Någon blommighet finna också i smaken, svenska sommaråkrar tänker jag på. Fantastisk öl!

Cobrizo limpio y uniforme con espuma marfil. Aromas de miel, frutas tropicales y alcohol. Cuerpo medio-alto con textura melosa, inicio dulce medio muy afrutado, miel y final de amargor moderado ligeramente resinoso.

It pours golden with a slight off white head. It has an aroma of caramel, tropical fruits and , citrus, It has flavors of tropical fruits, pineapple, and caramel. It has a sweet and mildly bitter finish.

Clear deep golden with a foamy sticky white head. The nose has a very pleasant and rich resin and buttered toast aroma with a fair bit of earthy pine--not acidic. Smooth and impressively drinkable with a sweet and charming pale malt grain and toast backbone with pine resin and orange zest bitterness on top. Quenching for a DIPA. lovely.

Dec 2014 - Keg at Euston Tap (18/12/14).  Pretty clear orange, still, big foamy white head, full lacing.  Aroma is sherbet and resin.  Body is medium, foamy, low carbonation.  Taste is orange liquer, sweet caramel, musty, not overly bitter.  Decent.  If it’s going to remove enamel from my teeth as promised, it’ll be the sugar rather than anything else.  (3.6)


Jan 2015 - Keg at Draft House.  Pungent, sweet malt.  Resin.  Same impression. (3.6)

Poured from a bottle. Pours a nice, clear amber. Bold hops and fruit, it's malty, and the alcohol is making it's presence known. Taste is high quality hops jump out immediately. I really enjoy this beer it's quite a good IPA.
Bottle from SB. Now it was some time ago I had this one, but it is as I remember a really good IPA. Strongly recommended!

Pours a pretty clear golden amber with a large creamy dull white head and tons of lace. Aroma is resin, pine, resin, tropical fruits, and sweet pale caramel malts. Taste is resin, pine, earthy, tropical fruits, medium-high bitterness, sweet pale malts, caramel maltiness, and a medium dry finish. Really nice balance with the alcohol known but masked as well.

Good beer with a great taste. Lagunitas always delivers..........................

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very hoppy taste balanced with strong taste of malt and alcohol. I love! They know how to brew a good beer I the US after all.
Sweet malt, hints of strawberry, caramel and hop resin. The alcohol is clearly evident but not overpowering. Nicely balanced, enjoyable beer.
Pours a clear golden color with white head. Pine, citrus, and floral notes on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with hop resin, bitterness, and some sweetness. Well done DIPA.
You can feel the hops for a long time. No foam. Quite nice but not that special.

Clear amber with thin white head. Aroma is sweet artificial flower. Taste is floral perfume. Better than your mass produced yellow frothy stuff, but I would pass on another. Many better ipas, and many better lagunitas.
It was a pretty straight-forward brew. No stand-out flavors or aromas but still very well balanced and good overall.
Bottle from san francisco store... somewhere. Gold color. Thin head. Medium sweetness. Medium bitterness. Aroma is hoppy, fruit, caramel.
Pours a clear amber color. Aroma and taste are toffee, pine, and some fruitiness.

Brilliantly clear amber colour with thin white head. Strong grapefruit and pine aroma with decent caramel backing. Standard, but exemplary. Oily body adds to perceived sweetness. The caramel is nicely balanced with a strong but rounded bitterness. A little alcohol warmth to finish. Nice.

Very citrusy in the beginning - huge overall hops infusion. Does pretty well on the malt backbone as well though. Pours dark amber with good head and lacing. Medium bitter finish. This would be very nice if super fresh. Some peel. Bottle.
Bottle. Aroma has fruits,citrus and hops. Taste is refreshing with long finish. Flavors of citrus, malt, hops and spices.

Draught on keg at Euston Tap. What a strange interpretation of the DIPA style - it smells like perfume & tastes like a mash-up of flowers and Ribena summer fruits! But, I seem to be enjoying its strangeness ...
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours clear golden amber, thin white head. Hop heavy resin aromas, pine too. Taste is bitter, sticky, boozy. Oily texture, bitter finish. Good, but not their best.

Keg and bottle. Hazy golden body with a thin off-white head. Steady carbonation. Great lacing. Aroma of pine, honey and orange. Flavour of pine needles, boozy tangerine, jelly sweets and a peppery, hoppy finish. Medium body with an oily, almost chewy texture. Soft fizz. This brewery knows how to hop an IPA/DIPA.
Really nice smell and color but the taste didn’t live up for me. Getting too much of the alcohol for a 8.2% and the sweetness and bitterness don’t balance well for me.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours deep amber, nose is sweet burnt toffee, pine, taste is salty, crystal malt, pine, sweet.

(350ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours clear medium amber with a moderate bubbly white head that recedes to a small cap with lace. Aroma has a lot of light caramel malt and decent amount of hops, mango, pine, dried stone fruit, hint of alcohol. On the palate, light slightly bready caramel malt core is fairly prominent, apricot, bit herbal, vague tropical notes. More pine resin and bitterness comes from the middle into the finish, honeyish malt sweetness and a bit of grain showing up along with some fruit lingering. Bitterness is pretty average for a DIPA, medium bodied, moderate sharp carbonation, hint of alcohol heat. This seems to have too much malt character (without complexity) relative to hops for me, and the hops are probably faded too. Not bad, but not best of style either.

Golden honey/red crystal. Smells quite floral with some tropical (mango) fruit and the malts. Not overly hopped up aromas, the maltiness really comes through on the nose. Loads of hoppy bitterness at the front with some slight sweetness from the caramel like malts, some pine resin. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Seems like there is too much malt and not enough hops but there is a sticky bitterness that persists making it very worthwhile.
Very hoppy and fresh aroma. Overall a nice DIPA although a bit too sweet for what I prefer a double IPA to be.
On tap. Golden amber with fluffy one finger head. Citrus and pine aroma. Really good, smooth taste of tropical citrus. This is really really good.

This is pure liquid gold. The aroma sends hoppy pine notes straight into your cerebral cortex, and fizzy needles stings your eyes like cactus spines causing your taste buds cringe and pull back into shelter before even tasting it. And the taste, a battle squadron of hops carried by a perfect sweet malt body, slowly leaks out like freon into the ozone layer, fighting down your defenses and leaving you with a smile on your face. A strong, well balanced DIPA and after having a couple of these, you look almost handsome.

Hazy golden orange. Light filmy head, soft ring and lacing. Punchy boozenut nose, dried wood varnish with apricots stuck to it. Initial taste is coppery, sweet amber and oddly honeycomb creamy. Oddly spicy, like uncooked reformed beef later on. Sticky and busy carbonation, unlike the Hop Stoopid before, and finishes a lot neater. Warming spice, tea like bitterness and a dessert wine cleansing fade. Not terrible by all means but perhaps not helped by its predecessor being so daisy cutter hop fresh. 

Keg, Hanging Bat

Golden clear with off white head. Aroma is hint of pine, lots of tropical fruit and some booze. Taste is apricot sweet and pine bitter. The malty flavor and the hoppy flavors balance each other but shine individually. Lots of pine and quite a bit of carbonation. Unusual and tasty. Lingering pine bitter, lingering fruity sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
"yet another that i really like when fresh/good, but i’ve had too many spoiled ones to get it off the shelf. too bad, cause like their imperial red, it’s big and chewy and aromatic...sometimes."
Teerenpeli/Kamppi 10/2014. Very well balanced, hoppy and malty (just as promised). Really enjoyable.
Hints of bouquets of floral apricots and ditch weed, kissed with the hair of bubblegum butterscotch ginger.

Floral and well hopped aroma. The taste is heavenly good. Very taste of fruit and sweetness. Lightly carbonated. Wonderful bitterness that fills the mouth a long time. Easy to drink and good. Top scores from me. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
The name does not disappoint, hoppy a little skunky but not unpleasant, crisp good ale

22 oz bottle from Fred Meyer in Hillsboro, OR. Aroma is sweet, piney, and resinous, with hints of garden flowers and butterscotch. Mouthfeel is creamy and sweet throughout, with a slightly bitter finish. This has been a favorite of mine for years!

Aroma: Medium-high hops, fruity, tropical fruit, guava. Resiny. Medium-low malt, bready, toasty.
Appearance: Body: clear copper. Head: Large, white, fizzy, good retention, lacing.
Flavour: Medium high hop bitterness, Medium hop flavour, fruity. Medium-light malt: biscuit, Medium-dry finish with lingering soft bitterness.Medium sweetness
Mouthfeel: Slight warming. Medium body. Medium, creamy carbonation. 
Overall: Well balanced. Even with the high bitterness the malt offers the perfect support. Wow! I can’t find fault in this beer.

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Esme and Lambert!
14C. Imperial IPA

Borostyánkő színe lebilincselő illatokat rejt. Fantasztikusan édes és gyümölcsös, süteménytöltelékes aromák, melyeknél a mangó, a grapefruit, valamint őszibarack befőtt illatjegyei között időzhetünk; mennybéli kezdés bármely komló-fanatikus számára. Vaskos, ragacsos lenyomatú kortyokkal örvendeztethetjük meg aztán ízlelőbimbóinkat, nem mindennapi élmény ez egyiknek sem. Lágy zamatai szétolvadnak a nyelvünkön, szirupos gömböcskékként gurulnak lefelé a garatunkon a kolibriszínű ízmolekulák. Szinte kenhető a test, tartalmas és izgalmakkal teli, likőrben úszó trópusi gyümölcsök hada gyantacseppekkel megbolondítva, és némi gyomorkeserűs jelleg teszi leírhatatlanná az összképet.

On tap into a mason jar (probably the worst way to present a beer ... and at their taproom no less! - see next paragraph for updates on aroma, taste, and palate). Muted aromas consisting of mostly bread and citrus with some caramel late. It pours a clear caramel orange color with an oily look to it. A soft, creamy white head retains a thick ring with good surface coverage and an abundant sheet-like lace. It?s a very well balanced medium bitter and sweet, maybe slightly more sweet, but nothing overwhelming - pleasant surprise for a DIPA. It drinks with a viscous texture and a creamy, lightly prickly carbonation and a medium full body. Flavors of toast, ctirus, caramel, and light pine come through on the mouth. It finishes fresh with light citrus zest and pine. These notes are joined by bread crust in the light aftertaste.

12 oz glass poured into an ipa glass. Sweet sugary orange aromas come through in abundant with a light note of spice and grass. The appearance matches the previous deScription. The taste is a medium high sweet and medium mellow bitter. It’s slick and sticky with a soft, small prickly carbonation. The medium contains lots of sweet, bright citrus with a toast and pine finish. It’s pretty smooth with a dry bread crust aftertaste that sticks around. So glad I tried this again in better glassware.
@ Nedre Mölla 26/7-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Hoppy, fruity, pine needles. Taste: Dito + quite sweet. Body is medium, the finish is bitter, hoppy and piney.

This gold colored beer has tinges of red. It has a sweet hop aroma. Nice crisp and full flavor it well balanced and finishes cleanly. It goes down easy. Maybe a little too easy. It could be a problem. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 22 oz bottle. Pours clear amber color with off white head. Big citrus peel, mango and juniper nose. Oily feel in mouth. Caramel malt ,mango and orange start. Lots of big fruity flavors and finishing with grapefruit zest. Not a lot of lingering bitterness. Another killer brew from Lagunitas.

Poured from the bottle into a snifter. Pours a nice orange color with a small white head. Aroma consists of pine, resin, and citrus. Taste is much the same with an emphasis on the resin hops. Medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation and a slight sticky mouth feel. Very good beer.
Really nice double ipa. Not overly bitter, which was nice. Strong pine, citrus and grassy notes

Bottle. Clear light amber with orange hue. Creamy dense head and excellent retention. Aroma is orange blossom, basil, honey, peaches. Taste is Citra hops with good malt support. The brew has an initial bite, but finishes very smooth on the palate. Very, very good.

Orange-amber color, nice white head .Aroma of citrus hops. Great balanced taste with malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness in finish. Grapefruits bitterness in aftertaste. Decent ABV , but easy to drink.
Hoppy and citrus.. Easy to drink. No head on the pour. Orange tint. Great beer, however had better.
22oz bottle pours a yellow amber color with a bit of head. Lots of citrusy hop flavors that ease out at the end.

Lovely unclear deep golden color with a fine white head. Good looking. Power aroma. Rich grapefruity and balanced fruity. Quite thick body. Fine balance between bitterness and sweetness. Could easily falled over to the sweet side. Tasty rich grapefruit hoppy and nice tropical fruity. Lovely dipa.
[Bottle from systembolaget web order, Sweden]
Taste, balance, abv, and price make this an amazing dipa. I'm very impressed.

Transfer from BA review on 3-9-13-
 Poured from bottle into a snifter glass

 Appearance – Pours a clear orange colored brew with some red highlights giving it a nice shine. Upon pouring there is a very small white head that fades quite fast leaving a bit of patchy foam on the surface of the brew and some very light lacing on the sides of the glass.

 Smell- The aroma is bready and hoppy with a very light level of sweetness. The bready aromas of are of a biscuit and slightly doughy smell while the sweet are of a light caramel smell. The heaviest of the aromas, the hop, are largely of a grapefruit nature mixed with some lighter noted of a pine hop.

 Taste – The taste begins with flavors of a mix of tropical fruits and a pine hop taste. The pine starts the taste rather strongly and lasts to the middle of the taste where it starts to be overwhelmed in strength by a grapefruit hop taste. While this is occurring the breadiness of the brew gets stronger while the fruit fades and its place being taken place by a light caramel flavor. More toward the end, where the grapefruit is rather strong, some more pine hop comes to the tongue and actually competes with the grapefruit in strength. It is accompanied by some more herbal hop flavors with a slight alcohol taste, which in the end, leaves a rather resinous and moderately drier hop flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is on the medium to slightly thicker and creamier side with a carbonation level that is average to slightly above average. The thicker body really accentuates the resinous hops and more bready flavors that develop more toward the middle. While the higher carbonation suits the fruit and caramel flavors well these are really not the focus of the beer and a slightly lower carbonation level may have been slightly beer for the style.

 Overall – A fairly tasty double IPA. It drinks pretty easy and has a decent drier flavor profile (especially at the end of the taste). Overall it is pretty good.
Riktig kraftig aroma, sötma humle . Kraftig i smaken, balanserad . Mycket beska.

Gravity dispense at GBBF ’14, day 1, 12/08/14.
Lightly hazed orange amber with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is pine coated, candied fruit peel, bitter tropicana, grapefruit, tangy orange, ripe citric peel.
Taste comprises bitter grapefruit, pine, candied fruit peel, sweet licks, mango.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with hop bitterness.
Decent, likely better on keg I’m sure, a touch sweet at times but dirnks well for 8%+

Kaatuu snifteriin kullanoranssina ja melko kirkkaana, noin 1,5 sormen paksuisella melko pysyvällä vaahdolla. Tuoksu on hyvää jenkki-DIPAa: sitrusta ja havua löytyy reippaasti, humalapää edellä mennään jo tuoksussa. Makeampaa hedelmää ja kukkaisuuttakin löytyy, karamellin tukemana. Mutta karamelli on aika vähissä, selvästi humalat edellä tullaan. Maussa sama tykitys ei ihan jatku; karamellia on nyt huomattavasti enemmän muodostaen havuisuuden ja pihkaisuuden kanssa hyvän kokonaisuuden. Hiven karheampaa ruohoisuutta ja makeampaa hedelmääkin on mukana. Suutuntuma on alkuun makea, kuivuen loppua kohden humalan nipistelyn lisääntyessä. Hyvä ja tasapainoinen DIPA, josta jäi hieman viimeinen rutistus puuttumaan. Laatu kyllä löytyy.

Excellent transparent pour w/ a retaining white head & plenty of lacing. The aroma is absolutely an enticing citrus hop burst w/ a malt undertone. The flavor is complex yet smooth. There’s a hop presence throughout but the citrus flavoring really makes this easy to drink at over 8%. Delicious & very well done!

West Coast IPA with firm, yellowish white head and warm golden amber colour. Delightfully complex and powerful hops in the nose, some orange, pine resin, tomato, pepper, grass; sweet malty and fruity onset rapidly overpowered by a very long, agressive, spicy, oily, pine needle- and citrus-like hoppiness drying mouth and throat. I can’t get enough of this type of beers and this is one of the best I had so far.

Bottle - big foamy head, clear medium copper color, big tropical fruit and pine aroma and flavor, fair malt backbone, very good overall as expected from these guys 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber color, with a touch of orange and a light haze. 2-finger white head. Aroma is all hops, with both pine and citrus notes. Medium body, mildly oily with a brief finish. Flavor is, again, mostly hops. A mix of pine and citrus notes, but there is a light note of caramel underneath that lingers in the finish.
Hell orangegelbes Bier mit schöner stabilen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig fruchtig, kräftig malzig, Grapefruit. Geschmack trocken fruchtig, hopfig, reife Früchte, bitter, etwas Karamell.
Spicy, dry grapefruit aroma. Deep, resinous flavor, with grapefruit and a warm frutiness. Very beautiful.
Ummm a tad astringent on the palate. This was a way to reach the last sixteen characters

Bomber shared pours a bright golden orange with white head and nice lacing. Aroma of huge citrus, apricots, mangos and possibly orange. The flavor is of the amped up version of their ipa. Damn tasty. Medium malt and plenty of hops.

Cask gravity at GBBF 2014. It pours orange with a small white head. The nose is orange chewits, candy, boozy, apricot, peachy, dried mango and five alive fruit juice. The taste is bitter, orange, apricot, chewits, peppery, grapefruit, sticky, booze, leather, some astringency, resin with a warming, citrussy finish. Medium+ body, low carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Rich, fruity and boozy. Pretty punchy. Would have been better on keg though...

Ah yes, liquid gold! Nice job Lagunitas. Maximus is a nice walk down dry citrus and spruce avenue. Although hoppy, this is offset by a considerable caramel and perhaps even nutty backbone. Serving: multi-12oz bottle experience.
No alcohol taste which is impressive. Fruity but not citrusy. Very good bitterness...

355ml bottle. Clear, deep dark orangey golden to amber colour with average, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Intense, resinous and piney hoppy aroma, orange fruitiness is condensed to a liquorice note, caramel malty background with bitter almond touch. Taste is initially fruity hoppy, notes of mandarine, orange, grapefruit, later more bitter, resinous, caramel malty basis with bitter almond note. Very nice colour, slightly too condensed intensity, therefore almost a bit monotonous or at least onesided.
Bottle. Floral hoppy aroma. Clear light Amber color, with light white color to head. Flavor is a little citrus, with light pine. Medium body. Very nice DIPA!

Bottle in a hotel room in Las Vegas. Bright orange pour, thin white head. Aroma of fruity hops, quite floral, citrus, pine, resin and very refreshing. Flavor is bitter fruity hops and some biscuits. Quite intense but clean and refreshing. Nice.

Pours a golden amber with white head that leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma and taste of pine, grass, grapefruit, white bread, and caramel and a littlebit like my ex wife, bitter. Less hoppy, more malty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour. Clean amber wheat in glass with off-white head. Minimal webbing. Warm pine, grapefruit and caramel nose. Borderline creamy. Medium body. Combination of candy sweetness and a mild, piney bitterness. Grapefruit on aftertaste. Full, round flavors. Enveloping mouthfeel. Higher ABV not obvious. Good, but a bit sweet.

22oz bottle 7/26/14 (Jewel)-58° in Shaker-Pours a lighter amber with a one fi9nger size off white head. Aroma of hops and malt. Taste of hops, hops, and more hops along with some malt. This medium to full bodied brew is well balanced and is extremely smooth. Nice brew.

Aroma of stale peaches, something sour, can’t quite place it. Sugars as well. Pours a thin gold, little head, no lacing. Taste is medium sweet and bready, a bit of a hot alcohol aftertaste; not unpleasant, not great. Lagunitas makes a lot of great beers and this just isn’t one of them -- thin, sweet, oddly sour.

Bottle. Dark gold. Pine with tangerine and grapefruit. Some bread and grass notes as well. Great ipa!

Clear golden, thick and frothy white head. Aroma has fruity hops, tangerines and pineapple. Flavour.has a solid maltyness and rather mellow bitterness. Bittersweet finish.
Pours Amber with a white head. Aroma of pine and subtle peach. Hoppy with some maltiness.

Bomber. Pours a golden amber with white head that leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma and taste of pine, grass, grapefruit, white bread, and caramel. Somewhat bitter. Less hoppy, more malty. Good finish of caramel malt and earthy hops. Medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation. Not bad, just nothing special. Great for the price though.

Cloudy amber color, white head. Resin and grapefruit nose, sweet malty, hints of caramel, peach and pineapple. Sweet malty taste, apple, resin, hint of soy sauce and alcohol, medium to high bitterness. Medium body, lively carbonation.

Bottle poured in glass. Pours a clear amber color with a white head. Aroma is malt, pine and hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice amber color with a one finger head. Aroma is totally citrus, hops, pine and a nice slight sweetness. Taste is citrus, piney with a small sweet finish. A good one. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice amber color.has a nice citrus, hoppy flavor.great IPA for a hot summer day. Enjoy !

Could not resist to put my teeth in this DIPA, especially since Lagunitas IPA is world class.

The beer has a very fine copper color and relinquishes some residue on the glass. The aroma is wonderfully strong. The taste is pretty easy for being an American "hop bomb". A very easy to drink DIPA. The medium bitterness is perfect and the beer would also have been if it were not for the chemical off-taste in the finish.

April 2019, May 2020, July 2021. Pale gold, crystal clear, tiny but abundant little bubbles, no lace, tall, loose and persistent head. 
  Subdued nose of orange flower and clay. 
  Full body, flavorful, silky, well carbonated, just enough alcohol heat, refreshing mouthfeel, perhaps lacking a kick (but then I remembered this time around I was drinking a cask, so the carbonation was low and the temperature only room),  Palate lingers forever, bitter and tasty finish.
  Bittersweet with plenty of malt background, bright, never excessive acidity,  perfectly balanced. 
  Deliciously hoppy, herbal , honeyed malt, resiny, citrusy, orange liqueur, pineaple, dried apricot, just a great beer.

From bottle in Helsinki leijuva lahna bar. Pours light amber/golden orange colour. Thin white head that disappears after 5 min. Medium carbonation, just how I like.little lacing. Grassy/pine/honey aroma. Peach sweetness on the palate that is well balanced, to finish with some powerful resinous new world hop flavours and bitterness. Double IPA style. Really good beer to enjoy cold when really thirsty. Mouthfeel is very enjoyable too!
This beer is just fantastic! I love IPAs and this one is one of the best.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured clear, amber with a small head, spotty lacing. Aroma is malts, fruit some hops and some booze. Taste is sweet, malty and with hints of hops and nice sticky finish. Not bad, very enjoyable very drinkable. Quite good.

12 ounce bottle. Deep yellow gold color. Large foamy off-white head. Tropical fruit nose with lots of resiny pine hops. Bittersweet hops and toasted malt with notes of mango, black pepper and more pine. This is a tasty IPA that drinks smooth and easy. Hides the 8.2% ABV very well. Finishes dry and spicy. Well done!

A dark yellow, slightly orange colour, a head is medium and blond. The nose has peaches, nice fructose, some mandarin and melon, rainy pine forest. Taste isn’t so sweet than aroma, the strong bitterness dry the taste. Anyway, strong and almost full bodied is nicely balanced with hoppyness. In the simple taste has pine needles, some grapefruits, only hint of fruits, dry resin in the end. Maximus isn’t the modern fruit sallad. Rough bitterness with nice balance.
This is a very delicious and hoppy IPA. Light amber color and foamy head. Very tasty and refreshing.
Really nice IPA. Has a good flavor and is really easy to drink. Hoppy but not over bearing.
Into a small glass....When nothing is new,this is my go to beer. Great aroma and taste. Must be ice cold,when warm it all changes.
From a bottle to a glass. Hazy golden pour. Pine, citrus and hps on the taste. Very enjoyable beer.
Pours a clear amber colour with a white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, grass, pine and hops. Taste is medium sweet leading to a hoppy finish. Nice one.

Very hoppy, piney, distinctive Lagunitas scent. Some malt detected, but mostly pine hops. Dark golden color with a massive amount of white foam. The taste is not a hop bomb like I was expecting. It is a bit sweet at first, with hops showing up at the end but even then they are not overwhelming. Palate is smooth; not as fizzy as many other IPA’s. At 8.2%, I don’t know if I would call it a DIPA, but it is a beer I could drink right out of the bottle on a summer day.
Orange klar med høyt offwhite skum. Humle, grapefrukt og lukt av sydhavsfrukter. Bittersøt smak av humle og sitrus. Tørr, bitter medium lang avslutning

Bottle from Saveur-biere.com - Color: clear amber beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy blast, grassy and floral notes. Caramel presence. Taste: nice hoppy taste. With good floral and grassy taste. Aftertaste: wet bitterness with caramel notes.

72.41 IBUs? That might be a deal breaker, I usually only like beers under 72.405 IBUs... 12oz bottle with dust on it into La Petite Tulipe - nose is a freshly opened bag of hops with what I currently suspect will be a noticeable malty backbone. Easy drinking for a DIPA. Slight minty/citrus aftertaste. I picture myself drinking this ice cold while being entranced at a large campfire/field party fire on a humid night in the summer. Abfackeln!!!

Just slightly hazy golden, tiny particles from bit fast pouring, bit sparkling, thin and long kinda white head that gives lacing. Caramel malt bit roasted, pine, tropical fruits. Medium body, sweet and slightly bitter, round, bittersweet medium long finish, soft carbonation. Tasty and nuanced, good balance.
Flaska från systembolaget. Maltig, knäckebrödig. Perfekt balans av humle. En av de bästa, om inte den bästa, DIPAn jag druckit! Mycket bra. Fyllig. Mums.

Poured from a 750 cc bottle. Pours clear orange with a generous yellow head. Nose is citrus, pine, caramel, honey, orange peel, and coriander. Flavour is light hoppy bitterness with sweet malts and tropical fruit (eg pineapple). Great easy drinking IPA perfect for a summer patio.

Bottle, BBE 11/09/14, 06/06/14. Pours a deep orange with a good-sized, nice-looking, yellowish brown head. Aroma is a wallop of green hops from the mouth of the bottle. Poured it turns into a huge whack of caramel. As it settles down there’s both with the pine and resin rising up as well. Taste is dry and bitter as you would expect. Piney and resinous as well as caramelly. The pith and resin dominate. Very full with fairly strong carbonation. Superbly easy to drink despite its hefty 8.2% alcohol.
355 mil bottle from purvis Surry Hills big citrus hoppy aroma golden in colour small white head taste is smooth hoppy goodness

Look: ours a light orange color. White head that hangs around. Slightly cloudy. Thick lacing as head goes away.
Smell: dank skunky smell. Citrus and pine aroma.
Taste: bitterness at the end. Citrus fruit. Slight pine flavor. Alcohol taste as the beer warms up.
Feel: very dry. Leaves a film on your mouth that makes want to drink more to wash it away. Good carbonation level. 
Overall: heavy hopped beer good an refreshing for summer.

Bottle:
Pours clear copper with a frothy, off-white head.
Pine, orange aroma.
Taste is malty, orange-peel, pine....
Creamy and smooth.
Very pleasant and easy drinking.

Nice amber color with a solid white head. Aroma is pine, citrus, caramel and lots of fruitiness. The taste is grass, tropical fruits, ginger and a hint of spiciness. Solid DIPA, so easy to drink to many...

From Bottle Shop. Relatively clear orange-brown with lots of carbonation and a thin white with big chunky bubbles. Smells quite sweet, pineapple and hard candy with malt and yeasty grassy hop in the background. Tastes similar, same pineapple hard candy sweetness
with even more piney hop. Quite crisp, esp.
compared to the other Lagunitas beers I've tried, though still a bit of slickness to it. Quite flavourful for an IPA, sweet and bitter pine.

Bottle from Bottle Shop at home. Clear amber pour with thin foamy head. Aroma is big and sweet - tangy and juicy hops, pinapple-y. Taste is similar. Big tropical fruit hops - orange and citrus but mainly pineapple. Piney too. Slightly bitter at the end with lasting acidity. Unusually strong pineapple flavors - really nice. Between a regular IPA and a Double IPA. Would definitely get again.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours amber with a white head. Taste citrus, pine, bitter. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

@ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear, light amber, bubbly full head cover, lace streamers that fall back into the drink. Taste is malt, joined mid palate by pine hops. This is like many good standard IPAs, strong, yes, but not as distinctive as I envisioned, and not on the level of the best. Worth a look.

Pours a 2 finger head, clear golden tan color, small tiny non aggressive bubbles. Lots of pine. Decent lacing. Super tasting DIPA. Highly recommended. Note this bottle likely bottled in early March. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
@ Havregatan. Flaska (355ml) från Systembolaget (24:-). Rejält humlig och fruktig, massor av tallbar, ganska hög sötma, medelfyllig. Avslutningen är besk och humlig.

From 12 oz bottle poured in a 8oz capacity snifter. Little to no head leading to obviously thin lacing. Malt predominant on nose with spicy hop character in the background. Nice weight and texture on palate with sweet malt supporting the 8.2 ABV. Not as hoppy as I would expect from a west coast IPA but a Sid offering from a brewery with a great track record.

Tastes and smells great but pours without good head. Carries a punch with its high alcohol content. Ive have yet to be disappointed from any lagunitas brews.

Clear amber golden colour, white head. Sweet aroma, hops, citrus, biscuit, lots of malts. Light bitter (for an iipa) flavour, honey, quite sweet. Finish honey with hops. Rather light flavoured for an iipa, maybe an older bottle(?)

(from 35cL bottle @ Beer Temple, Amsterdam)
Lagunitas deliver another solid IPA with a lot of flavor of pine. Relatively marked malt sweetness for this type of beer, but it works.
Bottle. Pours a nice clear amber with a big head and good lacing. Nose is a blend of sweet citrus with some grapefruit. Flavor is also tart citrus with some sweetness. A great IPA.

An off-white, creamy head rests upon a clear, medium amber body. Very strong aroma of slightly overripe tropical fruits e.g. melon, also pine, pure hop pellets, caramel and hints of alcohol. A bit more fresh and hop-centric aroma than many DIPAs, although the malty elements are absolutely present. Strong flavour, again on the hoppy side, of well ripe tropical fruits, grapefruit, pine, resin, caramel and a tad too much alcohol. Moderate sweet taste with a heavy bitter long-lasting finish. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, fairly dry. Tasty stuff! 

[35.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 8 months before BB date, from Systembolaget Gårda, Göteborg]
Pours light golden with a thin white head. Creamy, sweet lemon aroma. Taste is caramel, lemon peel. Finish is fresh and bitter.

Pours a clear medium copper with one finger of loose white head diminishing gradually to a dense cap and moderate lacing. Nose is piney hops with faint floral and citrus notes against a malt background. Taste is similar but more malt forward, with a little mango in the aftertaste. Mouth feel is medium-bodied, sustained by persistent mild carbonation, with a lingering bitter finish.

Bottle at the Brewdog Bar, Manchester. Gold amber with a rocky off white head. Aroma of malts, tea, bit of dark fruit. Flavour is hoppy with a fair smacking of malts, quite a fizzy palate. Nice enough but just didn’t stir me really.
Kind of like lagunitas sucks, just not quite as good. Lightly sweet pine and hop flavor.
Beautiful clear, golden color with a nice head. Tropical fruit aroma with some pine. Taste isn’t amazing, but very nice, good bitterness.

Pours hazy burnt orange with a small amount of off white head. Nose is really fresh tropical fruit. Pineapple, mango, passionfruit. Flavor is more of the noses fruits, a bit of grain and biscuit in the mid palate, with a spicy, slightly piney finish. At 8.2% you’d expect something pretty heavy but it remains pretty drinkable. Great.

golden, sparkling appearance with a frothy white head. hay, toast malt notes, floral, herbs, citrus hops takeover, barnyard notes. medium sweetness, very bitter with a medium body, thin feel, creamy texture, lively carbonation with a bitter finish. What a name. Sounds like a famous warrior. Great IPA!
Pours a dark gold with plenty of fluffy white head. Aromatic of fresh hops. Medium bodied with plenty of hop bitterness.
355 ml bottle. Half clear copper orange. Bitter citrus smell. Taste is bitter very bitter! Citrus grapefruit pine mango. Well balanced.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle. The pour is copper-amber with a modest off-white head that fades into a ring. The aroma has a nice biscuit malt character merging with the floral hop character. The best of both worlds perhaps? The hope tend to be a bit more forward. Light to medium body. The taste has a nice balance of malts and floral hops and a lingering biting bitterness. I wouldn’t go so far as to describe it as a Double IPA like RB does but it does have a fine hop quality to it.
355 cl Plektrum bar Örebro. Orange färg. Doftar en hel del men jag blir inte imponerad av smaken. Rejält bitter med en del alcohol Smak.
Bottle from Total Wine. Amber pour with lots if big bubbles -- pretty beer. Smells like a pine forest. Tastes is big hops with a nice malt balance. Very good beer.
12oz bottle to my dogfish IPA glass. Hoppy wood and pine dominated hops. Touch of bitterness. A bit watery body. This is a pretty good IPA.
Amber pour, nice head. Citrusy aroma. Nice hoppy flavor with some sweet maltiness. A solid DIPA. I like what Lagunitas has to offer here.
Bottle at home from stockholm, 10th April 14. Nice DIPA, very drinkable, and good balanced beer. Nice stuff
Pretty much a Lagunitas IPA on steroids, orange juicy, medium bitterness, a bit thick bodied for a WC IPA, tasty but nowhere near my tops.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Nothing extraordinary about this but drinks well and is relatively fresh which is nice. Mainly driven by citric fruit and pine. Slightly sticky which works nicely. Good drop

Bottle. Pours copper with a short head that leaves great lace. Huge aroma of pine, citrus, hay and grass. Nicely balanced medium bitter and sweet, interesting flavors of grapefruit and bubblegum, oily texture, medium body, average carbo and a brief balanced finish with sweet in the far finish.

Very clear and pale golden color. Good white retention and lace. Aroma of sweet malts, flowers, pine, some kind of fruit, spice, sugar. Taste is hoppy and mildly bitter. A little sweet but excellent balance with the hops. Really well done.

12 ounce bottle pours a medium copper color with white creamy head that lasts. Nice amount of lacing seems like there's hop residue or chill haze in the beer. Aroma is very piney with some sweet caramel malt scent along with some citrus. Nice malt to bitter hop balance a bit more full-bodied than a standard IPA.
bottle. Amber with one finger head. Kicked up version of the standard IPA. A bit of alcohol warmth, but very tasty.

The aroma is decidedly pine and grapefruit, with hints of sweet malt. Copper pour, nice lacing left, with a rim of head around the circumference of the glass. Taste is grapefruit, pine, and some nice bitterness. Good DIPA.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance had a dark amber/copper colored body with a nice two finger white foamy head that quickly dies and leaves some speckled spider web lacing that fully clings.
The smell has a rich considerable amounts of malty goodness with a wonderful allocation of citrus and piney hops embedded within.
The taste was bittersweet all the way through, no if’s, and’s, or but’s about it, this beauty shows a nice complexity of the piney/citrusy goodness wonderfully combined with the malts. I’m not getting any aftertaste whatsoever, but there is a dry finish.
On the palate, it sat about a medium to almost heavy (perhaps) more likely closer to medium, semi-sessionable, carbonation is good for the style and very good to me as there’s a nice sharpness, but still shows a decent smoothness.
Overall, gee, what a great DIPA, wishing I would have had this fresh, I’ll be sure to look for this Summer when it comes out as I would definitely have this one again especially if it held out for this long.
Excellent sweet citrus smell followed by a sweet hoppy DIPA taste. This is a fantastic Imperial. I’ve had tons of this stuff and never had a bad one either.

A- Pours an clear orange hue with a nice, big 2 finger off white head that leaves a ton of lacing.

S- Smell is predominately floral, piney hops and a bit of indistinct lighter fruit notes.

T- Taste is much sweeter than I was expecting, peach, caramel, floral character followed by a very balanced hop bitterness.

M- Medium body and carbonation.

D- This was an extremely drinkable ipa and for the price it’s hard to beat. Not a huge DIPA and very balanced.
Grym öl! Kopparfärgad, fräsch. Aromatisk, inte särskilt besk. Små inslag av citrus och karamell!

Pours a hazy light amber color with particulate matter swirling about. A thick, nearly white head with a lot lacing sits atop the beer. Strong aroma of orange and grapefruit with pine in the background. Flavor is initially sweeter than expected with bubblegum and candied fruit leading the way for the tart and tangy hops to kick in. Finish is strong, bitter, and dry with more grapefruit and citrus on the end. Overall a Good balance of malt and hops with a more complex flavor than I expected. It's not just a hops bomb. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wonderful example of an IPA. Full of fruity and citrus hops. Full of freshness. Full of being full and deep. Well balanced, easy to drink and still real class.

12oz bottle from Brewmaster’s in Wilson. Orange hue, hazy clarity with mostly diminishing white head. Spotty lacing. Moderate citrus hop, some sweet fruit, floral aroma on the nose. Moderate bitter grapefruit taste up front with a floral finish. As it warmsthe alcohol starts to come out more.

Bottle from trade with Cunningham - many thanks! The beer pours out in a light hazy amber colour with steady head and medium to crisp body. Wonderful aroma of fresh hops and herbs. Taste of aromatic hops, herbs, spruce, oak, spices and citrus. Very fresh and quaffable finish. Enjoyed it a lot - great IPA.
Bottle from Tom Thumb. Pours a rich copper colour with a medium white head. The aromas are pine, citrus. The mouthfeel is dry, bitter and has a medium body and good carbonation. Great beer! Cheers!

BOD 345/13. Pours a clear amber with a massive head and lacing that retains well. The nose is a blend of sweet citrus (orange and mango) coupled with notes of grapefruit and pine over a sweet caramel background. Almost full bodied with a rich creamy texture. The carbonation level is normal with a touch of effervescence on the finish. The complex, yet balanced, flavor profile is outstanding. It begins with a tart burst of citrus hop flavor like the nose, flows to a mild sweet citric bitterness which recedes into a caramel sweetness. The finish is smooth with a burst of sweetness and lingering light tart bitterness. A complex brewer’s masterpiece of balance, flavor and bitterness.

355 ml bottle @ Pub Kultainen Apina. BBE 04.10.2014.

Pours clear golden color with a medium sized white head. Aroma of mild hops, resin, pine needles, grass, citric fruits and some caramel. Flavor is somewhat sweet with fruits and caramels, oily and resinous hops with wooden dry finish. Decent but a bit disappointing.


4514

The citrus adds to the acidity but does cut the bitterness of the high octane IPA. I like it but recognize that it has a soapy taste that provides a "clean" finish but stout lovers are not going to like it.

Bottle. Clear deep orange. Small off white head. Bitter hop aroma. Taste is fruity and sweet. Could use a little more balance.

-- rated with beerbasher
Kopparfärgad med mellanstort ljust skum. Doftar friskt av humlen speciellt annanas!   Ganska besk men endå rund och söt. Mycket humle men även en del malt i smaken!

Golden. Average head. Fuity smell, lots of bubbles. Emphasized grapefruit flavor on a malty base that gives the alcohol a fair chance with everything else. A better balanced ale than most DBLs. Another one please.

Pour is golden amber with a nice foamy head...nice lacing.....smell is fruitty with a perfect pine and hops mix....taste is a citrus explosion...right away you are hit with a citrus/grapefruit punch that ends with a perfect hoppy finish...not too bitter...great balance....i really enjoyed this dbl ipa.

Citrus, grapefruit jumps out. whole lotta hops. Spruce. Shows bitter then smooths out. Head stays consistent throughout. The finest west coast IPA , but I have not been fortunate enough to try Piney the Younger.

En ipa jag verkligen gillar. Härlig humligsmak utan att vara allt för besk. Inte så humligarom men en bra öl!

Bière couleur de miel, sur levure et où une dwnae écume nappe largement le verre. Au nez, du malt biscuit, bien lacté, un peu de conifères. Elle est bien amère avec un peu de sucre résiduel. Elle est de corps robuste, peu effervecente, de texture crémeuse et se termine sur des arômes de biscuits et une légère amertume.

A: Lots of citra hops. Grapefruit. Very fruity floral note.
A: Looks fine. Nice white head. Amber color. 
Taste is hoppy. Bitter hops come through in the middle and on the finish. A strange spicy note. Some fruit notes but not terrible many.
P: Finish is a little off with the hops lingering. Very wet on the palate. 
Overall a pretty good showing for an IPA. Some good fruit notes but the bitterness of the hops lingers around a bit too long.

35,5cl bottle from Systembolaget, Sälen. Pours clear deep golden to amber with an off-white head. Fruity and hoppy aroma with tropical fruits, pine, citrus, caramel and pale malt. Sweet, hoppy and fruity with a decent bitterness. A bit too sweet, but still quite balanced and very pleasant. Certainly decent stuff.

Backlog. Tried on bottle a number of times. For me this is one of the standard west-coast IPAs, by that i don’t mean standard as in bad but in the sense of hard to tell the difference from the other good IPAs coming out of the west-coast.
From a bottle. Pours a cloudy orange, lasting thin head, big bold fruity hops flavours and a smooth finish. What a great beer!

これぞ求めていたIPAって感じ

まず香りが素晴らしい、華やかな香り

Very very hoppy. Maybe a bit too much. Still, it is a great IPA, specially when one is thirsty.Rerate added comments : dark golden/copper colour with a hoppy/sweet smell. The taste is of course very hoppy but still great. The palate too, with slightly bitter and sweet aftertaste (but not too much). Still great IPA, no changes on the final score. Re re rate: I feel some kind ofcaramel in the taste that makes me consist to down grade it. Will keep as it is for now but we see next time. ..

On bottle from Systembolaget Sælen. Golden color, good foam, a geat eal of small sediments. Immediate hop aromas, pine, malt some citrus and fruitiness, caramel in the end. Medium full body & high complexity. Good bitterness and very well balanced. Very enjoyable- really one of the best double IPAs Ive had!
Flaska från SB. Bärnstensfärgad vätska med gräddigt vitt skum. Doft av mango och citrus samt liten ton av alkohol. Beska och maltsötma i ett bra äktenskap. Fyllig och eldig.
En bra öl som jag gillar. Luktar och smakar en aning av citrus.Väl balanserad med beskan.
12oz bottle pours a clear amber with extensive suspended particulate. I?m hoping this one just sat on the store cooler shelf too long, because it?s just average at best.

Very citrusy aroma with a bready malt backbone. Light copper pour. Lemony citrus, orange rind flavor. Strong bitter in the back of the throat. Long finish Not bad but honestly way over-rated. Theres not much body or depth. Really One dimensional. Lacks the thick body and malt depth of a good IIPA. More of a high abv regular IPA. Great tasting beer regardless of specifics.

Bottle. Clear copper pour with a foamy white head. Malt and piney hop aromas. Dank pine and resin hop notes with a huge caramel malt presence. Might have a bit of age on it. Average mouthfeel and body.

Pours hazy golden/amber with high head. Aroma is nuts, caramel, hops. Flavor is caramel, hops, alcoho, malts, grass. Nice beer!

Pours gold with white head. Aroma is exotiv fruits, bread and pine. Flavour is medium to heavy bitter and medium sweet.

355 ml bottle @ home.February 13, 2014
