Almost no head; golden orange in the glass. Smell is delicious -- apple turnovers, candied fruit, a little grass, some citrus. Taste is crisp, bready, cooked pastry dough, tangy and slightly dry on the finish. Really good.

Orange with a bubbly, off white head. Aroma is slightly sweet with hints of citrus and caramel. Taste is a balanced bitter with a solid malty backbone. Medium body and carbonation. Overall not bad but not my thing.
Bottle from Systembolaget (24 SEK). Hoppy aroma and taste. Bitter. A typical but very good IPA. Excellent for that price. Will buy again.

Aroma is malty, sugary, and funky. For an IPA I really didn?t like this one. I prefer IPAs to be very hoppy and this one just leaned way too much on the malts and other flavors. Not a bad beer by any means, this one just isn?t for me.

Try pronouncing it with a Sean Connery accent. Sounds like a beer you don’t want to mess with. Glad I did! Nice copper color with an off-white head. Lace that stuck like glue to the glass. Incredible citrus and floral hop aromas. It’s a DIPA but is really well balanced. Also higher on the ABV but no bite from the alcohol content. Medium+ carbonation and less than average viscosity. This is a very sessionable DIPA in my opinion. Next time I’m going for the growler fill. PS - I paired it with some roast antelope which is a bit gamey, they both worked well together.

Dig this beer. Crisp clear copper pour with average off-white head. Laced. Nose is predominately floral with hints of grapefruit and pine. A sweet brew. Malty. Big flower bouquet with fat hop resin notes. A flash of citrus. Nice bitterness. Full bodied and smooth. Really clean finish. Great stuff.
Bottle 0.355l at Leijuva Lahna, Helsinki. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, hops and malts.
Dark amber. Tall white head. Well carbonated. Aroma of hops. Nice full, smooth body. Not that sweet.
Another one of Lagunitas Ale. This is my kind of Ale and this is one of a kind that’s not missing in my basement.
slight passion fruit flavor. slightly metallic, but not to its detriment. a lil bit spicy..also surprisingly nutty.

Nice copper color with lacey white head. Sticky pine hop meets floral hop aroma and taste with a sweet bready finish. Good bang for the buck.

Bottle. Marzipan, soap and fresh fruits. Smooth and quite well balanced between sweet and bitter, but in the aftertaste the bitterness takes over.

Big head, nice lacing, not a great smell or flavor of hops for me. A little unbalanced towards the bitter side but still drinkable.

Pours a large head that holds very nice and leaves excellent lacing. Light gold in color and mostly clear with a little cloudiness. Smells amazing a strong hoppy and piney aroma that tingles the nostrils very nicely. up front you get flavors of hops, citrus, ginger and soda. On the back you get that piney bitter taste and the finish is somewhat grassy, but it works well. An above average beer that is worth a shot at this price ($8.99/6 pack) and a must for IPA lovers.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörkt guldfärgad vätska med vitt skum. Mycket humle men lite för tydlig alkohol i eftersmaken för mig.
By far the best IPA I have ever had. Very hoppy, amazing grapefruit flavor. The kind of beer you just savor.

Bottle poured into a tulip. Pours a golden orange/amber with two fingers off-white head. Some tiny floaties throughout. Nice webby lacing as the head recedes. Aromas of citrus, caramel, bready notes, resin, a little dankness. Tasting notes of grapefruit, caramel, bread, pine/resin, piney hops. Sticky and juicy mouthfeel with a semi-dry finish. Medium body.

Nice color with definite floral notes. Exotic fruit essences in addition to the strong hops presence. Good bitterness, not over powering but just enough. Heave mouth feel almost like a stout but the carbonation is the seperation. Nice lungering after taste. At least two minutes if bitterness long allows you to enjoy the flavor between sips.
Pale orange body foamy white head and some lacing. Lively citrus hoppy resin aroma. Taste is a balance between sweet and bitter, resin dominates. Medium palate. Abv well masked. Nice double IPA.

12oz bottle served in a DFH IPA glass

A - Light and clear amber with a sudsy off-white head. Speckled lacing and the head sinks into a milky cap. Great looking beer.

S - Dank hops, soapy pine, sweet barley with some caramel mixed in, sweet bread, Hawaiian rolls, hints of tropical fruit.

T - Sweet citrus, pine, grapefruit, some lemon, perfume floral, pineapple, pear, caramel malt provides sweetness and mixes well with the hops. Not a lot of bitterness. Finishes dry with semi bitterness.

M - Viscous feel, medium to full body, soft carbonation, dry finish.

This is hop forward in flavor but without the bitterness. Good balance of juicy hops and malt with the hops edging out the malt. A very tasty brew at a good price point.

11-03-2013
Piney scent with malt, yeast and some florals. Nice pour with little head. Sweet, light citrus and some bitters. Good beer.

Bottle. Good looking, clear amber colour with small lasting head.
Aroma is hoppy with grapefruit, citrus and tropical fruits.
Taste continues same than aroma with piney notes added.
Medium carbonation and slightly oily medium body.
Dry, tropical and bit sweet finish, that leaves your mouth "sticky".

Not gonna write a huge review for this one because I drank it all and forgot to do a written review. It’s darn good. It’ drinks as lightly as an IPA and has a nice succulent hop presence. Fruity and even a bit dank. Nose is hemp seed and ripe fruit. Mouthfeel is a touch of oil and a nice soft body. I would have it again.
Pours a clear, golden yellow with smallish head. Aroma has some fruit in it, but also a lot of malt. Flavor is very fruity/citrusy, with a lot of malt sweetness. Bitter finish. Pretty good.
Great beer. Very fruity. Enjoy this way more than the stereotypical fan boy IPA’s! Def. one of my top 3 favorite IPA’s.
Bittle at Black Door. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with hops, caramel, mango, pine, resin and a bit of peach. Bitter finish with hops, mango, resin and a bit of pine. Excellent double IPA.

Deep golden with a white head - good hop aromas with some fruits - a ggo dmalt to support a very good hop that has flavours of fruits and some pine , and it has a good bitterness as well - Lingering hop bitter finish with some fruits - this was good
Beautiful orange amber color with white quite lasting head. Some flower hop aroma. In taste at the beginning a bit sweet with some malts in taste flowed by flowery hops explosion. Loved it.

Återbesökt och jag höjer upp den rejält. Mitt tidigare omdöme var av riktig rookie-klass. 

Nice color and crown. Rich in hops and really lingers. Maybe the 8.2% is a bit rich.
Really fresh, floral and hoppy. Medium-heavy bitterness. Medium sweetness. A little too much taste of alcohol.
Big DIPA with fruity hop characters and majorly sweet caramel malt base. Alcohol is well hidden. Full bodied and full flavour. Great.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - no BBE info found contradicting what the label tells, at Black Door, 20140104) The beer poured deep amber and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Afteraste had citricness, malts and bitterness. A pleasant brew.

New Year’s Eve tasting Flight (2 of 3 9:47p) - bottled. Another crystal clear brew from Lagunitas with a dark orange body. Aroma reminds me of their IPA too. Very slight pine resin aroma. Flavor of pine, lemon and tangerines. Resiny backend. Medium thick mouth feel.

Pours in a amber color and with a nice head. Nose of pine, citrus and a bit of toffee. A really good malty taste with a lot of hops. Long aftertaste with a good finish.

pours a clear light orange color, one and a half fingers of frothy white head. good lacing, head lasts a while. aroma is of strong orange, grapefruit, lemongrass, pine, spruce, pineapple, and other tropical fruits. along with light caramel malts. the taste is again, lots of strong citrus’s, including grapefruit, and other tropical fruits, pine and spruce. along with light caramel malts. bitter but not over the top, just a great balance! finishes with grapefruit and pine resins. overall, a very well balanced powerful citrus bomb double IPA!

Clear copper with a nice off-white head. Aroma highly oxidized with a strong veggie note, some tropical fruit and citrus underneath. Sweet fruit hop malt candy aroma. Amber colour with good head & lacing. Stone fruit malt hop flavour. Smooth lingering palate.

Slowbeer bottle (22-Dec-2013) Big sweet luscious passionfruit. Clear amber red tinged colour, sheet lacing and good head. Biggish Passionfruit medium spice flavour. Soft balanced broad passionfruit light spice finish and light herbal tangy aftertaste.

Åh, Lagunitas. Var jag inte ett fan av er förut (och det var jag) så är jag ett fan av er nu. Så här ska en IPA smaka om jag får bestämma; mycket men samtidigt balanserat. Och, om en extra bonus, är Lagunitas Maximus ett mycket vackert öl i all sin simmiga beigehet. Stor kärlek.

Bottle @ Beer Temple, shared by Martinus. Clear golden blonde color, white head. Aroma’s: caramel, biscuity malts, piney & citrussy hops. More malt and less hop retronasal. Flavor is moderate sweet & moderate bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes with a solid bitterness. Perhaps a bit past its prime.

355ml brown short bottle poured into a Spiegelau IPA glass. Appearance is amber with particles and a medium sized foamy beige head with good retention, that when reduced left lacing on the glass. Aroma of pine, orange and lemon peels. Flavours of grapefruit, orange peels, maple syrup and caramel. Taste is light sweet and heavy bitter. Palate is medium bodied, slightly sticky texture and average carbonation. Overall a great tasty well balanced Imperial IPA.

Bottle at BeerTemple. Crystal clear gold pour with white head. Biscuity aroma, quite piney, nice american C-hop, light caramel notes. Taste is malty, biscuity, maybe falling off a little freshness-wise, hop flavor is still quite enjoyable, piney character. Palate is med-full bodied with med carbonation. Good.

Bottled about 120 days ago.

copper with a finger of fleeting white foam. Some spotty lace. The malts have come through on this one, and they are nice and fruity, apricot fruity. Some hints of grassy and resiny hops. A little hint of citric essence.

Bitter and malty with a spicy tone. I like the fruitiness of the malt backbone here. I feel compelled to find a more fresh bottle so I can dig on the take with the hops. This is a thin brew with moderate carb and wet finish. 

I like how the beer comes together being about four months old. I appreciate that the hops are still complimentary, but are subdued revealing a truly appreciable malt profile.

Nose is citrus and earthy and some flowery hops. Herbal and citrus hop flavor with noticeable sweet malt. a touch on the sweet finish side. meh

Well hopped but balanced DIPA from Lagunitas..nice copper color, aromatic with fruit, pine..really liked the dry finish..started on the palate longer than I expected..went out and got the Little Sumpin Sumpin too..which is also a winner.

Clear dark golden with a white head. Aroma and taste of hops, citrus, grass, biscuits and some malt. Also some notes of alcohol. The finish was bitter and fairly dry. Drinkable but not as tasty as expected, I wonder how old the bottle was?
Poured medium orange amber with a small off white head. Aroma of heavy tropical fruit. Full body, flavour of the aroma, mango, papaya, caramel malt. Lingering dry sweetness to finish.

Thin white head. Clear golden pour. Nice bitterness. Well hidden alcohol.
Delicious! I’ve had a few Lagunitas brews, and this one is my favorite of their IPAs. Nice citrus fruit notes, with a bit of green in the background. A True West Coast India Pale. Cheers!!
Excellent, piney, resinous, sticky. Nice hoppy aroma that stays. Long, dry, somewhat better finish.

Pours a clear copper color with big off white head. Dank hop, pine, citrus and malt aroma. Sweet hop, citrus, floral and pine flavors. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Sweet hop finish.

This is my go to beer when I'm looking for a double ipa. The price is fair at $11.99 a 6 pack. (I hope those money grubbing folks at three floyds is reading this, I Am SICK of their 22 oz bottles for $10.99) The alcohol content sets the tone but is not overwhelming.

Nice sweet, fruity off the nose. Nice and hoppy. Carbonation is perfect. The alcohol is masked perfectly.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 8/3/2013. Pours moderately cloudy golden orange color with a 2 finger dense and rocky off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big grapefruit, lemon zest, pineapple, tangerine, orange zest, floral, pine, light caramel, and floral earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great complexity of hop notes with a moderate malt balance; and great strength. Taste of grapefruit, lemon zest, tangerine, pineapple, orange zest, floral, grass, light pine, light caramel, and floral earthiness. Fair amount of earthy pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, citrus zest, pineapple, floral, light pine, light caramel, and floral earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity of citrus/floral hop flavors with a moderate malt balance; and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy, smooth, and moderately sticky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent DIPA! All around great complexity and balance of hop and moderate malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to sip on the for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

12oz bottle picked up in WI, ix/2013. Pours unctuous orange marmelade with a beautiful permanent eggwhite lacing. Usual upfront suspects in the aroma: citrus zest, mango, pineapple - ma non troppo. Heavy, treacle-ish mouthfeel supporting some sweet and ponderous taste vectors: molasses, fruit syrup, preserved candied lemon, pineapple marmelade infused with orange rind. A top coat of almost medicinal heavy pine as a reminder that this is a ponderous IIPA, not a fresh IPA. "The end is near. Don’t sip. (...) Just buy a senate seat."? In the en vague apocalyptic mode, another US attempt at superlative self-description excitedly shoots for the outrageous and languidly lands at the merely feasible. Sweet and sticky enamel stripper.

Un aroma interesante y diferente pero sumamente original y agradable. En primera instancia destacan aquellas notas que se suelen percibir en cervezas de este estilo como los son citricas, principalmente de cascara de naranja, sin embargo posteriormente se encuentran aromas de frutas tropicales, principalmente la piña y de forma discreta notas a platano.

En cuanto a su apariencia el caracteristico color naranja con un intenso brillo y una turbiedad interesante. Carbonatación muy ligera y corona de espuma mediana de baja retención.

En boca es citrica, y un muy buen equilibrio entre dulzor y amargor.

Al paladar es una bebida que inica suave y ligeramente dulce. Posteriormente se perciben ciertos sbores citros y de frutas tropicales, especialmente piña y coco.
Al final las notas destacadas son amargas y de finsl mrfio, sin embargo la intensidad del amargor no es tan fuerte como se podría esperar.

Al final podemos hablar de una cerveza muy buena y agradable. INteresante y diferente. Presenta las notas caracteristicas de una IPA y aparte olores y sabores muy particulares.

Si bien esperariamos notas mas intensas de sabor, se trata de una buenisima IPA de Lagunitas.

Poured from a bottle into my trusty Sweetwater pint glass.  Pours dark  copper with a off-white head that disapates fairly quickly, but leaves some nice splotchy lacing along the glass.  Sticking my nose into the glass I pick up grapefruit and Lagunitas.  Signature aroma and signature taste.  Although I was expecting a bit more of a pucker-up and get ready for a grapefruit bomb after smelling the aroma.  That wasn’t the case, this beer was more subdued than some of the other hopped-up Lagunitas offerings but still brought the bitter grapefruit and earthy tones.  The beer is crisp with a bit of slickness that lingers on the tongue.  The hops dominate, but there’s a biscuity malt presense for sure.  For my taste, one of my favorites from Lagunitas.

Light orange and mostly clear on the pour. Sticky head foams to 2 fingers before dying down. Mostly earthy, pine, and floral aromas. Good body with some residual malt sweetness. Hop flavors are moderate in bitterness and flavor. Finish remains slightly sweet with a little herbal notes. Respectable, but underwhelming.
Clear orange pour with a full head.  Aroma is fruit, berry and pineapple.  Nice viscosity, super smooth with a hint of bitter, but a sweet mellow aftertaste.

Pours a golden orange color (almost like a rich honey). Small light tan head. Smells like pineapple and citrus. Taste of hops, pineapple, grapefruit, and slight pine flavor. Awesome IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an amber red rusty color with a nice mocha head. Nose is sweet with a fresh citrus hoppy aroma. Taste is bitter sweet with citrus and strong pine. Full of flavor and quite easy to drink. Finish is also bitter sweet, with the citrus lingering. Nice DIPA. Quaff Score 8 / 10
Pours an amber red with an off white head and sweet aroma of hops and pine. Taste is bittersweet, lots of hops, pine, citrus, and light caramel with a strong bitter finish. Excellent DIPA

12 oz. bottle poured into tulip glass. Appearance is a slightly hazy golden-orange with moderate off-white head which dissipates pretty quickly. Aroma is a lot of citrus, especially grapefruit and orange. There is also a slight whiff of malt. The taste is a good balance of hops and malt. There is a citrus flavor which reminds me of grapefruit rind. Smooth, crisp feel without being too light. Another solid Lagunitas beer.

22oz Bottle A - Pours clear orange amber with a pillow off white head. Good retention/lacing. S - Malt and fruity hops. T - Caramel malt, pine, grapefruit, and citrus rind. M - Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Citrus rind finish. O - What I’ve come to expect from this brewery, another solid ale.

Pours gold with a skinny white head. Didnt last long and left a lasting lace. Nose is big citrus, slight honey, cereal. Palate is smooth, crisp bubbles. Starts sweet, and ends with a nice mellow bitter. Abv is well hidden. Very nice ipa. 

-Fish!
Draft with a meal (buffalo chicken salad).  Smells like fresh hops, but not a hop bomb on the palate.  Slightly carbonated palate; a bit of citrus and earthiness.  Pretty good.

Bright orange color with small white head and nice lacing. Aroma and flavor are full of great bitter hops with a little fruitiness and balanced with a nice malty finish. Good overall and great price as always from Lagunitas
Poured clear copper, with a big, bubbly, white head.  Nice grassy hop aroma.  Nice dry, grassy palate.  Smooth, with a little bit of sweetness.

Very nice floral and slight citrus tones with a sweet malt backdrop.  Crisp and refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance was clear light orangish gold with whitish lasting creamy 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are citrus, tropical fruits upfront with slight sweet crystal, pale, caramel malts, no alcohol. Taste are sweet malts but sublime, then the fruits of orange, grapefruit, lemon, melon and pine come to play nicely. Palate was smooth creamy CO2 with meduim body, then lasting balanced smooth bitter finish. A wonderful easy drinking West Coast DIPA.

Bottle poor, copper/golden white head. Floral aroma, bitter finish. over all good ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice copper clear pour with white head from 12 ouncer into a hopheads tulip glass. Nice earthy yet piney hop aroma. Taste is malty yet super Hoppy but not too bitter. Great hopped up version of the regular.

12oz bottle.  Honey colored, good lacing, medium, adhesive head.  Huge floral aroma.  Floral taste, herbal, did I mention floral?  Nice mix of tastes, pretty bitter, but pleasant.  Warm, not dry at all actually.  Medium body.  Really good beer overall.

Served out of a 22oz bomber and poured to a nice creamy head with mild lacing. The aroma is a bit earthy and a bit hop stinky ( in a good kind of stanky way [if you know what I mean]). The color is a hazy amber. Taste great with a smooth malt finish. Very tasty.
Tasted from a 22oz. bomber.  Poured clear amber with a white head and slight hop aroma. Aggressive hop taste without bitterness.

Bottle from georgios in Chicago. Pours hazy amber with off white lacing. Nose Is sweet hops. Taste is a lighter ipa and well balanced. Almost like a pale ale in taste. 

---Rated via my mouth
Another great offering from Lagunitas - hops and malt, hops and malt - they are good...

22 oz poured into pint glass.  Pours a clear dark golden color with white head.  Aromas are pine hops.  Hop presence strong but well balanced with a nice sweet malt.  Mouthfeel is medium heavy which is perfect.  Alcohol is warming but not overpowering by any means.  Easy drinkability.

Bottle->SA.  Orange/gold with frothy white head.  Aroma is nice floral and citrus hops.  Taste is bitter and juicy pine and grapefruit that is quickly followed by a nasty and boozy aftertaste.  Must have been a bad bottle, intend to re-rate, but for now this is it.  2.9 

Re-rate: fresh bottle makes all the difference.  No more nasty aftertaste, just great juicy bittersweet grapefruit hops with a decent bittersweet aftertaste.  Much better.
Fantastic beer, well balanced with great flavour and aroma. Very drinkable too. Highly recommended!

Looking at this beer in the glass, you would never know it was a double IPA. Smelling it you would think it is a boring pale ale, or something. Regardless, the flavor shows the true talent behind the hops. Oh, and the mouthfeel. The mouthfeel is incredible. The mouthfeel actually changed with every sip, and is almost a roller coaster as you drink. Good name for a good DIPA from a great brewery.

Appearance: Really nice bronze color... there’s a two finger head that leaves just a filmy top. There’s a slight haze to the beer -- lacing’s very nice.

Smell: Not your average IPA ... smells like a Two Hearted or Racer 5 -- two of my favorite IPAs ever. Very fruity, bright, hoppy. Fantastic.

Taste: One of the best I’ve had... gotta say I’m surprised the rating for this beer isn’t higher than it is. I get that tea flavor throughout each sip -- which I get from any Lagunitas IPA -- as well as some bright hops and alcohol burn. The finish has quite a bit of bitterness, but then there’s a nice balancing act from the malts. 

A BIG beer that’s surely not for wimps (Surely that’s why this is a DIPA), and I think it’s absolutely fantastic all around. If there’s really any downside, it’s simply that I doubt I’d drink more than one in a session just because it really is so "big." Not just that, but it costs about 30 cents more per bottle... not sure I’d pay that extra too often when I could get Two Hearted for a bit less.

Pours a light amber with a white fluffy head that leaves tons of lacing. Lightly carbonated. The initial aroma is very hop forward, with the dominating scent being piney and earthly. As the brew warms though, the malts definitely become present. To sum it all up, tasty.
Very smooth hoppy beer. Not overwhelming, but full flavored...........................

Amazingly hoppy aroma. Orange clear pour. A lattice of lacing covers the glass on the way down. Crisp finish. Goes down smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear light amber with a thin off-white head.  Nose is vanilla, pineapple, floral hops.  Malty backbone but tips bitter with long lasting bitter aftertaste.  Slightly oily mouthfeel. Good.
Really tasty one of my favorite ipa. If I could afford to drink it everyday I would. Beers

12oz poured into tulip. Pours amber with one and a half fingers of moderately dense off white head, which shrinks somewhat quickly, but leaves lacing. Smells like piney sappy hops, maybe a little citrus. The taste doesn’t kick your ass, but it’s sufficiently bitter, and crisp with a bitter sweet resiny after taste. The palate is excellent, Thick, but not too thick for an IPA, medium body, with a nice pillowy carbonation. I added a bonus point for the more than reasonable price.

Pours a transluscent amber...with a nice white head that does not disappear.
Big Citrus aroma... very nice smooth flavor.  Does not make one pucker, but you know it is an IPA....
Pours clear amber with nice head.  Aroma is sweet malt and pine hops. Taste is rich malt and just enough bitterness to make it very smooth.
This is another beer drinker’s IPA.  Overall a tasty west coast IPA that is must have for any IPA drinker.

The aroma reminds me of warm pineapple mellow citrus perhaps apricot or pear with a little  earthy sweet hay in the background and a slight vanilla. Appearance is just a tad lighter than umber clear and clean. The ale pours with a neutral beige head that dissipates quickly, lacing is present but light. This is not a smack you in the face hoppy IPA but the florals at the back and under the tongue give this brew a very juicy mouth feel.  Maximus finishes quite nicely with a lingering soft hop tingle. This is solid and worthy of praise. I don’t think there’s a wow factor but this a very pleasing offering.

Fresh bottle poured in a teku glass 

A: Crystal clear dark orange with a pillowy, foamy substantial white head.  
S: Upon cracking it open huge fresh pine and bitter sugared grapefruit peel wafted out.  As it settled the aroma became less intense, sadly; however, still great.  Grapefruit and pine bitterness, tropical fruit sweetness, and some notable caramel to finish it off. Juicy but dry.
T: Full of flavor.  Smacked with pine and grapefruit bitterness first, then sweet citrus and caramel.  Finishes dry
P: Nice, refreshing, medium bodied appropriately carbonated ipa.  
O: This is a damn good beer when fresh.  Well balanced west coast style

Bottle picked up at Whole Foods in Las Vegas. Pour is deep copper with a fluffy cream head. Earthy, caramel, cardboard, somewhat oxidized, light grapefruit, orange peel, and bread in the aroma. Taste is grapefruit peel, bread, sweet caramel, toffee, light grass, oxidation, and malt with a light bitter finish. Medium body with soft carbonation. This one is a bit past it’s prime.

Had from the bottle. Poured a nice golden yellowish orangish color with a huge head that laces very well. Aroma is a little cirtusy, smooth, and caramely. The taste is a little cirtusy, caramely, and pretty creamy. This is a delicious  DIPA that is definitely one of my favorites. It is easy to drink and tastes delicious. I split a bottle of this with a friend during a beer tasting party and out of 5 or so different beers this was our favorite and we will definitely be getting it again in the near future.

I love a brewer with attitude, and Lagunitas has attitude.  This is a phenomenal ipa.  Rich beige head that sticks around for a while with a lot of lacing.  Wonderful aroma.  Sweet caramel aroma, vanilla and citrus.  Smells like the best of the best IPA’s generally do.  Mouthfeel is  like drinking liquid velvet!  Taste is marvelous!  A rich bed of caramelly malts gives way to a vicious hoppy bitterness!  Just enough hops to make it great, and just enough malts to make it drinkable.  To use words I found on the bottle, "The end is near, don’t sip!" This is probably one of my favorite IPA’s
I loved this brew, bitter and hoppy but closer to an amber than their ipas...a perfect blend

Bottle at home. Pours clear copper with white viscous head. Aroma is piney, earthy, dank with some citrus - like a handful of hops pellets. Taste is strong bitterness quickly balanced by the malt. Pleasant bitter aftertaste.

Pours a nice copper, not much of a head. Scent is lots of citrus fruits, grapefruit and so on. Very sweet and malty up front before the hops take over, though they aren’t overwhelming in any sense. Medium body, goes down fairly easy. Not the best DIPA I’ve had, but not bad by any means.

Bottle at P house. Clear golden pour with not much head/lacing. Ultra hoppy imperial ipa. Notes were mostly pine, grapefruit, grass, oat and tropical citrus. Very aggressively hopped even for these guys. Medium in body with active carbonation.

Bouteille 660ml, courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou Blankboy. De couleur orangée-dorée et voilée. Nez de houblon citrique et résineux, malté de caramel doux et sucré, fruité (agrumes sucrées, notes d’abricots et de pêche) et léger d’alcool doux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture moyennement huileuse. Goût moyen-amer de houblon citrique, floral et moyennement résineux (qui dure toute la gorgée) avec un goût fruité (agrumes sucrées, léger d’abricots, notes de pêches) avec des notes de grains de malt sucrés lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de caramel doux avec des notes de biscuits puis en finale, l’on assiste à un regain d’amertume de houblon résineux, moyennement asséchant et aux notes herbeuses ainsi qu’avec un léger goût d’alcool très doux. Post-goût long et un peu sec, moyen-amer de houblon floral, résineux, moyen-léger citrique et aux notes herbeuses avec un goût fruité (zeste d’agrumes).

very average DIPA if you’re from the west coast.   has a ’mass produced’ feel like a cold night on a detroit assembly line.  touch watery, lacking in body and depth of flavor hop taste is almost an also-ran.  can do much better.

A: a strong malt aroma with faint citrus hops. The aroma smells a little off from what I remember last time I had this, hopefully mine is not bunk.. A: pours a cloudy orange with a small head. Everybody keeps describing this beer as clear, I don’t see it, hopefully mine is not bunk. T. more malty than hoppy for an IPA. Tastes great just not what you would expect from an IPA. Booze also is detected. P: full bodied with average carbonation. O: a great tasting beer but if you are looking for a hop bomb this might not be it. A must try though.

crystal clear with half-pinky of bright white head and solid lacing. Nose is loaded with fresh tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, grapefruit, tangerine. Taste is sweet with malt at the front, and ends with sticky, resinous fruit aftertaste. Medium carbonation.

Pours copper brown with a small head. Tastes of grapefruit, pine and malt. Very well balanced. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear bright orange with a two finger off white head which fades to nice lacing.  Aroma is of citrus, pine, floral hops, and some sweet malts.  Taste is initially hoppy with some citrus and pine and some tropical fruits, but has more malt on background with some sweet caramel and graham cracker malts.  Has a medium body with a slightly creamy, yet slightly fizzy mouhtfeel, a dry, semi bitter, slightly boozy finish.  overall, a decent DIPA that is well balanced but does not do a good job of hiding it abv.

I’m a little mixed on this one as it was more mellow than expected. The aroma was not strong with more of the floral essence. Nice amber color with minimal head. Nice smooth palate with a crispness at the end and a nice level of carbonation. This had some fruit off flavors with a hops bitterness that was blended in well but not strong for an imperial.

Bottle from Julios. Pours out a deep clear golden orange with a thin head, and fine, bubbly carbonation. Citrus-bread aromas. Flavor is very smooth, well balanced sweetness and good honey, spice with a lingering light bitterness on the backside. ABV is superbly masked. I will be buying the entire 6-pack next time!
Lately I can't get enough of this beautifully balanced and pleasingly flavored IIPA. I enjoy a Sumpin' Sumpin' Ale first, then a Maximus. Makes for a wonderfully hoppy evening.

Nice looking, clear and tannish/orange with a nice lasting head and sticky lacing.

Piney Colorado forest type pine aroma, plenty of citrus too.  Hops dominate the aroma.

Flavor is pretty nice.  A notable light fruity sweetness compliments the piney, grapefruit notes that were so present in the nose.  Malt base is merely complimentary, it’s again mostly hops.

Body is well carbonated, medium, and a bit slick/sticky on the back end.

Overall it’s worthy of the name Lagunitas, which should say enough right there.  But I’ll add that I’m glad I picked up a sixer of this.  The brand name made me non-leary of trying a whole sixer rather than just a single, even tho I could have picked up a single at the large liquor store I found this at (Gabriel’s, San Antonio).
Bottle - dark gold with a lace ring. Hoppy aroma and an earthy (pine) hop taste. Medium body and a creamy mouthfeel.
citrus, earthy, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium body, slick feel, long finish,
From a bottle shared at home.  Pours a medium gold with a thick white head.  Citrus hop aroma.  Flavors of pineapple, grapefruit and spicy orange zest.  Bitter finish.
12oz bottle.  Now available in NM!  Pours a dark golden color with generous frothy white head.  Aroma is strongly citrusy hops.  Smooth hoppy bitter flavor.  Not too intense, but quite good.
Hops, hops and more hops! Nice hoppy flavor, with citrus, nicely balanced.  My favorite from Lagunitas.

12 oz bottle. Clear golden hue with foamy lasting white head, decent lacing, smells of citrus and candy, taste has some lemon bitterness, medium body, mild bitterness, seems more like an IPA with hidden alcohol. Faint lemon, candy and bitterness. Not too much of any one thing. Very nice. My fav from Lagunitas so far.

0.355l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. Gusher! But perfectly saved by ClubGonzo. This is a cloudy honey-colored one with a quickly sidesticking off-white top. Hoppy and light sticky aroma. Some boiled down red berries and traces of pine. Quite a classic dipa aroma. It’s soft on the carbonation and oily on the mouthfeel. Yeah, it’s definitely not fresh this bottle, but it’s still tasty. Light soapy and almost a pungent flavor here. Slightly pine traces also. Could have had some more carbonation, but it has some decent flavors this. 05.01.2012
Holy hops!  Hops hot the nose hard, but then you get some nice citrus.  The taste matches the nose.  Bitterness across the palate.  Damn fine beer, damn fine.

This version varies so much, sometimes even within a single sixer. Sometimes its a true IPA, others its almost got a Barleywine sweetness to it that you have to be ready for. Pours a dark golden orange with a huge floral/citrus nose at first... but sometimes the caramel/brown sugar sweetness completely takes over. This beer would rate much higher if it were more consistent. Still a very good beer that I would recommend to anyone.

Bottle pour. Pours a thin white head that sticks around for a while. Didn’t think the original lagunitas IPA was hoppy enough, they solved the issue here. Lot of citrus aroma and flavor, great hops, smooth as hell for 8%+. A bomb west coast ipa. Reminds me a lot of green flash’s imperial ipa. Well done.

Really flavorful ipa that isn't too bitter.  Goes down really smooth.  Just like the rest of lagunitas products, it is incredible 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a delicious golden orange with a modest amount of head. Aroma is amazing with loads of citrusy floral tones. Theres also a bit of caramel present beneath the floral tones. Bitter tastes permeate the whole sip and the beer finishes off dry and delicious. Despite the bitter there is a sweetness to the beer as well that makes it very refreshing and enjoyable as a post work beer!

Pours golden to orange with a cream-colored head consisting of larger bubbles that leave behind a zig-zag patchwork of lace. Nose involving resinous, citric, and spicy hops with some doughy bread notes and a touch of honey. Taste is pretty sweet with plenty of bitterness. Lighter side of medium bodied, a touch oily and slippery, with a pronounced bitterness on the end. Refreshing, quite tasty, balanced. Good stuff.
Dark straw color.  Thin head.  Smells floral.  Wonderful hop flavor....grassy and floral.  This is an awesome IPA.

It has a honey color in the glass with a medium head. Aroma of citrus and some pine. First thing I get on the taste is pears and some apples. There is some hops and resin that showup on the backend. Crisp with a good finish.

Fantastic aroma of citric hops and caramel malt spews from a light amber liquid with suspended granular sediment. The taste rocks of sour bitters and caramel malty notes. While a good beer, I've had better balanced from Lagunitas, especially of an impy.

Brought in the new year with this brew. Slight to almost no head..light lacing and a dark amber in color. Aroma was hoppy and slightly musky. Taste was not as bright or flavorful as their regular IPA. Fairly good, but there are others that I prefer.

Pours a nice, clear, goldish amber. Great floral and pine aroma up front. Big piney hop flavor up front, with a touch of grapefruit at the end. A bit of lingering dryness at the end, though the first few sips made my mouth water. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden pour with a small white head.  Aroma is piney with some grass, and a little bread.  Taste is similar with a grapefruit citrus on the finish.

Tap @ PD. Clear gold pour with a persistent, short white head leaving moderate lace. Nose is pine, biscuit and grass. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Pine, tangerine, biscuit, walnuts and some ethanol bitterness creeping in as it warms. Finish is medium, grapefruit bitter and dry.
nice copper pour with a quick fading head. Light smell... citrus and flowery pine. Watery mouthfeel, citrus and malt. Good beer for the ABV and 11.99/sixer price tag but overall pretty average.
12 ounce bottle at the Brass Tap, pours an amber color aroams of sweet malt, light citrus, and some pine.  Flaovrs are teh same, light pine in the aftertaste, ok beer overall.

Pours amber with no head to speak of.  The aroma is all piney hops, maybe a little bit of a floral thing, too.  The flavor is just big, dry, bitter pine hops.  There is a very slight, buttery malt in the background, but you gotta look for it.  As IPAs go this one is pretty simple.  It won’t convert new IPA fans, but if you already like it bitter, this ain’t bad.

Pours a translucent copper with a thick white head. Aroma of citric cops and bitter piney hops. Taste follows but with a sweet malt backbone not bad a little too sweet for a double IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample. Thanks Yoav. Pours clear dark amber with white head. Ripe peach, sugar and cherry aroma, sweet and cake-like. Malty bitterness with sweet, candy-like undertones. Medium body, sweet finish, well-carbonated. Definitely past its prime.

In bottle, crystal clear with half-pinky of bright white head and solid lacing. Nose is loaded with fresh tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, grapefruit, tangerine. Taste is sweet with malt at the front, and ends with sticky, resinous fruit aftertaste. Medium carbonation that leaves you wanting more. Overall an excellent DIPA, not on par with Pliny, but in terms of availability and price, an excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a copper orange color with a 2-finger white head that sticks around until the last sip. I noticed that this beer has some floaters in it (Lagunitas doesn’t filter their beers), but that doesn’t bother me. It also has some alcohol legs, which doesn’t surprise me for an 8.2% beer.

The aroma is pine and BIG sweet citrus and pineapple. It also has a bit of resinous hop aroma in there as well.

The flavor is pine, sweet caramel maltiness with a nice hop bitterness to balance it out. I also pick up a little bit of a bready maltiness as well.

Overall, this is one of my favorite IPA’s. It’s in the top five for sure. Massive hop flavor and aroma and a big malt backbone to balance it out makes this beer one of my favorites.
Aroma was way off, so I was expecting harsh, but it had great balanced flavor.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours an amber color, with a thick maltes head. Aroma of hops, citrus and pine. A hoppy peach taste. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice....very nice. It seems the dark amber color alludes to its full flavor. The aroma is thin, but the initial taste is BOLD. I can’t figure out the hops, but the full flavor is awesome. It is a chewy beer, with flavors on front side and backside. nice

12 oz bottle pours amber with a off white head.  Aroma of citrus, pine and malts.  Taste is sweet, malt, citrus and a nice bitterness.

Big forthy head, leaves some lacing. Aroma is pine, floral and caramel.
Very malty taste, caramel, butterscotch. Also a lot of hoppy bitterness and fruityness. Pretty sweet.

On tap at Carpool in Herndon/Reston, VA. 

Clear, red-orange copper with large off-white head and excellent lacing.

Aroma of pine, resin, citrus, grain and caramel.

Taste of pine, citrus, grain and caramel.

Full/medium body and medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 355ml. Pours a white soda head. Leaves a thin layer behind. Orange and peach for color. Powerful lovely aroma of roses, blackcurrant and rose champagne with a hint of licorice. Taste of honey and artificial blackcurrant. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is surely my Go to IPA!  Love the slight malty backbone and the nice dry hoppy finish. ABV is well hidden!
Oh far out man, crank it to the max, don’t be afraid to slam some of this juice down your wanton yapper!! Love the pup logo love this beer Lagunitas makes stupendous brew!

Intense citrus/pine aroma, mildy malty and smell a bit of alcohol. Medium copper colored, clear. Taste is malty, dryer than average. Good amount of hops. Medium bodied. Alcohol well masked in the taste.
Aroma is pine and a hint of malts and citrus.  The flavor is grapefruit, spices, citrus, malts and a tangy/bitter finish.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pous a clear medium copper with a one finger white head that fades away rather quickly leaving a thin cap and a little bit of lacing on the sides of the glass.

Aroma has the typical Lagunitas tropical fruit character. A touch of pine with a backing of bread and caramel albeit on the light side. Hops really dominate.

The passionfruit and pine carried over into the flavor with Tons of tropical fruit up front. This is followed by a little bit of yeasty banana and a flash of ethanol. Bitterness is moderate to high leading to a dry, almost chalky, mouthfeel. Not much malt in the flavor maybe just a touch of bread. The body is a little bit thin which aids drinkability but somewhat subtracts from the overall experience.

Overall, this is an ok beer but middle of the road as far as IIPA’s go. The body is a little too dry and this isn’t too much different from their standard IPA. Hop Stoopid is better and I probably won’t seek this one out again.

Maximus! Maximus! Maximus! 6 pac, pours dark amber with medium white suds which trace the glass nicely. Smells of fruit and candied pecans. Tastes like medium malty body with hints of honey with mild hoppy aftertaste.

Max-I-mus ihops here-  this guy screams out like Freddy Mercury at the Bronco Bowl- loud, smooth, rich, controlled and unforgettable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear light amber with a small white head that dissipates with some lacing. Aroma is surprisingly malty with forward notes of caramel and bread with a pine/citrus backing. Flavor is about the same, medium to quite sweet, light to medium bitter and a bit grassy on the finish.
Very balanced, amber colored beer. Disapearing head. Aroma with caramel imfluences. Greatly hopped with citrus flavours och remaining bitterness.

[bottle]
Potent hops aroma: cat piss, tropical, and citrus. Almost crystal clear orangiish-rose gold under a lasting off-white cover. Hops forward flavour: a bit of cat pee and bitter grapefruit peel with a not overpowered malt backbone. Medium body, medium carbonation, lingering slight bitterness.

Nummer 600! Och ett trevligt jubileumsöl. Hälls upp och ett tjockt, långvarigt vitt skum lägger sig ovan den honungsfärgade drycken. Lite brödig, apelsinig arom. Alkoholen sticker till direkt i munnen, sen kommer en klibbig känsla, och smakerna av apelsin och karamell fyller på. Mer beska, mindre alkohol hade varit önskvärt.

I love this beer.  A go to when I have no other option.  Always available with a great price tag.  I?m not going to go into a description of this masterpiece, I know you all have tried it.  It is what I think of when I hear IIPA.  A total hop bomb.

ok, open first one, realize it is leaking and flat, so that sucked.  Opened another, get an awesome color of copper, nice big head and robust, malty and hoppy aroma.  Normal IPA flavors of slight citrus and fruity sweetness, good full malt feel in the mouth. Alcohol really well hidden in there too, really snuck up on me.  Great beer, kinda wished for a little more unique flavor though.

Citrus mixed with pine aroma. Pours a thick malted head. Amber colored and Sweet (peaches?  what is that fruit i taste?) on the tip of the tongue and finishes with a hoppy wallop. Very refreshing. Be warned though. At 8.2% ABV refreshing can quickly give way to sleeping !
