Lightly sweet, which gives this beer a hop nectar type taste.  This beer was not as bitter or hoppy as I was expecting.  It is pretty good though.  It is a bit too thick for my taste though.
Aroma is hoppy with a hint of fruitiness - pears, apricots. Appearance is a coppery amber. Flavor is fruity up front iwth a very nice hoppy finish. A very satisfying IPA.
Bigger alcohol, bigger hop presence, and same chewy caramelly malt as in their IPA. Wonderful to the last drop. Thanks to SDBruboy!

Golden, bit of a copper tint, minimal white lacing - aroma is heavy with pine - nice malt/hop balance - not as aggressively hopped as many Cali. beers, but that doesn't have to be a bad thing - citrus, maybe even some melon, and a nice woodiness - a mouthful of sweet maltiness in the initial flavor makes way for a clean, hoppy finish - very smooth considering its alcohol content.

It's like an amped up IPA from Lagunitas, which I guess is its intent.  More hops, more citrus, but balanced with more caramel flavors and some dry orange peel.  Mild mouthfeel with a medium finish.  Good and smooth.

Slightly hazy burnt orange with a medium white head.  Lots of yeast in the bottom of the bottle.  Strong orange, pineapple, much like a Pina Colada aroma.  A nice hop bite.  Orange taste, slight pine.  The citrus remains throughout the 22oz beer, very enjoyable.  The finish is not bitter nor dry, easy drinking for an 8% beer.

Slightly hazy orange/amber colour with a medium-sized dense off-white head. Super strong hoppy aroma with the alcohol noticeable. Medium-bodied; Strong hoppyness in the taste with a slight medicinal quality. Aftertaste very hoppy and fairly alcoholic. Overall, a great IPA one to be had by everyone! I owe a great big deal of thanks to Phil (Haddon90) for bringing this 65 cL bottle back all the way from California for me to sample on my visit to Knoxville on 27-September-2003.

Bottle.  Clear amber color with a medium white head that dissipated rather quickly - still this is a brew that screams "drink me, drink me now wimp!"  Aroma is hops, hops and more hops, grapefruit and juniper with caramel malts lurking in the background.  Flavor begins with slightly smokey malt sweetness, which is quickly bitch-slapped and thrown aside by the agressive lemon and pine hops which overpower the tongue and loiter menacingly in the mouth long after swallowing.  Medium bodied, with a smooth, creamy mouthfeel that belies the otherwise belligerent nature of this fine brew.  Not for the faint of hops.

Nice orange color,slightly hazy.The aroma was hoppy,citrusy and some what spicy but mainly the hops and citrus shine on this one.The taste was better then i expected,light malt,hops and citrus with a nice hint of spice.the after taste seemed like a long take on the hops and citrus.A bit more hops then i'm used to but this one was quite pleasant and worth having a few more around for later.

About the same color as Ruination.  Taste is very smooth with a malty piney flavor.  Mouthfeel is kind of oily.  Ilike the balance on this one.  It's very easy to drink.  I really like this and will have to compare it with my other favorites like Ruination and Alesmith.
Pours a hazy gold color, minimal head.  Aroma is unsurprisingly, hoppy.  Flavor is hops hops and hops with small but detectable alcohol taste.
Bottled. Very good beer. Nice dry hop flavor to it. Alcohol could have been a little higher for this.

Lagunitas is fast becoming one of my favorite breweries. I really enjoy their plain old pale ale (very delicious and understated). Maximus oh man! Pours orangey as many have noted. Plenty of hops in the aroma, a taste follows through with citrus and malt giving way to moreish bitterness. This beer sticks to the inside of my mouth and for at least ten minutes after my final sip I can blow out my breath and inhale the sweet memory. I only do this in private. When my wife told me to brush my teeth I said: "But... but the SWEET MEMORY!" There are no institutions within reasonable driving distance so here I remain.
A nice IPA.  I enjoyed this one much more than sierra nevada, but it is not as tight as Stone IPA.  Yeasty, citrus, hop flavors throughout.

Note If they decide to create a new entry for the 8.4 abv "Limited Release" - 8 5 7 4 16 - more fruitiness, fresher aroma, thicker mouthfeel.  Overall a solid strong "IPA" - as it is not really classified as one. Pleasant bright orange appearance with a sticky bubbly, white head with generous lacing. The aroma is citrusy with some floral notes but not quite as fragrant as I would have liked.  Solid IPA flavor - grapefruity and tangy but leaves too much of a bitter taste in the aftertaste - I expects some from an IPA this strong - but it is a tad distracting in this one. Still a solid entry in the field of over the top hoppy beers - but needs work and a bit of refinement.

Tastes and smells like it just came fresh out of the oven.  A very doughy fresh bread aroma.  This was not nearly as strong as I expected it to be, I was looking for something along the lines of Ruination, but was instead nicely balanced and complex with lots of caramel malts and delectible hops/  Lots of different fruity and floral arrangments going on with each sip, and absolutely no achohol burn present in any sense.  A session strong ale if you will.

Aroma is not of a strong floral hop as expected but of an almost "hop bread" aroma, not hoppy, not yeast, but a harmony of the two, hard to describe. Flavor was not as hoppy as expcted, balanced and complexly malty. This I could drink all night, not bad at all, alcohol isn't detectable whatsoever.

Hop, hop hooray! This didn't remove my enamel, it removed my teeth! Very "beery" hops in the aroma, emanating from surprisingly light amber body. Aromas of cut grass, citrus, pine, vanilla bean, sage and thyme abound. ?First sensation upon swallowing is a cutting sweetness that slides under the doormat of the flavors. The flavor is all orange, tangerine, flower petals, and alcohol, all under the auspices of an intense bitterness, of course. Finishes with considerable sweetness and a prominent numbing sensation in the back of your throat.

Nice reddish/brown hue with a massive white head and great lacing. Aroma is very piney and roasted. Hints of grapefruit, butterscotch, and allspice. Starts slighhty sweet but then the large pine taste rushes to the palate like a Defensive End after a Quarterback on 3 and 20, eyes wide open with a goal of complete domination. To say the finish was bitter would be saying that the Mona Lisa is a nice painting, very understated. A palate destroyer for sure, I'm gone to eat a box of Grape Nuts to clean my palate...Wicked brew for your favorite hophead, but why share?

Clear copper with some sediment and a fully puffy white head.  Strong hoppy and caramel malt aroma.  Body starts lightly sweet and becomes more bitter and hoppy finishing with a sticky, dry bitterness.  Decent, almost syrupy  palate brings out some more malt, but in the end fails to balance the tremendous amount of hops.

Interesting and hoppy aroma, faintly woodsy and earthy, with some tangerine and pineapple citrus, herbal spice and toasty, caramel malt sweetness.  Light orange-amber color, unfiltered and heavily sedimented, with a fine, creamy head.  Good dosage of fresh piney, fruity, citrusy and spicy hop bitterness and flavor, blended nicely with toasty, sweet, light caramel malt.  Finish is nicely bittering and juicy.  Quite tasty.
Quite a beefy IPA.  Something in the Arrogant Bastard realm.  It was cloudy amber and somewhat sweet and malty at first... Good hoppiness that finishes very bitter and dry.  I like it.

A deep amber color in the pour, a nice head that lingers along the glass. Malty presence in the aroma as well as the hops. Nice taste with a bite on the hops. A very good strong ale. I'll certainly buy it again.

Dark amber brown colour with a medium, quickly diminshing head.  Fairly large malt presence in the aroma, that mixes well with the pine and hop cone notes. . .  Good flavours on the tongue - grapefruit and pine . . but the strong bitter palate could use some finishing and rounding out - some spice or soft fruits would have been nice - this is overhopped without enough accompaniments.  Overall still a nice IPA, but a bit too much for me.

great golden amber color with a very small head.  Very hoppy with an exceptional after taste.  Lagunitas does not make a bad beer and this is no exception.  However i prefer thier standard india pale ale and not the Maximus.

Brownish amber, nice healthy head. Piney citrus  very familiar IPA aroma. Very familiar IPA flavors, with an extra kick of hops and alcohol pushing this into the low end of the 'Big Beer' category. Very enjoyable, beginning to like this  brewery alot.

Rerate: Lots of different hop flavors abound - full range of pine and citric yumminess.  Slight alcohol at the finish.  Very enjoyable.

Rich pine aroma.  Luscious malty flavor combines with bitter hop resin.  Lots of floaties at the end.  Delivers what it promises and is very good.

Nice California IPA but these are beginning to be predictable. Nice fluffy head atop a deep copper ale. First whiff reminded me of grape jelly and I have no idea why. After poured aroma became more hoppy and piney. Smooth and balanced with an adequate hop and malt presence. A litle bitter on the finish but still a decent brew.
Earthy fruity nose. Orange color. Bitter yeasty fruity flavor with a bitter chocolate finish. Was wanting to like this more, but it was a bit one sided needed more malt for balance.

So i went to San Francisco and my brother (Volgon) sez, "bring me back a buncha beers" so i got this and a bunch more.  thank goodness they didn't burst or anything in my luggage from CA to NH.  anyways, i like the label of this.  Bold...simple...to the point.  good aroma, and pretty good hoppy flavor.  it was nice overall.

Definite citrus overtones in this symphony of hoppiness.  A somewhat cloudy color that's sweet and spiced with an IPA being at the center of it's world.  If that makes any sense, I just wanna give the DaSilky one a shout out for being an assclown.

Split a I.B.U. 72.41, O.G. 1.080 Net Contents 1 pint 6 fluid ounces. Barcode number 23830 00003 with Brock, Had out of a chimay glass while the room temperature was a cool 19 degrees celcius, dexter the cat was in the room tossing his own salad, the tv was on channel 30 and Sean sent my 19 meaningless im's. Just so Blake doesn't get one up on me. make that 19. So this was a nice lake water sandy color orange with a healthy head.  Good on the citrus with sugar or molassas or something sweet coming thru, even a mild amount of spice. Very malty and extremely hoppy, I feel as if i ate a fucking christmas tree. Has a smooth finish to it. Damn smooth for being so powerful. Nice brew.

One sniff and you know you are dealing with a west coast IPA.  Light yellowish orange, standard IPA color.  Decent brussels lace with a remaining light head down to the bottom of the beer.  Alcoholic, you can taste it on the sides of your tongue.  Obvious cascade hops linger and linger.  Tastay beer but not breathtaking.  There are better IPA's to be had.
Gold copper amber; smells like "kind bud". It tastes like it too. Fruity. SO west coast. A little paper-like aftertaste, probably from too many hops. Hopheads, feed like Jackals...
wow... definitely what an IPA should taste like! strong hop flavor, great color with a thin small head, sharp but mellow at the same time, easily drinkable beer
Dense, rocky head amber color. Nice pine plus citrus hop notes, toasty malt flavor
Light brown with a quick desipating white head. Smells hoppy and perfumy. Taste hoppy and tangy. Mouthfeel is like a barleywine. Semi-drying.

Caramel, peaches, and malt aromas.  Taste of maple, sugar, with a peachy hop flavor at the end.  This one is missing a strong fruity side to balance the hop bitterness, though it is quite nice, and is a change from the more overpowering IPAs.

Godbless all the great brewers who have followed suit in making these great IPAs,... whatever they want to call 'em. (Double, Imperial, whatever) This one pours a deep straw color with a beautiful long-lasting rocky head. Aromas of lemon-grass and oh my,.. a lot of hops. In the words of the great Tommy Chong, "It kinda grabs you by the poopoo." Well balanced but man those malts must look like Michael Spinks after the fight with Iron Mike.

A clear copper color and a medium sized rocky head that quickly dissapated. A strong hop aroma with some citrus and hints of pine and caramel. The flavor is hopped, but not overly, with piney notes, grass and citrus acidity. Good bitterness with a dry finish. Solid.

Bright pink-orange. Yellowish, thick head, disappearing. Citrussy nose, noble hops. Very hoppy, lemony taste. Outspoken hopbitter. Slightly harsh finish going into resinous. Well bodied. Good carbonation, but CO2 can’t win from the hops. Aftertaste are hops, resinous again. Very IPA. Mind you, it could grow on me.
Deep golden yellow with a great, lasting white head and a fresh, pine spicey nose.  Sharp hop bitterness like candied grapefruit rind, over top of a smooth caramel sweetness.  Very good beer.
Great aroma of hops and citrus.  Good deep copper thick color with a nice head.  Nice balance of malt at first, then the hops hit you over the head with a strong finish.

Pours with a hazy amber color. good head retention. As you would expect the flavor of this beer was totaly dominated by the hops. A good beer although I would like a little more balance. If you are a Hop Head this beer is for you.
One of my favorites, do not pass up this beer.  _TONS_ of hops, get some baby!!!  Nice golden color, great bitter-hops taste.  mmmmm...
Slightly hazy, dark copper color.  Hoppy aroma backed up with a little sweetness.  Flavor is the same.  Fairly thick and satisfying mouthfeel.  Bitterness is somewhat subdued despite 70+ ibus.

Big strong tastes in this one - maximum sticky hop resins backed up with huge malty sweetness gave this some real fruity characterisitcs.  The palate was extremely creamy and thick.  Hops were listed at 77 IBU, but, maybe because of the malt balance, it actually seemed tamer than their IPA.  Refreshing.

Pours a hazy, caramel color with a huge white head that leaves strange, beautiful rocky formations as it dissipates.  The aroma is quite pleasant.  Creamy, malty caramel exudes sweet, perfumey hop scents.  The flavor is dominated by strong citrus and pine notes.  The malt exists but isn't quite enough to balance it all out.  The hop flavor is nice.  Strong, but not overbearing.  A damn good IPA, but a little better balance would make this incredible.

Golden color, lingering head left some lacing on the glass.  Fresh hop aroma with just a touch of malt in the background.  Flavor matches the aroma with the balance on the bitter side.  Bitter dry finish.  I could drink a lot of this beer.
Golden orange colour.  WOnderful floral hop aroma.  Bitter, crisp flavour with a little malt underneath.  Je l'aime.
This is one of the best IPA's around. Nice hoppy flavor! Balance between hops and malts just right. Bitter yet floral. This one is BOLD!

VERY fruity IPA.  I don't know what the hops variety is but wow what a distinct flavor.  Very dry and bitter but a nice clean finish. I really like the IPA.  It's a little different than most but its a nice change.

This one pours a cloudy deep golden color with a big white head that lingers. It has a strong fruity hop aroma that is very piney and has hints of oranges in it. It has a medium body and big hoppy flavor, but is not bitter in the finish. Oranges come up in the aroma and flavor. The malts are there, just under the hops, they are side by side in the finish. An excellent IPA.

Strange.  I found their IPA a bit over the top.  Maybe I expected an overwrought beer with this one, so I was not as disappointed.  Fresh hop stickiness is the main story here and freshness is the appeal.  Still too bitter and for a similar beer, would prefer Bell''s Two Hearted.  Pretty good stuff, though.
Definatly one of the better IPA's i have had in awhile. Very well crafted brew that should please most hop heads.
It''s a very good IPA. Citrus aroma and a citrus taste, but a little more than that, I can taste the malt.  Pretty sweet, but a good IPA.

Dazzling, sparkling ,snazzy...top was collapsed avalanche ...aroma sung with chrismas trees with fruity candy-canes and hot lawnmowers...wam bam thank you mam hop onslaught...fruit cocktail with little cherries kept the hops from completely taking over...imagine chewing endlessly on a grapefruit peel...Exactly what an IPA should be like

Strong sour-apple hops aroma. Nice citrusy (grapefruit mostly) flavor with a heavy bitter kick to it. I did not detect the high alcohol content in the flavor or the aroma. Typical hazy orange color that I''ve come to associate with strong American IPA''s. The finish left a crisp acidic feel on my tongue.
I dont think I could add anything hopscotch didnt cover.This is a great IPA that is all hop,hops,hops. Another good one from Lagunitas.All I could want is a little more malt to balance.

HOPS HOPS HOPS!!!
The aroma is very floral and piney. Herbal with a suggestion of grapefruit. Very interesting blend within the aromas.
Golden and cloudy. Frothy white head that is mostly lasting. Excellent lacing.
Slightly sweet and malty up front. Tremendously bitter on the backside. Full-bodied. Lively carbonation with a creamy mouthfeel. Long, bitter, slightly sweet finish. Hop Heads Rejoice!!! Good IPA.

This beer has the most beautiful head I''ve ever seen. Too bad its a style I don''t care for. Way too hoppy. The English invented this style and got it right, West Coast brewers took it too far. I thought the head was really great though.....
sharp flowery hop aroma, extreme bitterness at times gets too rubbery but the hops just keep building
If you like hops, this is the brew for you.  Nice hop aroma.  Good balance throughout the body.  Finishes nice and bitter.

Medium brown color. Medium Head. Extremely hoppy IPA, some maltyness. Very full flavor, nearly chewy. Smooth maltyness. Finish is smooth and crisp. Aftertaste is bitter. High alcohol 7.5%.. A very strong IPA. Not for everyone, but a very interesting beer.
Nice lacy head,  citrus notes,  dry finish.  Hophead heaven.................
Wow!!! What a wonderful fruity, bitter, hoppy IPA.  This really is a keeper, nice texture in the mouth and a great summer beer (for hopheads).

Powerful flowery citrusy Cascade hop aroma.  Hoppy, grapefruit, tea flavor with a bitter/slightly sour/crisp finish.  The hops totally dominate and there is little discernable malt flavor.  Absolutely delicious, one of the best California-style IPA's I've ever had.
Slightly cloudy orange with a dense foam head. Maximus hopus grapefruit/ orange peel up front, just a hint of malt sweetness then,  POW hop bitter/ sour aftertaste finish.
Hoppy, hoppy, hoppy!  Almost a grapefruit hop nose.  Decent malt body.  Huge hops on the finish.  Not for the amature.

Fairly pale yellow-orange color with a massive head. Very citric hop aroma with some apricots and a little malt. Flavor is overwhelmingly bitter with some hop flavor and some malt. Medium body. I've had this many times on tap at the Covered Wagon in SF when it was a seasonal and lemme say, it's dangerous to drink as a session beer! A quite tasty beer that might be a tad unbalanced towards the bitter end of the spectrum. A hophead's delight.

Golden-reddish in color with a slightly yellow, creamy head. Floral hoppyness in the nose. Sour, citric flavor that fades to an earthy spicyness. Lots of hop bitterness that begins toward the middle and increases toward the end. This is quite different from most american IPA's. Seems like it is pretty much hop soda, but it is not overwhelmingly hoppy. The malt does just enough to keep it real interesting.
fresh texas st augustine + water + yeast = lagunitas maximus....hoppy as hell....very nice if you are in the mood for it, but not as good as the stone IPA.

Sliced grapefruit for breakfast wafts up to greet you. Orange, this is definitely orange. This leans quite a bit toward the citrus side of the fence. The grapefruit, orange peel taste is kind of interesting, but a bit distracting. The bitter lingers on the inside for quite awhile, yet without that coating feeling you sometimes get from high octane hops. Nice, but could do without so much grapefruit.

Pretty burnt orange; Head was massive and rocky and had tons of lace; Searing hops in the nose advertising itself with no BS. Dry and floral to start. The alcohol is present- maybe too much so. Tons of dryness is attacking the palate- like Stone's Ruination, I can't drink anything after this one. Quickly becoming one of my fave breweries.
Slightly cloudy orange appearance.  Very hoppy, very typical.  An ok beer, but I guess if you want a beer with balance then you don't want an IPA, let alone and Imperial IPA.

Orangey, hazy body, good head formation. Citrus and apricot aroma, biscuity malt. Medium bodied, light carbonation. Mildly biscuity malt flavor, sweetnes as beer warms. Impressive orange/grapefruit citrus hop flavor and great bitterness and sourness in the finish that spreads out in the aftertaste.
A bitter, sappy green pine underpining and a resinous, deep hop flower aroma. Slightly chalky, dusty and dry; although high in alcohol content, this ale is easy to gulp.

Great orange color and very firm off-white head. there is some alcohol in the aroma, but nothing overwhelming.  the true power of the aroma is in the hoppiness.  The taste starts out sweet and mellow but then the hops hit and they never quit.  It is an all out assault on your taste buds.  The medium carbonation dies fairly quickly making this a fairly thick beer that will leave you with hop breath all day long.
only moderately hoppy compared with other IPAs I've had as of late.  flavors of alchohol and light malt - a fairly robust beer.  floral nose.  balanced on the dry side.  good beer.
Nice, but I've had better. Is hoppy, but not less so or more so than much else, leaving it kind of in the middle of the pack.
Clear amber.  Chewy, toasty crystal malt aroma.  Chewy, sticky taste with only a hint of citrusy hops.  Hrm.  The worst qualities of this brewery all in one glass.
I feel this is overrated. A good hopy taste, but not quite the IPA that it could be. A success, just not an amazing beer.
RateBeer Summer (Toronto) '02: Grapefruit/citrus nose, slightly cloudy orange body. Odd fizzy then flat palate.  I love over-the-top beers, but only liked this.

Very bright golden color with a big head that refuses to dissipate.  Holy shit!  Incredible strong dry hoppiness in the aroma.  The initial flavor was a bit more mellow than I expected but the hops come out strong in the finish.  Absolutely destructive effect on your palate, don't drink anything else for taste after this.

The head is white & frothy & the beer is cloudy, w/ a dark golden color. A nice hoppy flavor, but it's not as well balanced as some others I've had. You can definitely taste the alcohol; I prefer a beer where the alcohol flavor is hidden.
What I didn't like was that it did not have a very clean finish, as other IPA's I've tried do.

Lovely hazy orange appearance with a peachy pungence of (casscade?) hops in aroma and flavor.  A well balanced IPA that lacks the metallic or sour finish of many harsher IPA's.  Well crafted and enjoyably bitter with a moderate body/mouthfeel.

Bottle. Head is initially average sized, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting. Body is light amber. Aroma is lightly malty (cookie, toasted grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (apricot, peach, grapefruit, flowers). Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium to full body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately alcoholic. A pleasant, easy-going example...it’s definitely not aggressively hoppy in either nose or mouth, just some mild pleasant fruitiness (although I don’t know how old this sample is, maybe it’s just faded into softness?).  Low acidity and astringency, and very well-balanced, so it’s quite easy to quaff or sip as your mood dictates. Quite enjoyable and better than usual from this brewery.  Over the years this has always scored pretty well for me. Might just buy me a sixer of this soon.

This pours nice with a big long lasting frothy head that smells like complex hops and a hint of floral and fruit notes. It has a nice deep flavor with interesting cascade type hop finish. Seeing this was a "Maximus" IPA I was assuming it would surpass the hoppyness of their regular IPA... but it didn't. It seems to have more balance and more maltyness.

A cloudy amber color, the head a light tan, the lace in sheets that cling longingly to the glass. Nose "HOP Floral", citrusy, light hints of malts. Well the beginning is sweet, the top light to medium, the finish, is all "Hops", somewhat dry, a bit acidic, with that "Terrific Hop" bitter aftertaste. A magnificent beer from a top notch brewery.

Foam is very dense, rocky, and well retained atop an amber liquid.  Typical pine and orange aroma with whispers of grass, plastic, nutty malt, and some sort of tinginess. Strawberry shortcake also comes to my mind? This aroma is rather soft, similar to Stone's IPA.  Pale malt structure is well displayed in the middle. Tangerine finish and semi-aggressive bitterness make battle for what seems like minutes.  Nice hop burps, to boot.  Not a bad IPA, but this left me beckoning for a little more.  However, (I know this varies greatly from one IPA to the next), bitterness is much more pronounced at room temperature and the potential is more evident.
Bottle.  Wonderful deep golden hazy appearance.  Rather smooth and balanced for an IPA, almost creamy.  Hops galore!
Rather bitter, as an IPA should be, but overly so.  It's truly a hop-monster, but not for me.  72 IBU.

Hops all the way through. Citrus and floral hop aroma, very hoppy flavor, long bitter finish. IBU 72, OG 1.080 a big IPA, I just wish it had a little detectable malt. At the end of this bottle I didn't even want to think about hops anymore. medicinal.
I understand that an IPA is supposed to be hopppy and bitter but this shows no kind of balance. It doesn't take much skill to just dump a bunch of hops in the kettle.
Non-playin' West Coast Hop Monster. No finess, no balance. Just drink it....
